1.content:
On a privet jet soaring in the sky, four women were bickering. Little did they know that soon, they would have to fight for thier lives.

Kyrstal the athletic girl huffed, "Look. Once we get there, can we PLEASE stop fighting? It is getting very old." June the bookworm adjusted her narrow rectangular glasses, "I agree. It's mainly 'cause Amelia won't shut up about finding rare treasures. You know that nowadays, all the rare gems and stones have been found. So just drop it, you won't find anything where we're going."

Amelia the treasure hunter spat, "I don't care what you say, bookworm, i'm going to find a rare gem and sell it for a handsome ammout of cash. And no one is going to stop me!"

Suddenly, a meteor shower flooded the sky, and Keira the rocket mechanic said nervously, "Guys... I think one of those meteors is heading this WAY!!!" Seconds later, a meteor slammed into the jet, causing it to explode!

Days later, the four girls wake up on a tropical island, their clothes ripped to ribbons from the explosion, but none were hurt too badly.

Amelia stated, "Well, what do we have here? A tropical island? Sweet! I bet there is a ton of rare gems and stones here! Hahaha!" Krystal removed her shreaded shirt, revealing an ice blue bra, "I dunno, I get a sense of fear from this island, like something here that can turn us into meat."

Suddenly, a scarlet dragon flew above them, but didn't attack. June's jaw dropped, "This island is inhabited by... DRAGONS!!!" Keira moaned, holding her wrench, "But that's impossible... isn't it? I mean... Dragons don't exist... right?"

Suddenly, a spiritual dragon appeared before them, "So, you are the new ones on the island. If you wish to survive on this island, you must befriend a dragon and fight to live. If you become the Queen of Dragons, you will be rewarded for your efforts, and you will become the ruler of this land. But beware, many dragons, monsters, and other creatures would be willing to turn you into a healthy snack, so you must be alert. You will need weapons to survive, I wish you the best of luck." and it vanished.

Amelia laughed, "Hah! This will be a piece of cake! I will find the strongest dragon here, and soon, very soon, I will be a queen! Oh can life get any better?" June spoke up, tossing away her melted sneakers and socks, "Didn't you hear him? If we're not careful, we're dragon meat. We can't run headlong into this, we have to plan it out carefully." "Hah! Sounds like words from a coward. I'm going into the island and finding me a dragon, so I can be rid of you three. Ta-ta." She gave them a mock kiss and walked into the jungle. "She's dead." Krystal said simply.

Keira spoke up, "Well, she does have a point. Unless we get a dragon or two, we're sunk. Let's split up and see what we can find." The other girls nodded, and went their seperate ways.

Who will you follow?
1.title: Dragons Galor

choices: The Small Dragon Hisses And Attacks Her!
A Huge Dragon Suddenly Eats The Small One!
11.content:
Amelia walked into the jungle to start her quest for gems, riches, and possibly to become the Queen of Dragons. Unfortunately she wasn't very jungle wise so her remaining clothes were shredded by the thick undergrowth leaving her completely naked.

"That’s just great!" Amelia complained to no one. That’s when her eyes fell on a long and sharp stick. She decided to pick it up and begins to examine it. "Well, that dragon spirit thing said that we should get a weapon. I guess this will have to do." She says taking it with her. "Now all I need to do is find a dragon to tri... I mean befriend. But I need to find a really strong one."

At that moment the bushes in front of her started to shake as something started to move through them. Amelia lowered the point of her make shift spear in front of her as she prepared to defend herself. But to her surprise a 3 foot long blue scaled dragon emerged from the bushes. It had a thin snout with wide eyes, little tiny horns on top of its head and short feet that ended in four tiny claws.

"Ahhhh... aren’t you cute!" Amelia says as she reaches down and strokes the top of the small dragon's head.
11.title: Amelia In The Bush

111.content:
Amelia is completely taken by surprise when the small blue dragon hisses and lunges at her. She loses her grip on her spear as the dragon nocks her over and pins her to the ground.

Amelia stares in shock as the small blue dragon suddenly opens its mouth impossibly wide and engulfs her entire head. She then screams as the dragon's tongue works itself over her face getting a good taste of her. The tiny dragon then starts to swallow her down with very little trouble despite its small size. Its jaws seem capable of stretching to any size as it easily gets her shoulders and then later her hips into its throat. In a matter of minutes Amelia completely disappears into the body of the small dragon leaving it looking more like a scaled beach ball than a dragon.

Amelia lay curled up and sobbing in the extremely tight stomach as it slowly started to excrete digestive juices.

Outside the stomach the Dragon Spirit looked at the small rounded dragon and couldn't help but laugh.
111.title: What A Way To Go

choices: Follow the little blue dragon into the cave
Make a run for it over the salt flats
112.content:
The little blue dragon purred.

Amelia had to admit that the sound, not unlike a chainsaw cutting though jello, was a little disconcerting. Still, this was the first island inhabitant that she had met that appeared to want nothing more from her than a good stroking.

"What's your name, little one?" she asked. Blue eyes blinked back at her and the little dragon nuzzled her hand again.

She smiled and massaged a scaly ear. "You wouldn't happen to know where a girl could get a new set of clothes, would you boy?"

The little dragon blinked, scuttled back a few feet, and hissed at her. The dragon was small, but it flashed razor sharp fangs.

"Hey, I'm not asking for Calvin Klein or anything! Like a couple of sewn together leaves would do..." she quipped.

A twig snapped just behind her, and she felt hot breath on her naked back. Suddenly, she knew why the little blue dragon had hissed.

"There's something scary behind me, isn't there," she asked. The little blue dragon didn't bother to respond. Instead it turned about, bending sinuously in on itself, and took off running through the undergrowth.

Amelia would have liked to have taken the time to weight her options and make an informed, rational decision about whether to follow her newfound friend, but just then a deep gurgling roar echoed through the trees. In a heartbeat, she too was beating her way through the forest.

In the deserts of Kalimbad, while searching for the Jewel of Despair, she had gotten caught in a herd of charging rhinoceruses. She thought she had ran for her life then, but that was nothing compared to fleeing a blood thirsty dragon.

Terror gripped her, and she flew though bushes and leapt over fallen logs. Branches tore at her unprotected skin and soon she was covered in a network of small scratches. Up ahead, the forest began to thin, and suddenly she burst out from under the cover of the trees onto the edge of a salt flat.

A field of white sand, covered in fine salt dust stretched out before her. Behind, it sounded as if the pursuing dragon was simply charging through trees instead of going around. The sound of exploding timber was horrendous.

Seeing no other choice, she prepared herself for a dash across the salt flats when she heard a frantic chirping coming from her right. The little blue dragon was signaling her from the safety of a cave. The entrance was full of jagged rocks, but, if she squirmed, she might be able to fit.
112.title: Her little blue friend...

choices: Strike the Red Dragon's snout with a Jagged Rock
Follow the little Blue Dragon deeper into the cave
1121.content:
Amelia turned and made for the cave as fast as she could. "Jagged rocks be damned," she thought to herself, "ain't no way I'm gonna be a dragon burger!"

The red dragon burst out of the foliage and skidded to a stop on the edge of the salt falts. He was huge, all muscle and sinew. His scales glittered crimson in the light, and his eyes narrowed as he spotted the fleeing girl. Crouching like a cat, he bunched his hind legs and leapt into the air.

Amelia shot a quick look over one shoulder and nearly lost her balance when she saw the dragon hurtling towards her. She had no time! Jagged rocks crowded the cave mouth, and here she was without a stitch of clothing. It was going to be a hard landing...

Without hestitation, she closed her eyes and made a leap for the cave mouth. The little blue dragon chirped in terror and scurried deeper into the cave, just as Amelia landed--hard!

The red dragon was only seconds behind and a thunderous boom shook the cave as he collided head first with the mountain outside.

Now, my friends, we all know that dragons are tough creatures, but red dragons, in particular, have exceedingly thick skulls, and this one was no exception. He was dazed for no more than a minute, and when he regained his senses, he tore at the mountainside with sharp claws, digging his way towards the helpless, naked girl.

Amelia, bleeding from a deep gash in her thigh, struggled to pull herself further into the cave. All around her, jagged rocks bit into her flesh.

A dark shadow obscured the cave mouth, and the red's crimson snout pressed into the cavern, teeth snapping. Behind Amelia, the little blue dragon howled and scratched at Amelia's shoulder, trying to drag her further into darkness.
1121.title: Into the darkness....

11211.content:
Amelia ignores the little blue dragon's effort to get her to move further back into the cave as she grips the jagged rock in her hand and brings it down hard onto the snout of the red dragon that's sticking into the cave.

This turned out to be a very bad move as the red dragon's tongue suddenly shot out of its mouth and wrapped itself around her torso.

The tongue then draged her kicking and screaming into the red dragon's mouth where she is quickly swallowed. Amelia screams again as she slides down the dragon's moist throat before ploping into its soggy stomach.

Amelia spends the next 15 minutes sobbing to herself and slopping around in stomach goo before she finally sucombs. Amelia's remains soon liquify and continue to slop around in the red dragon's stomach for a while before she drains into the intestines. Her remains spend the next couple of hours slowly sliding through the beast's innards. Before long Amelia is nothing more than a large pile of fertilizer.
11211.title: The Red Dragon Gets Its Meal

choices: A large nest with a huge dragon in it
A piece of a strange crown
11212.content:
Amelia looks back at the red Dragon's snout that's sticking into the cave and decides that she wants to get as far away from it as she can. So she follows the little blue dragon deeper into the cave. The jagged rocks at the entrance soon becomes smooth rock as the blue dragon leads her deeper and deeper into the cave. The light soon begins to fade so Amelia puts one of her hands on the back of the blue dragon and lets it lead her.

They keep traveling for 15 minutes and Amelia begins to wonder if the dragon knows where he is going when the cave suddenly opens up into a large underground chamber that is illuminated by some strange glowing fungus.

Inside the large chamber is...
11212.title: Deeper Into The Cave

choices: Is the one I'm looking for. Thanks, and you may proceed.
Is not the one I'm looking for, too bad for you.
112121.content:
Amelia stood there, shocked. The little blue dragon appeared quite shocked as well. Amelia guessed that last time he came here, the rather large dragon in front of them had not been there.

Amelia tore her eyes off of the dragon for a bit to survey her surroundings. The nest looked new, some of the plants used to construct it were still green. Although it was kind of hard for her to tell, with the green light coming from the fungus on the walls. But one thing caught her eye... it was sunlight. They were close to the exit of the cave.

A low growl drew her attention to the problem at hand. If they wished to get to the exit, they had to get past the dragon guarding it. And he doesn't look too happy to have had his nap interrupted.

"I'm sorry..." She began, "We were running from another dragon, and we thought this cave was empty." She was about to say more, but an impatient clicking of teeth silenced her. The dragon moved it's head closer to the girl, sniffing her.

Amelia thought she was done for, but the little blue dragon she had befriended stepped into the conversation. It looked the big red dragon in the eyes, and started making noises. To Amelia's ears, nothing was understandable, asides from the tone the dragon had, which was an apologetic one.

To the dragon's ears, it sounded something like this... "Sorry to disturb your rest, but like the girl said, we were being chased by a rather large red dragon who wished to make a meal of the both of us." The large dragon growled, causing Amelia to panic slightly, but a sound which comforted the little blue dragon.

"Describe him for me? I think I may know who you're talking about... if that's him, then I'll let you go. He doesn't know about the back way out of this cave, and he'll wait at the entrance for a day or so for you two. I don't like him much, he's the one who gave me this." The dragon pointed to a scar on his shoulder, only recently healed. "So if it's him, I'll let you go for informing me as to where he is. I've been looking for him to, ah, return the favor, or so to speak."

The little blue dragon began to speak again, but the larger dragon cut him off. "Enough! The dragon you are describing..."
112121.title: Dragon Talk

choices: Amelia and the small blue dragon exit the cave
Amelia and the small blue dragon get lost in the cave
1121211.content:
"I know from what you've already said that the dragon you're describing is the one I'm looking for!" The large dragon said to the small blue dragon next to Amelia. The large dragon pointed towards the back of its cave and said to the small blue dragon, "The other way out of the cave is over there. Now if you excuse me I'm going to give that red dragon a guided tour of my stomach."

The large dragon then moved off towards the cave entrance where Amelia and the small blue dragon had entered from and where the large red dragon was still waiting.

Amelia still had no idea what the two dragons had talked about but it appeared that the large dragon in the cave wasn't going to eat her so she was grateful. She bent down and gave the small blue dragon a hug and said, "Oh, thank you!"

The small blue dragon temporarily became a small red dragon as it blushed. Amelia then followed the small blue dragon as it leads her towards the cave's second exit.
1121211.title: A Lucky Break

choices: They all sleep soundly through the night
11212111.content:
Amelia and her small blue companion followed the dimly lit passage. It gradually sloped up and before long they could feel a draft. Not long after that, they emerged out of a mountainside into a sunny clearing, about a hundred feet across, in what appeared to be a dense forest.

In the center of the clearing Amelia saw the other three girls she had left on the beach, sitting around a large black dragon, itself sitting down, his massive head towering twenty feet over the heads of her companions, with his tail curled up around his feet. His scales were black as night, and shimmered in the sunlight when he moved. His underbelly and the underside of his wings were tinged crimson, and she could see thin wisps of smoke rising from his nostrils.

The dragon seemed to be expecting her, as he looked straight at her and she heard him say in her mind, "Ah, welcome Amelia! I sensed you beneith the mountain. We've been waiting for you!" He turned his gaze to the small blue dragon that had come with Amelia, and again, spoke telepathically, "Thank you for bringing her here. You may go now."

The small blue dragon turned and walked off into the forest, leaving the girls alone with the large dragon.

"Oh, hi Amelia!" Krystal said excitedly. "This is Vermithrax. He came to us right after you left! He said he'd protect us from the other dragons here, and help us figure out which one of us was supposed to become the Queen of the Dragons!"

"That's right," Vermithrax thought at them. "I needed you all together first though. I am glad to see you survived your adventure under the mountain. We dragons have no society as you know it. I am somewhat of a sorcerer but, even my considerable influence is very limited here."

Keira interrupted, "Hey, now that we're all together, why don't we get with figuring out who the Queen of the Dragons is going to be?"

Vermithrax chuckled audibly. "Not so fast. The sun is going down, and it gets cold at night here. You should gather materials to build a fire, we will rest here tonight and continue our quest in the morning."

With that the girls began gathering sticks and branches from the nearby forest. Vermithrax dug a pit with his claws, and the girls threw their firewood in the pit. It wasn't pretty but it didn't need to be. After about an hour of work, as the sun was starting to set, they were quite sweaty but had gathered a large pile of tinder and branches. Vermithrax told them to stand back, and then he took a deep breath, and exhaled a stream of flame over the firewood. A roaring flame was kindled and the girls, still naked, sat around the fire to keep themselves warm.

Vermithrax coiled his great tail around the fire and behind the girls, who, being very tired at this point, found as comfortable positions as they could on the ground and fell fast asleep.
11212111.title: The Girls Reunited!

112121111.content:
Keira, however, could not seem to fall asleep. She had read so many stories about dragons, but that's all they were, were stories. But now, she was on an island with real dragons! The thought both exhilarating and terrifying at the same time.

She watched the sun go down, her guardian's scales shimmering with hues of red and orange, and then white as the moon rose. She lay on the ground but couldn't seem to fall asleep no matter what she did.

"You know, my senses are much keener than yours. You don't have to pretend to be asleep" Vermithrax spoke into her mind.

"Well, it's just.. I've never seen a real dragon before! I've read about them and made up stories about them but I never though they were... real", Keira whispered softly.

"This island is special. It's a sort of.. nexus if you will. Half in your world, and half in ours. We have always had contact, of a limited sort. Let us talk away from the others though. I wouldn't want to disturb them."

With that, Keira and Vermithrax walked to the far side of the clearing. She was amazed that something so big could move so silently. Vermithrax sat down, once again coiling his tail around himself, just in front of his fore claws. Keira shivered once she was away from the fire, it did indeed get cold on the island at night.

"Please, sit down," Vermithrax thought to her, motioning with his head toward his tail. She sat on his tail, facing him. Vermithrax folded his wings over her, and exhaled a stream of warm, slightly sweet smoke over her. Her chill faded away, and she found the scent quite pleasing.

"Better?" Vermithrax thought to her. "Yes, much!" Keira spoke quietly, and continued, "I've always been such a huge dragon fan. My friends always told me I was such a huge nerd, reading stories and collecting little sculptures. But now.. that I really met one... you I mean... I don't know, should I be excited or scared?"

Vermithrax chuckled softly, and pulled the end of his tail back and started slowly wrapping it around Keira's midsection. "Scared? Why?"

"Well... don't dragons normally eat people? Especially girls like us?" Keira said. She found the sensation of Vermithrax's scales against her skin, and the scent of his smoke strangely soothing. Vermithrax seemed to notice, and continued twining his tail around her. He exhaled a denser cloud of warm smoke over her; she inhaled deeply, surprised at how she didn't gag or cough. She began to feel slightly lightheaded.

"Yes, some of us do. But if I wanted to just eat you I could have done that any time I wanted to. Do you want me to eat you? Don't talk, just think, I can hear your thoughts just fine."

By now Keira was completely coiled up, her head and arms sticking up through the top of Vermithrax's twined tail. She felt so good, she just relaxed there in his coils. "I don't think it would be so bad. But I don't want to die just yet." Keira thought.

"I told you earlier, I am a sorcerer. If a lesser creature than I desires it, and I decide to grant their wish, I can assimilate their spirit. They become a part of me, in mind, body, and spirit. It is not death, merely a transformation." Vermithrax lowered his head down to Kieia's level. Keira reached out and scratched his eye ridge gently, and gazed into his mesmerizing eyes.

"You would do that for me?" she thought dreamily, thoroughly under the dragon's spell. Thick smoke began to waft from Vermithrax's nostrils, contributing to the dense cloud held around her by the dragon's enveloping wings.

"Actually, I would do better. My mate and I have a clutch of eggs at the moment. Since you have been a dragon-follower your whole life, even if you didn't know it, I will put your spirit in one of those eggs." Vermithrax thought to her.

Keira could actually feel the dragon's spirit around her now, pulling at her gently. Her senses began to blur, she saw Vermithrax with her eyes and herself with his eyes at the same time, her body felt warm and appealing inside of his coils. She was hungry, desirous, and merciful all at the same time. And she knew everything he knew and knew she wouldn't say no.

"Yes", they said together, their spirits and minds one. All that remained was to make them one in body. Together, they lowered his head, and slowly licked the female body that was soon to join them in their oneness. The salty taste of sweaty human flesh was so delicious, they hadn't tasted it in a long time, but they knew they had to be careful as the slightest amount of pain could break the trance.

They loosened their coils, and opened their mouth wide. Carefully grasping the body with their fore claws, they wrapped their tongue around it, and slowly pulled it in, savoring its taste with every moment. They tilted their head back, and gently swallowed, their massive head easily taking it down with one gulp.

Usually, the lesser creature's soul would be assimilated by Vermithrax's now.. but he had other plans for her. They pictured Vermithrax's nest in their minds, with a small clutch of eggs in the center. Keira's soul slowly disengaged from Vermithrax's, his own identity returning to him as he did so, and with a small, precise mental twist, he placed it within the egg.

Vermithrax snapped out of the trance and returned to reality. He silently flapped his wings to disperse the cloud of smoke beneath them, and silently padded back over to the remaining girls, still fast asleep, not yet aware anything had happened. As Vermithrax lay down to sleep himself, he wondered how he was going to explain it to them. He knew everything Keira knew, but wasn't sure he should just come out and tell them.. and least not yet.
112121111.title: The End for Keira

1121211111.content:
Vermithrax roused the girls as the sun rose the next morning. "Come, we have much to do today!" he mentally prodded. The girls groggily struggled to their feet.

"I have rocks in my hair! Is there anyplace we can clean.. hey, where's Keira?" Krystal said.

"We had a talk last night. She was quite enamored with me, and, after we had talked a while she revealed she wanted to be a dragon herself. So, I took her spirit and placed it in one of my eggs. Now, there's a stream not far from here in the forest, I'll take you there."

With that he strode off into the forest. The girls followed, talking amongst themselves about who would be the Queen of the Dragons, and what they would say when they saw Keira in her new body, and other things. While they were walking, they heard many menacing noises coming from the forest, nothing approached them. Soon, they reached a small stream.

"Finally!" Krystal said, and she and the others jumped in, and began cleaning the dirt and grime that had accumulated on them from the previous day's exertions.

"So, what are we going to be doing today?" June asked.

"Today we are going to go to the top of the mountain in the center of the island, where, with any luck, we will find out which of you will be the next queen. Now come." Vermithrax said as he lowered his head to the ground, beckoning them with a fore claw.

The girls took the invitation and climbed up onto Vermithrax's back, positioning themselves between the three-foot spines. After they were all mounted, Vermithrax took to the air, his powerful wing beats carrying them quickly to great heights, and he angled toward the mountain when they were even with its top.

While they were flying, June asked, "Why does one of us need to be the Queen of Dragons, anyway? Why is there even such a Queen?"

"This island is a sort of portal, a nexus between the world of humans and the world of dragons. But the rift is not natural, it must be held open. Only one who is both human and dragon can do this, and that person is the Queen of the Dragons.. of this island at least. But nobody lives forever, the old QUeen died some time ago, and without a new Queen this island will sever itself from both worlds and drift in limbo. That is why one of you must become the new Queen."

Vermithrax angled in a lazy descending glide. They were over the top of the mountain now, and they could see a small marble building with a large, paved plaza in front of it below them.

It wasn't long at all before they landed. The girls hopped off the dragon's back, and looked at the building, which was definitely a lot larger looking from the ground. It looked like some sort of temple, easily a hundred yards square. A large patio about ten yards wide was in front, its overhanging roof supported by great marble pillars with statues of dragons twining around them. A large, imposing entrance about twenty feet high by forty wide stood before them, leading into a dimly lit chamber inside.

"Inside you will find the means to become the Queen of Dragons. I can not go inside or offer guidance beyond this point, save to say that only the new Queen will return from inside. I do not know what will become of the others, but, I can offer you a life of sorts on the island if you choose not to go inside" Vermithrax thought to them.

"Why can't we just go home?" Amelia asked.

"You can't. The connection to your world has already been severed. There is nothing in this world except this island, and it will remain as such until one of you becomes the new Queen" the dragon answered.

Krystal turned and faced the entrance. "Nothing ventured, nothing gained!" she said as she walked inside. June shook her head and followed.
1121211111.title: A Mysterious Temple

11212111111.content:
Vermithrax watched as Amelia followed the others into the temple. He was a bit disappointed, he had hoped to have another one of the girls for himself. Perhaps he still would.

Inside the temple the girls paused as their eyes adjusted to the gloom. The inside of the temple seemed to be one giant, bare room. A large circular pool, about ninety yards across, dominated most of the room. In the center of the pool, on a small island, stood a small statue of a sitting dragon, which held a brightly glowing orb in its jaws, which provided most of the illumination for the room.

The girls looked around a bit.

"I think that's what we're supposed to get," Krystal said, pointing at the orb.

"Yeah, but how are we supposed to get there? I am NOT going in that water, it looks nasty!" June replied. Amelia contented herself to try and look around the dark edges of the pool, perhaps there was another way to it.

Krystal was undettered and began wading into the pool. "I was a champ swimmer in high school! I can handle a little dirty water. It's not like we're not filthy already."

Amelia and June watched as Krystal carefully worked her way toward the center. She was about fifteen yards out, in water up to her chest when she suddenly stumbled, saying, "Hey, I just bumped into something, and..."

Her voice trailed off as the water in front of Krystal began to churn, then roil as a huge serpent thrust up out of the pool. It looked to be about a foot in girth, with a wide, crested head and a long fin running its muck-encrusted length. Amelia and June backed against the wall as it rose about fifteen feet out of the water in front of Krystal, blocking their view of the orb.

Krystal stood absolutely still, barely even breathing, hoping that the creature somehow would not notice her. It lazily flicked its tongue out, and slowly rotated its eyes until it was looking straight at Krystal. She looked back, into those alien eyes, and suddenly lost her nerve and tried to frantically back toward the entrance.

The creature merely hissed, and then struck with lightning speed, biting her shoulder and lifting her out of the water. She screamed as she ascended, and as soon as her feet were clear of the dark water the creature rapidly spun her around, and she vanished into a writhing mass of coils.

June and Amelia could only watch as Krystal's screams were muffled, and then silenced as the creature squeezed her tightly. A moment later, its head emerged from the mass of coils, and Krystal moaned weakly as the coils loosened a bit and shifted, revealing Krystal's barely conscious head and shoulders, the left of which was bleeding freely, dark drops of blood dripping into the gloomy water.

The serpent fixed its predatory gaze on Krystal, and its tongue flicked again over her face and hair. It began to visibly salivate in anticipation, and opened its mouth wide and took her head into its mouth, face down, tongue against her face. Thick drool flowed over her bleeding shoulder and breasts as it swallowed, her head causing a visible bulge appear in its throat.

It stopped at her shoulders, as it considered how to pass this wide obstacle. It held her there for several minutes, shifting more of her out of its coils, letting the drool dribble down to her waist, and then shook her gently as it unhinged its jaws and pushed, getting her right, then left shoulders in, and swallowed again, its throat expanding into an almost lurid outline of the still weakly struggling Krystal.

Another push and swallow, and her drool-covered breasts disappeared into the beast's throat. Globs of spittle began to dribble over her box, and onto the serpent's coils around her legs before finally falling into water, the splashes sounding deafening to Amelia and June in the silence. It uncoiled her completely as it pushed forward again, her rump facing up in the serpent's mouth as her barely-kicking legs hung outside its mouth.

It hissed as drool filled her crack and dribbled down her legs, and swallowed again, her knees in its mouth, the rest of her clearly visible in the enormously bulging throat, which resembled a skin-tight snake suit at this point. It turned to face Amelia and June, seeming to show off its prey, before lifting her legs into the air and swallowing again, leaving only her twitching, glistening feet visible in the back of its mouth.

The serpent closed its mouth, and Krystal slowly descended down its length and passed out of view beneath the surface of the pool. It flicked its tongue at Amelia and June, and then slowly lowered back into the water.

The remaining girls stood in shock for a few minutes, before June finally exclaimed, "I am SO not going in there!"

"We don't have to. There's a bridge in the back." Amelia said, pointing to a narrow path leading to the island on the far side of the room, barely visible in the near-darkness.

"I'm still not going in there! Did you see what happened to Krystal? That thing... ATE... her!" June said, still unsatisfied.

"Well one of us has to take the orb, or we're all going to end up on the menu!" said Amelia, who began to walk around to the back of the pool, toward the bridge.
11212111111.title: Into the temple!

112121111111.content:
"You're insane!" cried June, as Amelia slowly made her way across the narrow bridge, which was barely six inches across. "I'll be alright, I've raided temples way more dangerous than this!" she replied back to June, even though she wasn't quite as sure about the last part.

Still, though, Amelia held her fear in check as she continued across, ever mindful of the giant serpent which could still be seen swimming in the water, the bulge in its belly a reminder of what would happen to her if she fell in. Slowly, one foot in front of the other, she continued, and, after what seemed like an eternity but was really only a few minutes she stood on a small marble platform in the center of the pool.

She looked at the statue. It could be trapped. She knew from her previous treasure hunting experiences that valuable treasures usually were. But then again, this treasure was meant for her, she was supposed to take it. It wouldn't make any sense to trap it.

"What are you waiting for? Take it!" cried June from across the pool, interrupting Amelia's train of thought.

"I'm not sure, it might be trapped," she replied, still trying to make up her mind.

"There's only one way to find out. If you don't take it, I'll come over there and do it," June yelled back to her.

Amelia looked at the brightly glowing orb, held tightly in the statue's jaws. There was, indeed, only one way to find out.

She wrapped her arms around the orb, and pulled. Slowly, it began to slide loose, grating over stone teeth as it slowly came free...
112121111111.title: A Trap?

choices: June tries her luck with the orb.
1121211111111.content:
With a sudden snap, the orb came free. Amelia stumbled backward a few steps, and the serpent's head broke the surface, mouth open in anticipation of another meal.

Amelia, however, caught herself at the last moment, and avoided falling into the water. She regarded the large orb cradled in her arms, its warm glowing seeming to draw her in. So complete was her attention that she didn't notice the stone dragon blink, and become animate.

"Amelia! Watch out!" June cried. Amelia blinked and looked up, just in time to see the dragon snap at the orb, snatching it and one of her hands into its mouth with lightning speed.

She tried to pull her hand free, but the dragon held it fast. It seemed to regard her with amused interest as she wriggled and jerked on her trapped hand. Amelia quickly realized she wasn't getting anywhere, and then stood there and looked back at the dragon.

"Um.. let go, please," Amelia said, and added in a somewhat hopeful tone, "Please?"

The dragon seemed to smile, and responded by pulling her arm in up to her elbow. Amelia shrieked and began to struggle in panic, to which the dragon responded by biting down just hard enough to draw a single drop of blood, and gently shook his head.

Amelia took the hint and relaxed, and the dragon pulled her in up to her shoulder, her hand and arm now inside the dragon's throat. Despite it's stony appearance it seemed flesh on the inside, wet, warm, and strangely inviting.

"June! Get out of here! There must be another way!" she shouted, waving emphatically with her free arm as the dragon opened it's stoney maw wide and descended over her head.

June however did not run away, once again frozen in place as she watched another of her friends be devoured. The dragon pushed forward, and Amelia's shoulders slipped into his mouth as her head joined her arm in the dragon's throat. It lifted her up into the air, until her legs dangled above the beast's head, and it swallowed again, taking in her entire torso in one swallow, seeming to grunt with effort as its neck swelled tremendously as its new prey passed through.

It shook its massive head as it swallowed again, her body disappearing into the dragon up to her calves. The dragon licked a bit at the petite feet dangling outside its mouth, seeming to save the taste as it pulled her all the way in. June watched as it slowly closed its mouth and swallowed again, and the bulge in its neck passed down down into its body and disappeared.

The stone dragon relaxed, then looked at June, seeming to almost beckon her. She remained in place at the edge of the chamber however, and after a few minutes the dragon returned to its original spot, and coughed violently a few times. Another bulge, this time coming up, appeared in its throat, followed by the orb reappearing in the dragon's mouth. It sat down, holding the orb between its teeth, and once again appeared to be only a statue.
1121211111111.title: A trap!

11212111111111.content: June shook her head, thinking to herself, "No! No way am I going to try that," before turning and heading back outside.
11212111111111.title: Backpedaling

112121111111111.content:
June could smell the dragon's distinctive sweet-yet-smokey breath well before she could see him, and sure enough as she emerged into the blinding sunlight Vermithrax was right where the girls had left him, lying on his side sunning his belly.

He saw her come out and sat up, thinking to her, "I see you have returned. But you have not become the Dragon Queen, and you are alone."

She ran frantically to him. "Krystal and Amelia.. both.. eaten!" she shrieked.

Vermithrax exhaled over her. "Breathe deep, little one, and relax."

She did breathe deep, and did her best to calm down, the dragon's smoke pacifying her. Vermithrax folded a wing around her, as she finally mustered enough composure to tell the story of what had transpired in the temple.

A few minutes later she finished. Vermithrax thought to her, "Well, with your friends, you must understand that that is the way of this island - to eat, or be eaten. As for you, you have emerged from the temple, but have failed to become the Queen..."
112121111111111.title: At the mercy of the dragon

choices: Look around outside for a powerful host to inhabit.
1121211111111111.content:
"Come with me. I will use my magic to assist you," Vermithrax thought to her.

He leads her to the center of the courtyard, to the center of a large amphitheater-like bowl, where an ancient stone altar sits, its stone blackened by soot.

"What is this place?" June asked.

"A very special place. Here, the people who lived on this island long ago would gather to worship us. On this altar we would accept whatever they wished to offer us - food, gems, and their bodies and souls. The energy that still resides here will allow me to give you a powerful blessing."

June looked at the altar, and then at Vermithrax.

"You want me to get on that? Are you going to eat me?" she asked, a little apprehension working its way through the smoke-induced calm.

He smiled, and exhaled over once more. "Though I have blessed many thousands by allowing their spirits to become one with my own, and would happily grant you this blessing, you must still become the Queen. But where I will send your spirit, your body can not follow. Now please, lay on the altar."

June felt a little lightheaded from the smoke, it was very relaxing, and she thought if the dragon simply wanted to eat her he could have done that at any time. Besides, what choice did she have?

With that thought, she walked up to the altar and laid down upon it. It was oddly warm and despite being solid rock was not uncomfortable.

Vermithrax thought to her, "Now relax, and breathe deeply."

He began to chant vocally in a language June did not understand, and as he did so thick, black smoke billowed from his mouth and nostrils. In the still air of the amphitheater, it did not disperse and soon filled it with a gradually thickening haze. June soon found herself feeling deeply relaxed and peaceful as she breathed in his draconic essence, and after a few minutes he paused, inhaled deeply himself, and exhaled a voluminous cloud of thick, black smoke directly over her.

She breathed in as the smoke blocked out her sight of everything, surprised that she did not gag or cough, it felt as natural as breathing air. Vermithrax began to chant faster and louder, she found herself craving his smokey essence, breathing deeply and quickly herself, each breath expelling smoke as if she was a dragon herself.

The ritual reached its climax as Vermithrax reared back on his hind legs, emitting an ear-splitting roar as he expelled a jet of white-hot flame over the altar, it's flames splashing over the edge and singing the ground. June felt no pain however, only a sensation of warmth as her flesh disintegrated instantly, her bones lasting only a little longer beneath the gout of dragon's fire.

For what seemed like an eternity, but in reality only for a few seconds Vermithrax doused June with flame, the dense smoke filling the amphitheater. Finally, he stopped, and though June's body was completely gone, her spirit could clearly be seen, a human outline of the dragon's smoke and fire.

Vermithrax sat up before the altar, and wrapped June carefully with his wings, and began to chant again. June found herself lifting into the air, still feeling nothing but a warm calm as the dragon stopped chanting, and opened his mouth. She floated toward, and then into his waiting maw. He closed his mouth, and as he did so June felt herself begin to fade, and as she did so, felt the dragon's body, as if it were her own.

Slowly normal thought returned to her as Vermithrax padded softly out of the amphitheater into fresh air.

"What.. happened?" asked June, realizing as she did so she was speaking through the dragon's mouth.

"Just think, little one.. it is all that is necessary," Vermithrax thought back to her. "The magic I have infused your spirit with will allow you to become any creature that eats you for one day. But unlike right now, you will not share the body for that day, you will have full use it."

"Um.. OK" she thought, a little confused. "But what happens after that one day?"

"You will sleep, and wake in your human body. But there are a couple of limitations," he thought back to her.

"Oh.. what are those?" she asked.

"First, to become the Dragon Queen, you must take the orb while in your human form. And second, the magic is less effective on dragons. I can only guarantee that you will be able to possess the first three dragons that consume you. After that your spirits will commingle, and you may not be able to separate who is dragon and who is human - if that happens you will not be able to return to your human body and will remain in whatever form you inhabit for the rest of your life."

"As for today however, we will share this body. Come - I will show you what a dragon's life is like!" he thought, and she sensed he was in fact eager to do so.

With that, June spent the rest of the day learning to fly, to breathe smoke and fire, the thrill of the hunt, the satisfying feeling of having a belly full of prey, the sight of the impressive hoard of treasure in Vermithrax's nest, and many other things. But, eventually, the sun hung low in the sky, and she felt suddenly very tired.

"Yes.. now sleep, and when you awaken continue your quest to become the Dragon Queen. I will not be able to aid you further, but I am sure you will succeed," Vermithrax thought to her, as she nodded off.

...

The next morning, June found herself back in her own body outside the temple. A little unsure of what to do next, she decided to...
1121211111111111.title: June's Blessing

choices: She stops to get a drink of water first.
She heads back to the temple.
11212111111111112.content:
"Well, I'd be best off seeing what I can find out here, before I go back in there. Maybe if I can get rid of that snake and dragon, I can just pick the orb up!" she thought, as she started down a path into the jungle and down the mountain.

She hadn't gone far, maybe a mile or so, when, as she was crossing a clearing in the forest, she heard the beat of leathery wings, and looked up just in time to see a large (though not as large as Vermithrax) red dragon land in front of her. It looked to be about forty feet from snout to tail, and it was solid, bright red color.

"Oh.. are you lost?" the dragon asked her.

"You can talk?" asked June, a little surprised to hear him speaking verbally.

"Of course I can talk - though it takes a little of my magic to let you understand me. I was flying down to the lake, and saw you all alone. You must be lost to be here," the dragon said to June.

"Well, yes. I guess I am a bit lost," said June, not quite sure what the dragon was up to, but having a hunch it was going to involve her ending up in his stomach, which, given what Vermithrax had done earlier, wouldn't be a bad outcome.

"You're in luck then - I happen to know of a nice, warm, place that I'm sure you be perfect in! Would you like to see it?" the dragon asked, smiling wickedly at her.

"Um.. sure," said June.

"Excellent! I'm glad we both agree that you would be much better off in my stomach," the dragon replied, as it suddenly lunged at her.

June, surprised by the sudden movement, stepped back, and stumbled, grunting as she fell on her stomach. The dragon wasted no time, snatching her up by her rear into his jaws.

She was bent double, and even though she was quite flexible it was a bit uncomfortable to have her head suddenly shoved between her legs. Her legs flailed around outside the dragon's mouth, and she instinctively grabbed hold of its lips with her hands as she tried to pull herself, at least into a more comfortable position.

The dragon, however, would have none of it and simply pulled her backwards, and swallowed, and she felt his throat bulge around her rear as it swallowed. Her hands lost their grip and her feet were all that remained outside his maw. He swallowed again, and she felt the throat slipping around her back and thighs as she was drawn all the way in. Another swallow, and she felt herself sliding down his tight throat, before finally coming to rest in his stomach.

"There - nice and warm, and rather comfortable, for both of us I think," the dragon said to her. "Now relax, and you may find the experience rather enjoyable."

The dragon swallowed a gulp of air for her, and she did find that the dragon's juices only caused a feeling of warmth, even as her new body's skin was turning to goo. She did relax, and before long passed out.

...

She awoke, after what seemed like only a moment. She felt rather pleasantly full, and noticed that she was in the red dragon's body. Fortunately, after being with Vermithrax the day before it only took her a few moments to get accustomed to it. She was also very thirsty, but knew she should be getting back to the temple, she only had a day to use this body and who knew what the dragon would do when it realized his body had been possessed by its food.
11212111111111112.title: June Gets Into a Red Dragon

choices: "I AM giving you a life on this island... a short one... as my meal."
"Very well, I'll give you a life on this island... as my slave."
1121211111111112.content:
Vermithrax pulled June up against the side of his big scaly belly with one of his wings as he thought to her, "Well, with your friends, you must understand, that is the way of this island - to eat, or be eaten. As for you, you have emerged from the temple, but have failed to become the Queen so according to our laws you must be eaten."

June gasped and tried to push away from the dragon, but his wing kept her firmly in place against his belly. June struggled and shouted, "No! I-I'll go back in the temple and try again!"

Vermithrax breathed his strange calming smoke over her, but she was too afraid for it to have much of an effect. The dragon shook his head, "I'm sorry little one, but it is only possible for someone to enter the temple once. After that, it is impossible for them to ever find it again."

June looked at the temple and to her surprise she saw that it had vanished. Despite her panic, the dragon's smoke was slowly starting to have an effect on her. She felt dizzy, but struggled to resist it as she wailed, "I don't want to be eaten!"

"Of course not, little one. I would say that this will hurt me more than it will hurt you, but that would be a lie, because I know that I'm going to enjoy this." Vermithrax chuckled as he breathed another huge lungful of his smoke on her. He used his wing to prevent most of the smoke from escaping so she would be forced to keep breathing it in.

"You said you would give us a comfortable life on this island if we didn't become the Dragon Queen..." June muttered as she fought a losing battle against the calming effect of the smoke.

Vermithrax replied...
1121211111111112.title: June Fails

11212111111111121.content:
"Well, had you become the Dragon Queen, you could have done anything you wanted. But, you have failed. You should be thankful that I will be kinder to you than most," the dragon replied, before releasing her from his wing.

She stumbled a few steps before collapsing onto the ground, and Vermithrax began to lick her, savoring her taste. She found herself suddenly becoming aroused as he worked her breasts, and then lower.

"Oh!" she moaned. "What are you doing?"

"Drawing out your juices. Human females are so tasty you know."

He grinned evilly as he began probing about inside her, expertly thrusting the forked tip of his tongue deeply inside of his prey. June moaned as she suddenly came, her juices gushing out onto the waiting tongue.

Between the intoxicating smoke and the dragon's attentions he found herself helpless grinding against his tongue, grabbing it with her hands and pulling it deeper into her. She scarcely noticed as the dragon's huge maw engulfed her, the tongue wrapping around her even as it probed ever deeper inside of her.

Soon her moans become louder and more urgent, as the dragon drove her to climax again, and again, and again. Soon she was completely covered with a mixture of the dragon's saliva and her own juices as the dragon, impossibly, continued to drive her to heights she had never known even existed.

Finally, after thirty minutes of almost nonstop orgasm, she tired, and the dragon withdrew. The tongue loosened its coils around her, and she felt that huge head tipping back, and she slid easily into the dragon's waiting gullet. He swallowed, and she felt the throat contract around her, and push her down, down towards her final destiny. Once in his stomach, she felt an odd sense of peacefulness come over her, as she finally passed out, and then slowly liquefied.

Vermithrax was glad to have another of the girls. It would be another hundred years before the planes would align again, and he would have a chance at such a meal again. Besides, with any luck one of them would succeed in becoming the Dragon Queen.
11212111111111121.title: Lunch with the Dragon

11212111111111122.content: He gave her a life as his slave but she wanted to get away from them so when the dragon was asleep June ran through the jungle until she could run no more. She sat down to rest for a little bit. Just then June heard a noise in the bushes right beside her. She jumped hoping that it was not another dragon. A long silver dragon stepped out from the bushes and saw June. The dragon was female and wanted June for..
11212111111111122.title: June runs away

112121111111112.content:
June emerged back into the courtyard outside the temple, blinking several times as her eyes adjusted to the blinding light of the sun.

"Vermithrax? Where are you?" she called out, but the black dragon was nowhere to be seen.

Not having anything else really in mind that she could do, she decided to set about finding some shelter. Perhaps a nice cave, or even a spot on the beach free of all the predators that seemed to roam the island at will would do, at least until she could find something to defend herself with against the dragon guarding the orb in the temple would do. It would only take a day, maybe two at the most.

Still determined to become the Dragon Queen, she strode off into the jungle, but had barely gone out of sight of the temple when she felt a sharp, piercing pain in her left leg.

"Ow!" she cried out, and looked down to see a very large cobra, easily the size of a large anaconda, with its fangs sunk deeply into her thigh. She struck at the serpent with her fists, and it withdrew, hissed, and slithered into the shadows, but the damage was already done.

June shrieked as the strength left her legs and she collapsed onto the ground, a slow paralysis slowly creeping its way up her body. "No! Not like this!" she sobbed, and then began to suck on the wound, spewing her own blood on the ground trying to stop the poison, but it was no use. Soon her strength faded entirely and she collapsed again, able to feel and breathe but totally unable to move.

She could only watch, helpless and terrified, as the cobra slithered out of the underbrush toward her. It flicked its forked tongue over breasts and neck, its smooth scales feeling cool against her flush skin. It dove under her, lazily wrapping a coil around her midsection as it flicked its tongue, tasting her legs, then her calves, and then finally tasting the soles of her feet before opening its mouth wide and engulfing first her left, then right feet.

The snake's inner teeth alternately tickled and vaguely pricked her skin as the cobra slowly worked its way up her legs. As it pushed up over her box and rump, the fear and panic left her, and June felt oddly at ease with the whole situation, glad that at least it would be over soon. She was just a naked girl, on an island where humans were obviously nothing more than food, this was her natural place here. Besides, the inside of the snake felt wet and cool, very good against her skin.

The cobra bulged enormously as it took in its meal, wiggling its head a bit to get her hands in with a proficiency that belied previous experience with consuming human food. June liked the bulge, it revealed her contours very nicely, and while it lasted at least the snake wouldn't be hungry. The snake was happy too, it didn't get to eat such sumptuous prey very often, especially warm, still-breathing prey.

It pushed over her breasts, and neck, and for a moment she looked into its eyes, and in that moment, locked in pose as predator and prey, she completely surrendered herself to it, and closed her eyes as the snake slipped in the rest of her. She was surprised as she did not pass out immediately as she passed down into the snake's stomach. "The venom must have slowed my metabolism," she thought as she felt the snake slithering away, the bumps in the ground cushioned by the tube of muscle around her.

Eventually the cobra's movements slowed and stopped, and as it rested she felt the fluid around her become warm and it started stinging her skin as it began to liquefy her as she gradually passed from awareness, and then this world.

The dragon spirit looked on as it digested its latest meal and thought, "How sad, that she would come so close just to fail. Now we must wait another hundred years for the planes to align again - perhaps then a true Dragon Queen will come to our island."
112121111111112.title: June's Failure

choices: "Give your virginity to the dragon statue and the orb is yours."
11212111111112.content:
June looked at the statue of the dragon with the orb in its mouth. It had come alive and gobbled down Amelia when she pulled the orb out of its mouth. It now looked like a normal statue again and was even posed in the exact same way that it was before. The only difference was that it now had a bulging belly. June swore she could see the faint outline of Amelia.

June trembled fearfully as she wondered what she should do. This island was extremely dangerous. She was the last one left and even she would be gone soon if she didn't become the Dragon Queen. But to do that she had to get the orb out of the mouth of the statue. She walked across the narrow bridge over the water until she was on the small island in the center standing in front of the statue.

The eyes of the dragon statue looked down at her and even with the orb in its mouth the corners of its mouth turned upwards in a small smile. June trembled in fear, but was relieved when the dragon statue didn't make any other movements. With a flash of inspiration, June realized that the dragon would only try to eat her if she took the orb from its mouth like Amelia did.

The statue just kept smiling at her almost as if it was saying, "Go ahead and try. There's still plenty of room in my belly for you."

"There must be some solution." June muttered to herself as she closely examined the statue and the big stone pedestal that it was on.

She discovered words engraved on the pedestal and read them…
11212111111112.title: June tries her luck with the orb.

choices: Pulls out the orb, and offers herself to the dragon.
Notices the orb is showing her something.
112121111111121.content:
June read the inscription, a little puzzled as to how she would accomplish this task, not just with a dragon but with a dragon that seemed to content to sit inanimate unless it was eating people.

"Well, mostly inanimate," she thought as she saw the bulge in its belly wiggle slightly. She hoped Amelia wasn't suffering but there was nothing June could do for her now.

Still wondering what to do, June stood before the statue and...
112121111111121.title: An odd task

1121211111111212.content:
As June pondered what to do, she noticed the orb's white glow had subsided, and something could be seen within in.

She looked into the orb, and saw a small, featureless room made of the same ancient marble as the temple. As she considered it she felt herself being pulled forward, and before she could do anything she tipped over and toppled headfirst into the orb.

She yelped in pain as her head hit the bare floor, but wasn't seriously hurt. She stood up and looked around, and found she was in the room she had just seen in the orb - somehow its magic must have brought her here. A single stone arch lead into a dark passage away from the room.

June saw that the room seemed safe enough, so she examined it very thoroughly, trying to figure out exactly where she was.
1121211111111212.title: Teleported!

choices: She sees something off in the distance
She stumbles around in the dark
11212111111112122.content:
June saw a faint glint of bronze from beneath a thick layer of ancient moss on the wall away from the arch, and proceeded to scrape and brush it away, until it could be read. To her amazement it was in English!

"This is the Dragon's Labyrinth. Here, you must master the Dragon's Essence, Strength, Fire, and Wisdom, if you are to become the Queen. If you should fail, only the Dragon's endless hunger awaits you..."

She took it in, thinking, "The Essence, Strength, Fire, and Wisdom must be things in here I have to find."

She turned around and looked into the darkness of the passage. "How will I ever find them though? This place is completely dark except for right here!"
11212111111112122.title: A strange place and a stranger task

112121111111121221.content:
Far down the dark corridor, June could see some light. She didn't know what it was but it was the only thing to go to in this place, so she strode forward into the darkness, hoping nothing would grab her.

Though she could feel a presence the entire way, she walked unmolested through the dark corridor for what seemed like forever until she arrived in a large, octagonal room. Dark passages led out of the room on her left and right sides, and the wall in front of her was dominated by a large pool of some glowing liquid that was the source of the illumination, being fed in through a dragon's head fountain mounted on the wall. On the wall behind it was an engraving of two serpentine dragons, both breathing some kind of liquid at the fountain, so that it seemed like the fountain was splasing their breath into the pool.

June ponders what to do, and..
112121111111121221.title: A magic pool

choices: She goes right, around the corner
She goes left, and tries to fly over the chasm
1121211111111212211.content:
"Well.. this must be where the Essence is, or maybe Fire," June thought to herself, as she looked at the engravings on the wall.

She kneeled down before the pool and scooped up a small cup of the oddly glowing water with her hands, and drank. She felt its power instantly go into her, and suddenly she was more thirsty than she'd ever been before in her life.

She got down on her hands and knees, sticking her face into the water and drinking it in huge, thirsty gulps. She drank and drank and drank, only becoming even more thirsty, scarcely noticing in her thirst that her hands and feet has sprouted claws and her skin was darkening and turning to scales.

As more of the water's power flowed into her as she continued to guzzle it by the gallon, her fingers grew shorter, her arms longer as they become forelegs. Her new scales grew in entirely, black as the dungeon around her, and her head began to change shape. Her mouth pushed out into a muzzle, her hair was absorbed into her body, horns and a crest sprouted from it, as well as wings from her back and she felt a tail began to push it's way out behind her.

Still she drank, and her wings grew in fully, as did her tail. Spines erupted from her back, and she began to grow larger.

Finally, however, her thirst subsided, and soon she found herself licking the last drops out of the pool with her new forked tongue. She looked around with a certain sense of wonder, thinking, "That was definitely Essence. I took the dragon's Essence into myself, and, well, I'm certainly rather dragon-looking now."

She noticed she could clearly see down the passages now. To her right the passage went around a corner after about another hundred yards, to her left she could see a chasm but she thought she may be able to glide over it with her new wings.
1121211111111212211.title: Essence

choices: Tries to bash through the pile
11212111111112122111.content:
June padded down the corridor, able to see clearly even in the near-total darkness. After about a hundred yards, the ancient marble passage rounded a corner and after another twenty yards or so she found herself in another large, octagonal room, its only exit blocked by a jumble of a wooden logs.

June examined her new surroundings. The walls here were not moss-covered as they were in the passage and room she had just come from - rather they blackened, as if from fire. The floor of the room had a large engraving of a flying dragon, its mouth open and breathing fire in the direction of the logs blocking the passage. Directly above its mouth a large crimson flame flickered, roughly three feet across, with no visible source.

The new dragon considered her situation, and...
11212111111112122111.title: Another Strange Room

choices: June is surprised when the flame dragon releases her tail... and starts flirting
The flame dragon takes the tip of her tail and puts it in its mouth
112121111111121221111.content:
The new dragon considered her situation and laughed confidently, "That flimsy wooden barrier can't stand in my way! I'm a dragon now!"

She charged at the barrier and rammed it head on... only to discover that it was much sturdier than she thought it was. June's large dragon head hit the wooden logs, but the only thing she managed to accomplish was giving herself a huge headache.

"Ow!" June moaned as she shook her head trying to clear away the stars.

That's when June heard something behind her. She gasped in surprise and quickly turned around. Her jaw dropped as she saw another dragon several times her size towering over her. The most alarming thing about the huge dragon was the fact that it's body was literally made out of crimson flames. June looked around and saw that the strange floating ball of fire that was in the room a moment ago had disappeared. It must have transformed into this fire dragon.

The flaming dragon gazed down at her with eyes that looked like two smoldering embers. June looked around nervously and spotted the passageway she had entered from. She immediately started running for it on her four powerful legs. She was about seven feet away from the passageway when something large and heavy slammed down on her lizard-like tail pinning her in place.

June looked behind her and had to fight down her rising panic when she saw that the flame dragon had placed one of its taloned paws on her tail like a cat catching a fleeing mouse. Strangely enough its flaming paw wasn't burning her, but she had no doubt that this strange dragon's stomach acids would burn her.
112121111111121221111.title: The Flame Dragon

1121211111111212211112.content:
The flame dragon lifted its massive foreclaw slightly and grabbed hold of June's tail, lifting it up and placing the tip of it in his mouth, and slowly started pulling her in, reeling in her tail as if it was a long piece of spaghetti. June tried to run but the much larger flame dragon effortlessly held her in place, and her powerful dragon legs simply paddled in place against the floor.

She could only watch her tail, still visible through the flames of the dragon, slide down its throat as she was lifted off the floor entirely by the huge flaming beast. Her rear entered the dragon's maw just as her tail slid down into his belly and she began to feel his heat.

As her legs were pushed forward against her sides as she was pulled helplessly in, she craned her head around on her massive, serpentine neck and saw she was literally disintegrating - half her tail was already gone, with the rest, the part feeling the full warmth of the dragon, gradually disintegrating and catching fire as it passed further into his belly, until it became indistinguishable from the dragon's flames. She realized in horror she was being digested just as she was being swallowed, and frantically tried to grab hold of something with her foreclaws and mouth, still dangling outside the fire dragon's jaws.

But it was to no avail as the fire dragon, being much larger than her, simply continued to pull her in. 112121111121.content:
Krystal and June paused once inside the entry, both to wait for Amelia and to let their eyes adjust to the low light. As they acclimated to the gloom, they could see they were in the entryway for a long disused, ancient temple of some sort. The large chamber they were in had a high ceiling, easily twenty feet, and statues of dragons, gryphons, and snakes lined the walls. They could see remnants of ancient artwork painted upon the walls, but it was in too poor of condition to make much out.

They waited silently for about ten minutes. "I guess she's not coming" said Krystal, who continued, "Let's move on then."

Nervously, they walked across the marble floor. Another large, dark opening awaited them once they reached the far side; two large, twenty foot tall doors, which appeared to be made of bronze, which had long since been removed from their hinges lay in front of the door. They couldn't see much further ahead, but there was no other way to go.
112121111121.title: Journey Through the Dar

1121211111211.content:
They pushed ahead into the darkness ahead of them, holding hands so as not to get separated.

"I feel a wall on both sides of me," said Krystal, holding both her hands out. "I think we're in a hallway, and.. ow!" she exclaimed as she bumped into wall. "I think it goes around a corner here," said June, who was carefully feeling her way along behind Krystal.

They turned, and saw that the hallway ended a few feet in front of them. A large hole in the left wall illuminated a chamber about thirty feet wide and sixty long. In the center of the wall in the far end of the room they could see a great sculpture of a dragon's head and open maw, carved from a single block of marble. A passage led away behind it.

The room's contents had been rearranged, along with a fair number of added bits of cloth and various twigs, into a large nest for a pair of large gryphons, and their eggs, which rested in the center of the room. Strewn about the room outside the nest were countless, unidentifiable bones.

"They seem to be asleep," noted June, who added, "We need to get across to that passage back there."

"No way! What if they wake up?" said Krystal, who was thinking that maybe Amelia had made the smarter choice by staying outside.

"Well, we have to try. There's no other way!" June countered, and then began to carefully tiptoe her way quietly across the room. Krystal watched worriedly, knowing that without any weapons or any dragons to protect them there was no way they could defend themselves against the gryphons should they wake up.

After a few minutes of careful sneaking, she made it to the maw-shaped portal on the other side of the room. June turned and faced Krystal, silently gesturing her to make her way across. Krystal crossed her fingers for good luck, and slowly began making her way across.

Carefully she tiptoed across the room, being very cautious not to make any noises. Even so, when she was about halfway across, she inadvertently stepped on a small piece of bone. It made a quiet, almost inaudible crushing sound as she put her weight on it.

Kyrstal stopped cold, hoping the small noise would go undetected, but it was no use. The larger of the two gryphons opened one eye, and fixed his gaze upon the intruder in their nest. Krystal saw the gryphon awaken, and took off running for June as fast as she could. The gryphon jumped to its feet with surprising agility, and let out a deafening, falcon-like screech.

She sprinted for all she was worth toward June, while the gryphon behind her pounced, its beak opening wide as it descended toward her. She was only a couple of feet from safety when the gryphon struck home, taking her head inside its beak and lifting her up off the ground. Krystal shrieked in terror, and June grabbed on to her ankles, trying to pull her out of the beast.

The gryphon merely shook Krystal a bit, knocking June loose. June scrambled back for the cover of the passage as the gryphon's mate, roused by the commotion, also pounced at her. She could only watch at the gryphon sat up and lifted Krystal about five feet into the air, still flailing helplessly in the beak of the creature.

The gryphon licked Krystal's face with its birdlike tongue, and made a pecking motion as it swallowed. Her arms were forced to her sides as the gryphon's beak advanced to her breasts, which one hung one on each side of its beak. Her head disappeared down the gryphon's throat, which began to bulge slightly as it cut off her shrieks.

In the sudden, eerie silence, the beast held her there for a moment, then made another pecking motion, taking her in up to her midsection. Her hands, just outside its beak, clenched and grabbed in vain, and the gryphon's neck bulged out more, clearly showing her shapely, wriggling outline. It raised its head, lifting her kicking legs high into the air, until they were almost brushing the ceiling, and made yet another pecking motion, this time taking her in all the way to her knees.

June could see Krystal still struggling inside the gryphon's extremely swollen throat. The gryphon, however, didn't seem bothered by this at all as it simply pecked into the air again, this time taking in all but her feet, her toes still wriggling in the air. It pecked again, and then even those were gone. June watched, and saw the gryphon finally close its beak as the bulge that had been Krystal descended into its belly and disappeared.

The gryphon sat there for a moment, seeming to enjoy the feeling of its wriggling prey inside it, before giving June a disinterested look and returning to its nest. Its mate followed, and they both laid down and went back to sleep.

June knew she was all alone now, and there was only one way she could go.
1121211111211.title: Krystal Verses the Gryphons

11212111112111.content:
June walked down the passage and once again found herself shrouded in total darkness. She felt her way along the walls, glad they were smooth at least, and she found the passage narrowed and curved sinuously about. After about fifty feet or so she was brushing the walls with her shoulders, and she hoped it wouldn't narrow any further or she might have trouble getting through.

However, it wasn't more than another twenty feet or so before the narrow corridor finally opened up into another chamber. And what a chamber it was! It was circular, easily a hundred feet in diameter, and looked as though it took up most of the building she was in. A brightly glowing globe some three feet across was mounted to the ceiling in the exact center of the room, and provided illumination, and five dragon statues of various colors, life size, stood spaced evenly around the room, reared up on their hind legs with their mouths pointed toward a six-foot by two-foot altar directly under the glowing orb.

She wasn't quite sure what to do, so she cautiously approached the altar. When she reached it she saw there was a human-shaped indentation on the altar, as well as a small pile of soft cloth where the head should go.

"Well... I guess this is it!" she said to herself, and then climbed up on the altar and lay down on it, resting her head on the soft cloths.

Immediately, the eyes of all the dragon statues began to glow. She saw the yellow dragon's mouth spark and crackle, and then yelped in pain as a bolt of lightning shot from the blue maw and arced over her body. Her skin charred instantly, and then vaporized, revealing a new covering of shimmering, prismatic scales.

June caught her breath, and started to lift her head to see what was going. Before she had even raised it an inch, however, the green dragon's mouth began to drip, and then spray a torrent of acid over her. It sizzled and pitted the stone of the floor and the altar, but did not harm her. It soothed her still smarting scales, and she found she was suddenly more thirsty than she had ever been in her life. She drank and drank and drank, and she felt it burning terribly inside her as it ate away her human organs. She felt strange inside as new, draconic organs instantly grew in their place.

The joints on her arms reversed and they lengthened, and her legs grew stronger as well. June felt uncomfortable as wings began to sprout from her back and a tail grown from her spine, and she turned herself over, lying down on all fours on her belly. Her neck lengthened, and her head reoriented itself as it sprouted horns and her mouth extended into a long, slender snout. She dug her new claws into the stone as spines sprouted from her back, and after a few minutes the stream stopped. Thoroughly exhausted the new, small dragon collapsed onto the altar, just wanting to rest.

But the process was not complete. Fire danced from the red dragon's muzzle, and then shot over and into her. She felt her own fire kindle as thin wisps of smoke began to trail from her nostrils, and a desire more powerful than anything she had ever known took hold over her. She moaned as she struggled to her feet and presented her hindquarters to the red station. Fire surged into her new sex and filled her entire being, and she roared in ecstasy and the flame took hold of her. With each immense orgasm she belched a huge gout of fire and grew larger, two or three feet each time.

Finally, after a dozen climaxes, the statue's flame died out. Now thirty-five feet long and larger than the statues themselves, June ripped the altar out of the floor and tossed it aside. Completely spent from the bizzare passion, she lay down, hoping at last to rest.

She lay on the marred stone floor, and as she did so the black dragon statue's snout began to emit a stream of smoke over her. She found its scent pleasing and breathed it deeply into her draconic lungs, and as she did so she felt her human instincts and emotions leave her. She was a huntress, the Queen of an island of predators. She desired treasure, and to consume all who were not worthy of her regal self.

After several minutes, the black dragon stopped smoking, and the air cleared. She was now the Queen of the dragons, but the process was still not complete. The blue dragon statue began to stream water over her. She found the sensation of water on her scales relaxing, and lay down in the stream, washing the bits of her previous self that were still clinging to her away. As she did so, she felt the knowledge, the spirits, the very essences of the previous queens enter into her, become one with her. She absorbed them all, retaining her own identity but acquiring the memories, thoughts, knowledge, and magic of those who had come before her.

Finally, it was done. All the statues were again silent, and the new Queen of the Dragons stood up, and shook herself. With a small mental twist, she teleported herself outside of the temple, ready to take up her duties. She needed to reestablish the rift, she needed a mate, but all that could wait, she just wanted to make a nest first, and rest for a little while.
11212111112111.title: June's Transfiguration

1121211111212.content:
Krystal and June pushed ahead into the darkness. Carefully feeling their way, they found that they were in a pitch black hallway.

"I wish we had a flashlight or something!" complained June as she stubbed her toe on a piece of broken tile.

"Well, we have to make do with what he have.. which is nothing," replied Krystal. "Oh, I feel another wall here, and a doorway to the left," she added.

They carefully made their way around the corner, and found themselves in a small, bare, circular room, about twenty feet across. A single shaft of light streaming down through a small hole in the roof provided some dim illumination, but after their time in the dark hallway it seemed as bright as daylight. Another doorway led onward on the far side of the room, and on the floor, in the center of the beam of light, a small, blue dragon was sunning itself.

"Hey, isn't that the dragon Amelia was with earlier?" asked Krystal. "I think it is," replied June.

The dragon turned its head toward them, then stood and stretched, looking not unlike a large, scaled cat as it dug its fore claws into the floor and opened its mouth in a wide yawn, and then shook itself and stood there, looking at the girls, who were still standing in the doorway.

"Well, it seems friendly enough. And it was with Amelia earlier," Krystal said as she walked out into the room towards the dragon. It nosed and licked her hand, and she beckoned to June, saying "See, its friendly enough. Come on, we still have to figure out how to become the Dragon Queen."

June cautiously walked into the room, and as she did so, they felt the floor shake, and stone slabs fell down behind both doors, hitting the ground with a thunderous crash and kicking up broken pieces of tile.

"Oh great, now what?" Krystal said. June tried to lift the slab behind her, but it was no use. "It won't budge, we need to find another way out it seems" said June.

Krystal turned to try her luck with the slab at the far end of the room. She did her best to lift it, grunting with the exertion. Behind her, she heard June say "Hey, I think he likes me, and, hey! Down boy!". She turned as he heard June let out a tiny "Oof!".
