they walked over to buddy who haddent noticed them yet kystal put her finger to her lips and crept up on him. When shevwas there she shouted "Buddy did you just steal something" he jumped turned around to find her laughing her head off. He said "errrr great joke your hiness" kystal said "I've told you just call me krystal all my servents can" he said "thanks krystal" he saw ameila. And his face lit up "Amelia is that you it can't be I saw you het eaten by..." he saw amy "HER" amelia smiled "so you name is buddy long time no see" don't worry I'm safe.. It's a long story" Buddy was nearly shouting "I thought you died I'm so glad you are ok oh thanks you" he litrarly kissed her. " oh sorry but I'm so happy I can't believe it" amelia said "I can't aswell so how did you get to be here" he said " well when I thought I lost you I diddnt know what to do so I ran into the forest and was crying, then I ran straight into kystal and a dragon, the dragon was about to eat me when I said 'Amelia I'm sorry', kystal saved me and I helped her and well here I am"

After hours of talking amy said "amelia you out off time" amelia sighed and said "sorry guys" Buddy said "will we see you again?" amelia replyed "yes you will" and started getting in amys mouth. "by the way have you seen anyone else?" kystal said well Junes been spotted but our last friend got eaten 24 years ago June is now at the east end of the island." then amy swollowed her makeing Buddy sqweak as he had a flashback.
1121211221121121.title: Yes

choices: Amelia flies back to their den
1121211221121122.content:
"Amy." Her master said after a moment's pause.
"Yes?"
"Only one of you would have had to become queen of the realm, even if the others survived, they would undoubtedly have been eaten or killed by the other creatures or the dragon queen herself."
Amelia looked down, a tear forming...
"Would you rather we visit the dragon queen tomorrow? So we can use this day to practice your wings?" Amy suggested, rather nervously.
Amelia nodded..
"I understand..."

The second day arrived, Amy was confident in Amelia's flight sessions, and was about to give her flight...
"Are you ready?"
"No..." Amelia backed a bit away from the ledge they stood on.
"Remember what I taught you..."
Amelia spread her wings, jumped, beat, and was airborne.
In an instant, her fears of height left her, she felt anew and embraced the currents and soared...
Amy followed suit as she glided...


It was noon when they arrived at the dragon's castle.
Vermithrax greeded Amy and looked almost longingly at Amelia who, by impulse of fear, backed behind her.
"I see you've got an off-spring?" He asked.
"Yes."
"What of your servant?"
"She has been faithful."
"Oh, I see." Was that regret? "What of her?"
"Her life is to be forgotten."
"Ah."
"We are here to greed our Empress."
"Ah, she would want to see you, I'm sure." He looked hungrily over Amelia once again.
"Stay close..." Amy whispered.

A shimmering form perched atop a dragon statue looked down with green glowing eyes, golden horns embued with the history of the dragon queens of old gave her a beauty unrivalled by any on the island and beyond.
She was enormous.
Amy bowed, and following suit so has Amelia.
Vermithrax approached the dragon and said what needed to be said, and the dragon got up and jumped in front of them making a little quake.
Amelia quaked and fell before the majesty. The head was three times the size of Amy's... and even Amy fell.
Yet, it was a gentle voice that rang out.

"What is it you desire of me?"
Amy spoke before even Amelia could.
"My Queen, I bring before you Amelia, whom were a friend of yours."
"Amelia? Ha-ha... Good to see you!"
"So it is, you..."
"What brings you here?"
"I missed my old friends."
"Oh... I see. It's longing." The great dragon resumed back to her perch. "Do you know who I am?"
Amy shook her head. Amelia spoke.
"No."
"It's June. They call me Junifioth here. It's been how long?"
"Thirty years."
"That long?"
"Yes. It's good to see you June!"
"I'm surprised to see you though. You say longing brought you here. I'm sorry, Amelia."
"Why?"
"Krystal was devoured by me, and Keira disappeared some time before I even came to be deemed worthy of the title. I've heard rumours of her being by the coast, and even that is two weeks' worth of flight from here. Too long for me to be sure."
"You ate Krystal!?"
"Unfortunately, it's the ways of the dragon kin. Vermithrax became my advisor since he aided me through to here."

A silence followed.
Amy was the first to speak.
"Queen?"
"Yes?"
"Which direction does she lie?"
"I've last heard of her location three years ago, I doubt she's still there, but it lies in the direction of the rising sun."
"Thank you, my Queen."
"You're welcome, it was good to see you again, Amelia."
Amelia managed to give a weak smile, and nodded.

Outside, Amy comforted her.
"It's always been this way..."
"I don't believe it." And took off.
She was hurt, she was sad.
Why?
1121211221121122.title: Overruled

11212112211211222.content: The flight was quick, but the coast was empty. "Perhaps she is gone" Ameilia said before a large object caught her eye. "what is this?" her eyes fell on 2 large sets of dragon armour and 3 sets of 2 swords, which were all tied together with runes enscribed on the ropes. Ameilia walked up and examined the runes, one of them said 'when the 7 are together, nothing shall stand'. However, the runes on the blades were the most interesting, where they all had something inscribed on them, they were; fear, courage, fire, and ice. Ameilia looked at the 2 longest blades and one read 'light' but the other one was in a different set of runes. She backed up, and tripped over a rope. turning around, she saw that she...
11212112211211222.title: Amelia heads towards the coast

112121122112112221.content:
The world went dark around the blades, and it seemed as if whatever the blades had on them, was forming people inbetween the blades, when the blades floated up, and cast off the ropes, setting off a reaction which started summoning sand to the 2 sets of armour. after a minute the blades were being carried by several people, which were Krystal, Keira, and someone who Ameilia hadnt seen since the plane was hit. "Damn... that didnt turn out so well" Krystal said, possibly just coming back from the dead.

"Consider yourself lucky i convinced you to weild fire and ice" said the man, who Ameilia remembered as Scott.

"Well, dying isnt fun anyway"

"Actually, the only reason im back here was because of some stupid dragon who goes by the name of Verthimax, banished me into the realm of humans, where i was shot up into peices. Do you have any idea how much that hurt!?!?" Scott shouted.

"Cant be worse than being eaten alive by a friend"

"Way worse than dying peacefully" Keira said.

The 2 sets of armour stood up, revealling them to be very serpentine dragons. a few roars later, scott started hissing like a snake to the dragons, and they started hissing back.

"I... I thought you were all dead!?" Ameilia screamed.

"We were, but only temporarily, now lets bring you back..." Keira said, pointing Fear and Courage at her, which shot a light out and hit her in the head. When Ameilia opened her eyes, she was human again.

"Now lets go, we have to get you Water and Air" Scott said as he walked away, wings coming from his back along with his hands turning into a dragons, with 6 inch claws. Ameilia was so stunned she din't even notice he had a tail.
112121122112112221.title: cut it

1121211221122.content:
"Don't worry about her, little one. Once I eat you, you will belong to me instead." Vermithrax sat up and folded his wings around Amelia, and exhaled a dense cloud of smoke over her.

Amelia was surprised that she could easily breathe it. She found the swirling vapors intoxicating and began to feel quite giddy. "Come, be with your friends. Surrender yourself to me."

"Well... I guess," said Amelia. By now she was feeling faint, and began to fall backwards. Vermithrax swiftly caught her in his jaws, her entire body easily fitting inside that massive mouth. She felt his tongue massage her body, turning her on more than just a little bit.

"Come then, be one with me." Vermithrax thought to her as he swallowed. She felt the familiar passage down a dragon's throat, though Vermithrax's throat wasn't nearly as tight as Amy's. She hit the stomach, and felt the tingle of his stomach acids, but instead of passing out she simply felt the sensation of him digesting her fade away, and she had the sensation of floating in space.

She felt blissful, but a bit confused. "What is happening?" she thought.

"You are becoming one with me," the dragon thought back to her. "Think my thoughts, feel my great body. Become me," he thought to her.

She felt herself becoming aware of the dragon's body as if it were her own. She could feel the dragon's thoughts inside her mind, urging her to relax, and as she did so she gradually became less aware of herself and more aware of the dragon, until nothing of her own mind remained.

Vermithrax broke his trance, and found a quite annoyed young red dragoness standing in front of him.

"That girl was MINE!" she hissed, furious.

"Well, perhaps you should have kept a closer eye on her. Is it not better for the humans anyway? They live such a wretched existence. I give them the greatest blessing they could imagine, you know."

"How are we supposed to get up there", Amelia moaned.
"Patience, you lack such an aspect"
Then Buddy jumped against the tree, sunk his claws into it and started climbing. Soon he disappeared into the ever green. Amelia moaned, she started thinking Buddy just left her. Suddenly, a branch grabbed around Amelia. She screamed and tried to shake herself off, but the branch just pulled her up into the pine needles. They stung Amelia, she was panicing and screaming even more. Then the branch let her go and she found herself on a very thick branch staring into the eyes of Buddy.
"Control in fear you lack as well", Buddy added.
11212122212112.title: The journey continues

112121222121121.content:
Amelia fell asleep right infront of Buddy. The next morning she woke up to see Buddy and two other similar dragons except that one was sapphire colored when the other was violet. The sapphire colored one sniffed Amelia. Then it walked away as did the violet one.
"Don't worry", Buddy said,"Their just alittle unsure about you.
Amelia sat up. She realized she her bed was a branch which was full of soft pine needles.
"What's going on?" Amelia asked,"First I find my self infront of a tree, the next moment I'm grabbed by this tree and then I'm here."
"Calm down, calm down", Buddy shushed,"This is where I live, there is no safer place on this island. This tree is ancient and has seen thousands of years. It is the king of this forest. All the plants and trees here are under its control. It mostly stays out of others buisness, but in imergancies it can do terrible things. It protects us and we in the other hand help it. The reason I was so far out in the island is that this tree requirs once a millenia a drop of a certain kind of water. Now eat," Buddy handed Amelia some fruit,"This tree provides many things."
"Why aren't the two others you're with so sure about me", Amelia asked.
"Well... they...,"Buddy hesitated," they fear you will mess everything up with your lack of patience, control of fear and other aspects which makes us so good in stealth. I asked the tree and it believes you can learn these things. It will teach you. Infact, it wants to begin trainning now. Buddy moved aside and the branch Amelia sat on currled around her waist. Then it pulled Amelia even higher into the ever green. Amelia struggled, she was panicing. Soon the tree wrapped Amelia completely out of sight. Amelia started to get visions, they felt really. In one vision she saw Buddy being ripped up. Amelia screamed, she wanted to get out, but couldn't. Then Amelia saw Krystal running towards the dragon crown. Amelia stressed and started running too, but she tripped, saw her opponent grab the crown. Then many dragons cheered. Leaving Amelia lying on the floor. Amelia panic again. This was when the tree let her go and placed her back on the giant branch next to Buddy. Buddy just looked at her, sighed and walked away.

The next month or two continued the same way. Starting with the tree giving her visions and ending with Buddy's sigh. On day was different, however. When Amelia woke up the tree didn't pick her up, but there was Buddy with a happy gleam on his face. He announced...
112121222121121.title: Onward

1121212221211211.content:
Buddy announced,"You have not passed the training. Fear and greed have a strong hold on you."
"Then why are you smiling", Amelia asked insulted.
"Because the tree has given me permission to eat you."
"But... how, you can't. You are only three quarters of my size."
"Oh, don't fall prey to fact and science..."
Suddenly, the tree started swishing thin branches over Amelia. Amelia got all disy from the swirling, but when she came back to her senses, she realized something had changed. Everything was so big. The tree... had shrunken her. She looked up at Buddy. Amelia was a bug in his eyes.
"But Buddy... I thought you cared about me", Amelia muttered.
"We are, I just don't mind having you as a little snack. Besides, after I digest you, you'll be part of me. Because you didn't pass the tests the tree set upon you, you wouldn't survive much longer once you leave this tree. I could protect you for some time, but patients doesn't work well with impatients.

Buddy lay on his side next to Amelia. He then wrapped his wing around her and pulled her towards his belly. Next, he started rubbing her against it. Amelia felt good. Buddy had after all done a lot for her so why not her pleas him this time. Buddy's stomach growled. Amelia knew it was begining for her. Finally, Buddy picked Amelia up by the legs in his foreclaw and lifted her over his snout. Then he slowly openned it and dangled Amelia over it. She got a good view of his mouth, the last thing she would acually see. Buddy brought his tongue towards Amelia. He gave her a small lick.
"You taste suprisingly good", Buddy said.
He started licking her all over. He tore off the nice pants and shirt he had made himself for her. All this time Amelia was enjoying it. She licked the feeling of Buddy's tongue dragging against her tiny body. Buddy's stomach growled even harder now.
"Are you ready?" Buddy asked.
"I guess so", Amelia answered.
Buddy brought her slowly down towards his waiting mouth. Amelia could see his throat ready fro the swallow. Amelia was now inside Buddy's mouth and he let go. Amelia dropped into his throat and he swallowed a loud gulp. Amelia slid down into Buddy's stomach where she splashed around in the gastric juice and thought happily to herself that she had pleased the only friend she had on this island.

The dragon spirit chatted with the tree. The dragon spirit said,"It was unfortunate for her to be a treasure hunter, though she had skill, her gread for treasure made her weak."
The answered,"I knew all along that she would fail. I wanted to reward the blue one though, for fetching me the water. I knew he'd enjoy her as a snack."
1121212221211211.title: Amelia didn't succeed the training

1121212221211212.content:
Buddy announced,"The tree wants to congradulate you. You have passed the tests it has set upon you. Greed and fear were both strong inside you, but you have fought against both of them and defeated them. I apoligize for my lack of support during this time, but the tree banned all of us from giving any support and comfort for you. And...", Buddy looked around a little, then he whispered,"I haven't left you."
The tree formed a heart above the two. The two other dragons who had been spying, started laughing.
"You two... go to hell!"
The tree formed a cover over Amelia and Buddy.

The next day Buddy came to Amelia and said,"Because you understand the meaning of stealth we all grant you this cloak. It is a very special cloak which will turn into the color of your surroundings, wherever you are. It is called "the cape of the evergreen"
Amelia took the cloak, it was a complete dress, it covered the torso and legs, it had a face cover to it along with a hood and a large cape which could cover her completely.
"Here you see a pair of shoes which, believe it or not come from your world. They are enchanted with a most useful spell, they make you run faster and jump higher."
Amelia stared at the pair for it looked exactly as a normal hiking shoe pair.
"This amulet keeps you calm in the most horrible moments where even we start panicing, wear it all the time. And finally, the tree personally wants to give you this bow. The tree carved it out of its own self. It is very powerful and will cause fear to the enemies around you. You are only granted ten arrows for this weapon for violence it an unecassery aspect in our lives because we sneak past the enemy with ease anyway."
Amelia took these gifts and said,"Should I leave right away?"
1121212221211212.title: Gifts of success

11212122212112122.content:
"No, stay there. Your quest is to become dragon queen isn't it", Buddy said.
"Yes... atleast thats what I started with", Amelia replied.
"I wish to be your companion. If I understood correct, you must have a male companion. There is something the tree wants you to know. It gives you the name of Ranger of the Evergreen Oak"
Suddenly, the tree grabbed Amelia and pulled her up to the top. Amelia had a wonderful view.
"I see you have befriended a dragon"
Amelia turned her head and saw the dragon spirit.
"You have been given some very special gifts. They are unique, so take good care of them."
"Is this the whole island?" Amelia asked.
"No, no... it's only a small part. This island is about the size of the place your kind call Africa."
"How..."
"Nobody has ever found this place because it is the gate between your world and the dragon world. From both sides, creatures have entered by accident. Unfortunatly, those from your world are in grave danger because the dragon world has a lot more powerful creatures. However, if your kind and the dragons find a permenant entry way, this place could turn into a bloody battle ground. The strength of dragons and the weaponary of your kind are an equal match. This tree, The Evergreen Oak as it is called, though it has no less trates as any other tree. Me at it are one of the guardians of the island. The Evergreen Oak looks over all the living creatures when I make sure the portals that open, close."

"Why don't all these creatures leave, don't you allow them?"

"There hasn't been a dragon queen for two and a half centuries. Without one, portals open randomly and not even I can predict them. When a dragon queen is crowned, she then holds the portals shut and can open one whenever she wants. Most the dragon queens have been weak and have not been able to hold this island in order. They either go mad or meet their fate in some kind of revolt."

"But... why don't you help them"

"The most I can do is give them small pieces of advice and give the a starting push like I'm giving you. My job is in the stars. The Evergreen Oak has its job with nature. Beware, however, there are evil powers here also that wish only destruction to the worlds which these islands keep together. If a spirit or supernatural thing offers its help to get you on the throne, reject. Now you must continue your journey, however. Your companion is waiting for you."

With those words the tree placed Amelia to the ground, next to Buddy. They started off. Buddy no longer lead. Amelia had to find the way. At first she felt uneasy about choosing the direction, but then she remembered what she had heard in a movie "If you can't find the way, then no one can".

After some travelling, they reached the root of the mountain. There was a cave entrance. It was also possible to climb up the mountain. The Evergreen Oak and Dragon Spirit had somehow gotten their hands on mountain climbing aquipment.

Amelia sighed deeply. She could feel the imminent peril weighing down on her, like she was about to become a prop skeleton in an adventure movie, but something in the little blue dragon's eyes told her that she really was meant to take it.

"Alright." She started, pointing down at the little blue dragon, "You'd better be right about this." Her little friend cooed happily in response.

Amelia stepped back towards the pedestal, cautiously eyeing it up and down, searching for any suspicious grooves or cracks in the carved stone. She took a closer look at the pedestal itself, realizing there was some sort of illustration adorning it. Amelia could recognize what appeared to be a group of dragons, some big, some small, gathered around a massive crown. There appeared to be other markings, and perhaps a written inscription, but the light was too dim to make out much else. Amelia ran her fingers around the base of the pedestal, testing to see if it was part of some pressure-activated mechanism. After another minute groping the dusty stone floor and squinting at what seemed to be draconic hieroglyphics, a chirp came from behind her. She turned her head, the small blue dragon looking at her expectedly.

"Look, you can't blame me for being careful, okay? I've told you already, I know what these ancient temples are like." The little dragon rolled his eyes, grumbling. Amelia scoffed, "Okay, fine, I get it! You want me to do it, I'll do it! Here goes..!"

Amelia stood, hovering her hand above the pedestal, trembling slightly. She closed her eyes, held her breath, snatched the crown piece, and then...

Amelia is horrified. She is trapped in the big dragon's belly, which is wet with what has to be stomach acid. So far there is not even a tingle from the stomach acid, but that is sure to change, and get worse and worse until ... She is indeed horrified, and with good reason.

But not panicked.

Born the only girl in a family of roisterous and daring brothers, her choices had pretty much been to be the little glass princess, pampered and highly protected from the least danger, but not allowed off the shelf, or be a tomboy, willing to try any fool stunt her insane brothers might think was fun, which usually meant dangerous. For reasons she can no longer recall [& currently thinks quite inadequate], she became the tomboy. This had produced her loud insistence that she could so do anything the boys could do, and plenty of situations where failure was... not an option. If she had not learned long ago to look for every way to get out of disasters, she wouldn't have survived, ... to be in this disaster.

But how is she to get out of this one? All she has are her hands and ... that stick she picked up. She had been eaten too fast to even have a chance to drop it.
So what good is it going to do? Stab the big dragon a bit and make it regret digesting her? Enough wounds and it might even die from infection or something. That would be a victory, but a distinctly costly one for her. She would be digested before it died.
But what if she stabbed it in the heart? ... It would die quick, and she might be able to struggle her way back up that throat to freedom. ... Lots of ways the idea could fail. Too many to list in fact, but it might work. And one chance in a million is the best she has anyway.

It has to be tried.

But maybe she can still do it... Stick into top of stomach and push with the legs... Yes, that could work, but it has got to be done just right. A stab into the lungs or elsewhere won't kill fast enough to save her. And she won't get a 2nd chance either. That stick will be jammed in too far for her to pull back while crammed in this stomach. Well, have to try anyway...

Stick into stomach wall...feet on top...pu...!@#$ the thing wobbles too much. Got to get better guidance, but how? ...

Grabbing forward and pulling the little dragon back to her, Amelia says "Little guy, you had better be way smarter than I think or we both are so dead...
"You see this stick. You have got to grab it, put your paws on it, yes, like that. Now you have got to aim it at this big lug's heart.
"Let's see... Your heart and stomach are here, and here. His should be about a foot directly behind the end of the stomach. You listen for the heartbeat and then make sure the stick is pointed directly to that heart. You got that?"

The answering whimper could mean anything, but Amelia has to hope it means yes. "Okay, now down to my feet you go." And she starts pushing and squeezing to get the little dragon to the other end of the stomach.

It's encouraging that the little dragon seems to be trying to get to the right position, and that it is holding onto the stick, maybe in the right position. Plenty of chance this is accident, but it might be working...

"Ready?" The answering whimper sounds sorta the same as the previous one, and Amelia has to hope it does mean yes. "OK, hold it steady, because this is our only chance..."
And she starts pushing with both feet.

How much later Amelia wakes, she has no idea. But the dragon is still now, very still. Has she done it? Is the dragon dead? It would seem so.

But this does not save her. No more acid is being produced and she is not going to die quick, but dying slowly is not a clear improvement. She must still get out of here.

The obvious way is the throat, and to do that, she needs to turn around, a task that proves difficult, but doable now that the stomach muscles have relaxed.

Clutching the little dragon, Amelia shoves her head, and then the rest of her into the long throat and starts to climb up. Thankfully the muscles that normally push food down are now relaxed, but it is still a tight fit, made even tighter by having to carry the dragon.
But it is just a tight fit, and the throat walls are flexible enough. Not like some of those stone caves she had to squeeze thru when her brothers thought cave exploration was a good idea. There, she really came close to being stuck. And the throat sees to be open all the way out, so while the air smells terrible, it is air.
Now comes the mouth itself, and while it has a border that is tougher to enlarge, now the little dragon can simply be pushed in first and she can then squeeze thru. Then getting past the teeth to the outside is almost a breeze.

As she wipes off some of the sweat, the little dragon wakes and whimpers at her. Amelia bends down to comfort it, but can do little more. It's a definite break and only staying off that leg for a long time will cure it.

"Yes."

"And I suppose I can only have this little dragon, whose leg is broken to boot."

"Oh you can have any number of dragons. But only the first is absolutely loyal to you and will always try to help you. The later ones may, or may not. You saw that when you made friends with the red dragon. He liked you, but liked dinner more."

"So you are saying I am seriously screwed."

"Possibly. But your choices worked well for you this time. That spear would have been too big to get into, much less use in, the dragon's stomach. And while the stone dragon is a much better fighter than your choice..."

"Stone dragon, what stone dragon?"

"He is right ther ... oh, finally got around to moving I see..."

Amelia looks in the indicated direction and sees nothing, in particularly she does not see that "big rock" she had to walk around. That had been a dragon? It would have been huge, a great help. And she had all but climbed over it?

"Anyway, he is rather slow, and you likely would have been eaten before he could help you. So maybe you made the best choices.
"Anyway, all you candidates for Dragon Queen are always in great danger. We have gone thru a dozen batches of candidates in some cases before we got a Queen."

"You mean I am going to be killed and eaten if I don't become Queen?"

"Well, it's not required. And I think some of the candidates survived for quite some time after the queen was chosen. But this island is quite dangerous for you and there is no way off,... unless the Dragon Queen orders it of course.

Amelia had been getting more and more depressed as she listened, but this last comment brings an idea to mind. "Wait a minute. If we 4 women work together and we all succeed, one would become queen and the others could leave?"

"... Well, I suppose so. It has never happened, but I know of no rules against it. Only one can become Queen of course, but the Dragon Queen would decide what would be done with the others, and that could include sending you where want to go."

"And...
113221121.title: questions and answers

choices: Find The Peices Of The Crown!
Be The First To Reach The Throne!
1132211212.content:
"Wait a minute, you said that the Dragon Queen could choose to send us where we want to go. What else could she do with us?" Amelia asks the Dragon Spirit.

The Dragon Spirit shrugs his shoulders and says, "Well in the past most Dragon Queens ordered their former rivals for power to be eaten. Although there was one odd Queen who decided to keep them as her pleasure slaves. But all that depends on whether or not the other candidates even survive that long."

Amelia begins to get a little nervous as she asks, "So what do I have to do to become the Dragon Queen anyway?"

The Dragon Spirit answers...
1132211212.title: Q and A

11322112121.content:
"You see this island is divided into six sections, a volcano, an icy wasteland, a desert, a rainforest, a bone yard, and a mountain in the center." The Dragon Spirit says. "To become the Queen of Dragons you must travel to the first five sections of the island and find all five of the lost pieces of the Dragon Crown that have been hidden there.
"Once you have all the pieces of the crown you must take them to the cave at the top of the mountain in the center of the island."

"Sounds like a silly system to choose a leader." Amerlia grumbled.

"I suppose having the right parents, killing as many as possible, or telling the most lies is superior? We have done quite well with it for centuries of centuries." The Dragon-Spirit responded.
"Anyway, there are a number of dangers and complexities, some of them even helpful, along the way. I have given you merely the basic outline. It is up to you to discover the rest."

"Hmm...you say visit the 5 sections. If we 4 combine and each visit 1 or 2, would that work? Or would the winner have to visit all 5?"

"Hmm...That has never come up. Strictly I suppose there is no rule against just visiting just 1 section if you can get all 5 parts. I will have to check that. I suppose to be safe, you had better do all 5, but it may not be necessary."

"How much more information can you give me?

"Oh loads. At least when I can get time off from being substitute Dragon Queen. Terribly bothersome job if you ask me or any sensible dragon. That's why the job normally goes to you humans. Spending time making all these decisions instead of lying in the sun..Any dragon who wants the job is clearly not one to be trusted with it.
"But ask what you will, and I can supply the answers, at least until I am called back to my duties...like I just was..."
With that, the Dragon Spirit vanishes.

"Drat. There is so much I need to know. No telling when I will get a chance to learn more, other than the hard way.
"Well, I guess we have to get my stick out of that dragon. That will likely have to wait for something to eat the dead dragon.
"Think we should just wait? Or go back and check on the others?"
11322112121.title: mission statement

113221121212.content:
"It will likely be some time before the local vultures finish eating the dragon. It is awfully big after all. And some of them may want fresh meat, like us.
"Yes, best to be away for awhile. Let's see how the others are doing.

"First, I have to put a splint on that leg of yours. I think you can keep up with me on three legs, but you are going to hurt yourself worse, if we don't immobilize that leg. Let's see... ah, these branches will do fine. Don't know about these vines, but I don't see anything better. Now hold still.. No, don't lick my face... Now stop it... I said Stop!... Don't give me that hurt look. I'm trying to help you here. Just hold still ...
"Hmm...definitely male...very definitely. Bet you keep the lady dragons happy. Hey, no need to start showing off. You just keep lying there thinking happy thoughts if you want. ... I need to work on that leg. ...
"There now. Now you can get up. ... Not a bad job at all. Of course I had plenty of chances to practice on my brothers. Now you be sure not to put any weight on that leg and you should be ok.
"now back to the beach to see how the others are doing."

It is not a long trip. but long enough to consider one point. "I really should give you a name...Blue boy? That sounds cute."
The little dragon quickly shook his head. "You don't want a cute name?" Again the answer is negative.
"Surely you don't want something really macho? You'd get laughed at." But the response is positive.
"Men! Well, let's see if I can think of something not too silly ... Sheen? ... Draco? ... Lind ...
A great many names later... "Well, how about Angus? That means 'chosen one' & 'strength'."
The little dragon considers this ... and then Angus nodes his head.

"Well, that is settled anyway. Now let's see how the others are doing."

But the beach is empty, except for ...
113221121212.title: Naming Angus

choices: Keira goes off on her own
1132211212121.content:
The only thing Amelia can see is a flying dragon, a long, emerald green and white serpentine dragon. For a moment, it bothers her that the dragon lacks wings or other apparent means of flying. But this island had already shown enough oddities to worry about this one long. Much more important is make sure this one doesn't want an Amelia-sized snack. As big as it is, she might not be worth the effort, but...
Now she spots the tiny girl on the dragon's back. One of the others has clearly gotten herself a pet too. Amelia has a surge of jealousy watching this thing that is over 10 times as long as her Angus. Then she bends down to pat Angus "No, I wouldn't think of trading you for him. You've saved my life once already."
Of course what she means is that she wouldn't trade him like a shot. A little dickering and some agony... That would be a different story. But there is no good in saying that. Instead she steps onto the beach and waves. None of the girls like each other, and she is likely the least loved of all, but surely there is no desire to kill... is there?

Not at the moment anyway. The dragon lands nearby and it is Keira who hops off. "Well, well, the great Amelia returns with a dragon, or is it a dog?"

Amelia manages to suppress her anger surprisingly easily. This is not the time to get in a shouting match. With a laugh that was somewhat genuine, she answers "Dragon, and it has saved my life.
"But the island is tougher than I expected, and I think you had best stay with me from here on out."

"Ooo, the great explorer has gotten scared and needs my protection. And why should I stay with you? Airblast and I can handle anything we meet."

Amelia keeps silent about the jab about being scared. She had never backed down from a challenge in her life, and is not about to start, but arguing her courage is not her purpose here. "keep thinking that and you will be dead in no time. It's the wrong thing to think anytime, and in your case, especially wrong. Airblast is not a fighter."

"Nonsense, he's so big, he's got to be a real good fighter."

"He's so big that he can run away from any fight before the attacker can hurt him. Look at his teeth. He's a plant-eater."

"But dragons don't eat plants."

"This one does. Take a look. What you have here is transportation, not a trooper."

"Airblast?" Keira appeals to her dragon to refute the charges. But the dragon's expression needs little reading to know he is very sorry, but ...
"Aw.. It's all right Airblast. I still love you. And the Dragon Spirit did say I would have to meet the challenges, so you couldn't help me that much anyway. And I bet you will still be a big help." Keira emphasizes this with a big hug, tho 5' of girl does not come even close to fitting around 50' of dragon, even when it is a skinny dragon. Airblast is not quickly comforted.

Keira considers "Well, in that case, I best be getting a weapon. I'm going to need something to fight with. The Dragon Spirit did say I would need a weapon..."

Amelia interrupts with "I think you already have your weapon."

"Huh?"

"That wrench you are holding. My bet is that is the only weapon you will be able to use. At least I wouldn't bet on finding anything better. The weapons on the island here come under a 1 to a customer policy."

"But I brought this with me. Surely it doesn't count."

"Well, I know where we can test that. But keep hold of that wrench because it may be all you get.
"But we had best band together and find the other girls. Do you know which way they went?"
1132211212121.title: finding Keira

11322112121211.content:
Keira considers "They went in different directions. Why don't I look for June and you look for Krystal?"

Amelia counters "I had best stay here. If either returns, she meets me. And you should be able to find June quickly on Airblast. If I search too, we can all get separated again."

"Sounds good" Keira agrees, and mounts Airblast, who flew off so quickly that Amelia almost wonders if she flew away or vanished.

"Well, we have to wait here. Not east to do, but nothing is sometimes the best action."

Angus has a different idea. He starts licking Amelia. "Hey, you're getting me all sloppy. Stop that!" Angus does, but only for a moment before starting again. And again when ordered to stop again. Eventually ..."Oh all right, if it makes you happy..." It seems to, and Angus has licked much of her body when a dragon and Krystal walk onto the beach.

As Amelia approaches, Krystal proves less hostile than Keira had been. "Well, I didn't expect to see you again."

"You almost didn't. I was nearly digested by a big dragon, bigger than the one you have there."

"There are dragons bigger than William? Drat, I was hoping he could keep the creatures away."

"Some of them, but this place is dangerous, and we need to stick together if we are to survive."

"Well, I was nearly eaten by a python, so I can't disagree, but only one of us can become Dragon Queen."

"We can decide that some way that does not make the others dragon food."

"Surprising that you are so eager to be around me. Didn't you say you wanted to get rid of the 3 of us?"

"I did and I do. But not if somebody is going to get killed, and that is what going off alone would do to you."

"Not to mention to you."

"I'd take my chances actually. I don't run from a challenge. But, yes, I suppose I am safer with you."

"Well..."
11322112121211.title: Meeting Krystal

113221121212111.content:
"I suppose you are right. We should stick togeth.."

But as Krystal says this, Keira is back, again so quickly that Airblast seems to have almost appeared rather than flown.

"Get on board. June's in trouble." Keira yells. The girls and dragons jump on, and they are rapidly flown to a valley where they see June and a dragon being attacked by 4 giant wasps. Their landing and jumping off Airblast attracts the wasps' attention and 3 break off to attack the newcomers.

Krystal is terrified by the one coming at her and William, who is blithely sticking his head out where the wasp can sting it. And that is just what the wasp wants to do.
...wanted to do.
The wasp has a big nasty stinger. But William has a bigger one, and a faster one, which mashes right into the wasp when it is only a foot away. The body of the bug almost floats into William's mouth, where he starts happily chewing [just as he had planned], until Krystal reminds him vigorously that the other girls are in danger too. With a shrug, William flies to their defense.

Keira does not need much defense. It seems Airblast is properly named. He produces a blast of air that stops the wasp dead in the air, allowing Keira to hit it with her wrench, and then another blast of air sends the insect back a dozen feet. Whether groggy from the blow, or just working on instinct, the wasp tries the same tactic, with the same result.

June is also not in great need. Her dragon has a hammerhead that functions very well as a weapon. The wasp tries to get to the dragon's rear to poison it, but June's efforts, while harmless, distract the attacker long enough for the dragon to turn around. She can use some help, but June will likely win.

Amelia is another story. Neither she nor her dragon have much in the way of offensive abilities. This is not a fight they can win. As Krystal steers William to her aid, she is surprised to see Amelia is doing as well as she is. She may not be able to kill the wasp, but she is being amazingly hard to hit, while offering herself as a target. Were Angus healthy, they might be able to dodge the bug all day. But with his leg broken, Amelia must take extra chances to lure the bug to attack her.
Krystal has to admit she is impressed. She can out-dodge Amelia, but try to do it when this horror is trying to kill her? Amelia may be a lot of mouth, but there is plenty of nerve to back it up.
But one can dodge only so many times. A loose rock, and Amelia is a little slow, and the wasp's sting rams into her.
...well rams her anyway.
To the surprise of both girls and the wasp, there is no gaping wound in Amelia. There is something sizzling on her skin, but this does not seem to bother her. She acts like she merely got a punch in the side.
Angus takes advantage of the surprise to attack, but without damaging the wasp, who prepares to attack back, only to be stopped by William's stinger.

Krystal directs William to aid June as she gets off to check on Amelia. A moment later there is a crunch as William finally gets to chew on a wasp, and a thump as Keira's foe falls to the ground.

"You ok?"

Amelia answers "Yeah. Wasp kicked like a mule, but I've taken worse."

"But why didn't it sting you? That thing's like a sword."

"I don't know. It just didn't penetrate. ... Hmm... My skin looks odd. Feels odd too." Amelia looks over her skin.

"These spots that are giving off steam. They look normal." Krystal notes.

"They feel normal too. Say, they would be where the poison from the wasp hit. ... But they hit this slime on me and boiled it off.
"This slime... that's where Angus licked me... Angus! Did you give me a suit of armor by licking me?"

Angus affirms this guess.

After poking at some spots with and without the slime, Amelia judges "It's hardly top of the line stuff, but It was sure useful this time. Guess I was wrong to interrupt you. Well, you can take care of that in a moment. Let's check on June."

June is in fine shape and introduces her dragon as Floral-Foehn. Having just been rescued, she is quite eager to be part of a group.

"The Dragon Spirit said this island is divided into six sections, a volcano, an icy wasteland, a desert, a rainforest, a bone yard, and a mountain in the center. And we need to visit them all. Which to go to 1st?" Keira asks. The question produces considerable debate.

As they argue, Amelia declares "While you decide, I am going to have Angus give me a full suit of armor. Come on little one. Lick me all over."

Angus starts by licking her feet, but then he opens his mouth and puts her toes in his mouth. Then he starts putting her feet in his mouth. "Hey, I said to lick me, not eat me. Stop that!"
Angus does, but a moment later he is trying it again, and then again. "Look, I'm too big. You can't eat me... Can you?" Angus insists he can. "But that's not going to do me any good to be eaten, will it?" Angus again insists it will.
"You were right last time, but being eaten alive?"
113221121212111.title: Rescuing June

choices: in for a penny, in for a pound
1132211212121111.content:
"You were right before, and the dragon spirit said you were fully loyal to me... It still sounds really stupid, but I guess I'll risk it... OK, Angus, chow down!"

Angus quickly does. Amelia's feet vanish into his mouth, and as he starts up her calves, become a bulge in his neck. As he reaches her knees, she can see that the dragon can hold a whole lot more of her than she could have expected. His belly is expanding as more of her enters it. It still seems impossible that he could swallow all of her, but she can no longer reject it as absurd.

"Amelia! What is he doing?" Krystal had noticed what was happening.

"Possibly making a real fool of me. But the dragon Spirit said he would always try to help me, and he insists this is help. So I have to let him do it."

"But how can being eaten alive help?"

"Well, I sure hope I find out. Anyway, I am risking it."

"I do hope you are right." Krystal stepped away with a very worried look on her face.

Amelia is of course even more worried. Some creature have very perverted ideas of what help is. However, there are some compensations for her situation. The dragon's tongue and internal parts provide a soothing massage. If she wasn't worrying about what is going to happen afterwards, she would even be enjoying herself. The swallowing is very pleasant, even sensual.

In fact, too sensual as he reaches the top of her thighs... "Whoa, stop. That's off limits for dragons."
Angus stops, but only for a moment. "No, I may not be a prude, but there are limits, and sex with a dragon, one that looks underage yet, has got to be past it."
And again Angus flicks his tongue at its target. "You're just not going to stop until I say yes, are you? And you want to assure me your perverted male mind didn't add this in for your own fun? That it's good for me?"
Angus can't nod his head when Amelia's legs are in his mouth, but he tries to agree.
1132211212121111.title: swallowing

11322112121211111.content:
"Sigh...ok, I suppose I have little choice..."

Angus quickly takes advantage of Amelia's permission, completely covering all parts of her neither regions with licks of his tongue. Amelia is surprised at how quickly she changes from reluctant to eager as quick darts slide over her mound. She feels her excitement building and building until she climaxes. "Well, you are not to do that again, but.."
But Angus does proceed to do it again, and again. His tongue again and again goes over and into all of her, driving her to completion time after time. It is only when she comes for the 6th time that he finally has mercy and resumes swallowing her. "My, I can't say that any of my lovers have done that well by me" mutters Krystal. June and Keira say nothing. Their sexual experiences are distinctly on the limited side. They are wondering if that was a good thing after this scene.

A satiated Amelia is rather serenely watching the dragon swallow her. As he opens wider to engulf her breasts, he blocks her view of all but dragon mouth, but it is only as her shoulder enter his mouth that she starts to worry again. This has all been very pleasant, but what comes next? A very good question, but there is no way now to avoid the answer. A moment later her head is out of sight, and her arms follow quickly.
As her hands vanish, June starts giggling. Reprimanded by the others, she says "I can't help it. Angus looks so much like a silly beach ball with legs."
Looking again causes Krystal to break up. The dragon does look silly, with a stomach several times the size of the rest of him. He can't begin to move with Amelia in him and his attempts to do so are comical. Keira however remains serious "Now what?"
11322112121211111.title: full meal

113221121212111111.content:
Amelia felt rather snug in Angus' stomach, and after six climaxes, she was rather tired out. She sighed, wondering what Angus had in mind. Too bad she found out that it wasn't to her liking.

She suddenly felt the stomach walls excrete digestive enzymes, and it started to work on her flesh. Now she was scared, she called out, "O-okay Angus! T-that's enough! Let me out... LET ME OUT!!!" The acids chruned all over her, dissolving her skin and flesh. She began to cry, "This can't be how it ends. Not for me. I was destined to be a queen! How could you betray me, Angus!?"

The other girls watched in horror as his stomach shrank slowly, and soon, Amelia was no more, never to walk the earth again. The Dragon Spirit floated up, "Pity really, but I don't think she should have trusted him with that kind of task. You see, when a dragon gets a free meal, they tend to finish it off quickly. Pity. I guess one of you remaining three shall be queen. I wish you the best of luck."

Angus gave a loud burp and scurried off into the underbrush, satisfied of his sexy and delicious catch. Keira sighed, "How did I see that one coming? I guess it's up to us now. Adios Amelia."
113221121212111111.title: A meal named Amelia

113221121212111112.content:
Amelia wakes feeling very much the morning after. She is half-way thru swearing never to drink again when she realizes there was no wild party the night before. That the last thing she can recall is Angus swallowing her. That was supposed to give her a suit of armor on her skin. Right now it does not seem worth it.

Say, where is everybody?
A tongue wetly tells her where Angus is a moment before her eyes can focus enough to notice him in front of her. But the other girls?
"Come on, let's find the gang." A command that proves a bit hard to follow as it takes 3 tries to get to her feet, and 5 to stay up. But as she starts to stagger forward, she continues to recover and is functioning moderately well as she moves into a clearing.

"Amelia! What are you doing here? Are you all right?" Krystal is suddenly right in front of her. Clearly Amelia is still groggy if Krystal can get this close without being noticed.

"I feel like I'm recovering from a 3 day drunk, but besides wishing I was dead, I guess so. What happened?"

"That's what we would like to know. We pretty much assumed the worst when Angus's belly started to shrink. And then he ran off into the woods..."

"Wait a minute. Angus has a broken leg. He can't run!"

"Well he did, and fast too."

"But..." Amelia bends down to look over Angus, and finds that his broken leg is fully healed. "Is that what this was all about? You eat me and you can draw off enough pep to heal your leg?"

Angus tries to deny it, but he looks really guilty. "Well, I do need a healthy dragon, so I suppose I have to forgive you anyway, but you just keep in mind that you made me feel terrible."

A shrill whistle from Krystal makes her feel worse. "Please! My head is too sensitive!?"

"Sorry, but when we went looking for...well, whatever, we selected that as a signal. The others should be here shortly."

And they are. It is June who points out that Angus seems to have provided the desired tough skin. At least Amelia's skin looks and feels different. But for the moment, none of the girls are willing to chance Angus's mouth to get their own benefit.

"Now what?"

"Well, the dragon spirit said we would need weapons, and you said we would get only one choice, so we are working on that."

"Good point. I want to go get mine back. It is not much, but it has already been useful. But it can wait if you have any idea where to get one."
113221121212111112.title: Amelia is back

1132211212121111121.content:
Krystal muses for a moment "You know, I think I see my weapon..." She begins examining a long vine. "tough, not too slippery, very flexible...yes, this will do nicely.."

"But what is that?"

"Rope! All sorts of uses, both in an out of combat. And I expect William will be doing most of the fighting anyway. Where he can't help, this may."

"I don't know... but since I am stuck with a stick, I can hardly say it is a bad choice. June, you have any ideas yet?"

"No, I don't. I would really like a book about this island. That would be very useful. But there likely isn't a book on the entire island...
"What's up with Angus?"

"I don't know. Some dragon thing, I guess."

"You don't suppose he knows where a book is, do you?" Krystal's comment is hardly serious, but it spurs frantic nodding from the little dragon.

June of course is thrilled. She has barely lived outside of books, and her current experiences are not encouraging her to leave them. "You do? You do! Where is it? How do we get it?"

Amelia interrupts "This could be long and dangerous. How about we get my stick, not to mention a bit of dragon meat to eat, first?
1132211212121111121.title: weapons

11322112121211111211.content:
It seems simple to get Amelia's stick if she wants it, so all jump on Airblast and are quickly at the sight of Amelia's battle.
There are a lot of hungry dragons on the isle, and few of them are fussy about what type of meat they ate. Dead dragon ranks well up on many diets. So not surprising the body of Amelia's foe has been half-consumed already, and is nearly covered by feasting lesser dragons.

William is easily able to chase off those who look interested in fresh meat, and Floral's hammerhead proves sharp as an ax and she is able to carve out plenty of stakes for the party.

Amelia, however, is after her stick. If the dragon spirit is correct, and there seems no reason to doubt that, she will not succeed without it. Just how she can with it is hard to see, but it worked once so far, so....
But here it is, about halfway eaten loose from the dragon. So just grab it and...stuck. Pull harder... Is it caught in some bone or something? Determined, Amelia puts all her muscle and concentration in her next try.
Which means she does not hear the cry of warning from her companions. Instead she feels the confines of a huge dragon mouth again.
It does not take her long to guess what has happened. This big dragon came swooping down and decided it wanted living food, and she was the only thing not diving for cover. She is right back where she was with the other dragon, except she lacks stick and little assistant.

She also is dealing with a smarter dragon. Once it has gotten a distance away, it starts chewing on her. To both parties' surprise, she takes no damage. pain, yes, but no damage. Has Angus done some good again?
The dragon is not too concerned. If it can't chew, it is still big enough to swallow. So Amelia is turned to face its throat and it starts swallowing.

Her head goes down easily and her shoulders are soon following. As more of her enters the passage to the stomach, Amelia is finding the actions of that huge tongue surprisingly erotic. Is she actually going to enjoy being eaten? She is not sure whether to deem that a small generosity or a huge insult.
But as her hips leave the mouth and the tongue can no longer stimulate her sensitive regions, she finds she can't resist the urges of her body and her hands seek her sex, rubbing vigorously. She soon comes and relaxes for a moment. When she recovers, she sees she is entirely in this dragon's belly. An "earthquake" is quickly identified as the dragon giving a massive belch.

With a sigh of contentment, the dragon lies down to digest its pleasant meal.
11322112121211111211.title: been here before

113221121212111112112.content:
Amelia fights down her panic and tries to find a way out. But the options are grim. This time she has no weapon, and the stomach is too small to turn around in, or even to move much. This looks hopeless. For a moment, she considers just playing with herself. That way she can at least go out with a bang. But she has never walked away from a challenge in her life, and she is not going to stop now. She is almost certainly dead, but she is not going to surrender quietly.

So there are only the two ways out. And not only is the throat behind here where she would have to push her way backward with just her hands, but she would surely wake the dragon no matter how deeply it sleeps. Then it would just swallow her again. No hope that way.
Forward is the only hope. That must be 100' of crawling thru a tiny tube, with all sorts of reasons she can't make it, but it is the only chance. Forward she goes..
The tube is as small as she had feared, and does not stretch easily, but she starts to make progress. However, the air is getting bad. And likely will be worse soon. Right now, there is only a hint of oder. That will get a lot worse before it gets better.
But more important is that she is feeling tired and sleepy, and having trouble remembering why it is so important she keep moving, especially when it is so hard to get around the corners... Finally she just has to take a break and rest for a l i t t l e bit...

She is quite confused when she wakes. Why is there grass under her? Wait, shouldn't she be inside a dragon? Yes, that is right, a dragon ate her. Did she actually manage to crawl out? That seems wrong. She is a mess, but not that kind of mess. But how else could she have gotten out? Well, this place is weird in many ways, and some will have to remain mysteries. Right now, she had best concentrate on finding the others.

The first of them proves quite easy to find. Angus is looking at her from only a few feet away. "Angus? How did you find me?... Oh why bother asking a question you can't answer? How about where are the others?"

This he is able to answer it seems. He gets up and scampers off in what seems a random direction, looking back to make sure Amelia is following. She is, and is soon rewarded for her faith. A few minutes later, all of the girls are together again.

It is June who asks what happened to which Amelia can only reply "I don't know. the dragon ate me and somehow I got out of his stomach, but I have no idea how."

June considers "You know...your skin looks normal again. Do you suppose what Angus did to you got you out of the stomach?"

"Angus, did you provide me with a 'get-out-of-belly-free' card?" The answer is positive. "That was a real good gift. I have got to thank you." A hug seems to be sufficient.
"Now, as soon as I get cleaned up, I want another trip to your stomach. That sound like a good idea to you?" Apparently. "Good, now the other girls need protection too. Can you provide it?" Again, the answer seems positive.

As she reaches the flower, she realizes the scent is coming from the pit at its center, a hole a little over a foot in diameter and several feet deep. As she leans over the scent becomes ever more powerful and delightful.

Now she realizes what sort of plant this is. She had read of plants like this that lured flies by scent, trapped them, and digested them. The poor girls would be enchanted by the smell and crawl in to that pit, only to find they were trapped, and then they would be slowly digested. A single girl might feed the plant for a year. 12.content:
June walked around nervously, acting very skiddish. She hoped that she could find a dragon that would like her, but not like her as a snack. She came to a valley where there were a ton of swirled red and white dragons with milky eyes and hamerhead shark-like heads. "Well, they seem friendly. Let's just hope they're not hungry." She walked down into the valley.

The dragons looked up from thier naps, but none seemed to care about her presence. June looked around nervously, "Okay, they don't seem to mind me. Maybe I can just ask one to be my partner. I hope they don't kill me." She then saw a young looking dragon near her, it seemed to be a female. "Maybe that one will do." As she approached, the dragon eyed her with suspicion, June noticed this, "Don't worry, I won't harm you. You can trust me." The dragon seemed to understand, and just placed her head back on her claws. June gently touched the dragon's neck, expecting it to snap at her, but the dragon remained motionless.

"Good, at least you like me. Do you want to help me survive on this island? Without you, I might die, so please?" The dragon yawned, turned her head towards her, and gave a small nod. June was overjoyed, "Yes! Thank you! Now for a name. Since you're red and are a female, how about Floral-Foehn?" The dragon nodded, but then used her tail to rip off June's shirt and bra, leaving her perky breast exposed to the air. "Hey! What'd you do that for? I liked that shirt." The dragon made a low growl, almost saying "I like you better this way." June seemed to understand, "I get it. You want to make sure that I won't harm you. I guess so, just give me a warning next time, Floral-Foehn."

Suddenly, they heard a buzzing, and all the dragons perked up. "What? What's wrong Floral-Foehn?" Then, out of the bushes came a swarm of...

The outer walls of the building were quite high, about forty feet, and a large doorway led inside. She couldn't see inside though because the way was blocked by a medium-sized silver dragon.

June thought about it, knowing she had befriended Floral, and decided, "Well, I'll just have to try my luck!".

She strode out of the jungle, up a stone pathway leading toward the door, and the dragon, who...
1211211.title: An Interesting Place

choices: June listens, hoping she doesn't end up another snack
12112111.content:
"Welcome, June, to the Temple of the Moon Dragon", it said.

June jumped, quite startled at meeting the first talking dragon she had encountered on the island so far.

"Um.. you talk!", she explained, and added, "... but how do you know my name?"

"I know all about you, June," the dragon continued. "The other three in your party passed this way some time ago." The dragon yawned before continuing, "I was starting to think you weren't going to make it."

"Then they're inside?" June asked, hopeful that she could see her friends again.

"No, I ate them all," the dragon added matter-of-factly.

June backed away but the great silver dragon effortlessly wrapped June in its tail. "Are you going to eat me?" she asked fearfully.

"Perhaps. You do seek to become the Queen of Dragons, don't you?" the dragon added.

"Yes, I don't want to die!", June said quickly, hoping that she could talk the silver out of eating her, as it had her friends.

"Then I would advise you listen to me, young lady." The dragon continued coiling its tail about June as he talked, so that all that was visible of June was her head sticking up through the top of the sliver coils.
12112111.title: Dialog!

121121111.content:
"This is the Temple of the Moon Dragon. My name Keer'el, and I am the High Dragon," Keer'el began grandly.

"Long ago, humans and dragons lived together on this island. The humans worshipped us dragons, who in turn worshipped the great Moon Dragon. Here, the high dragon and the human high priestess directed worship and presented sacrifices to the Moon Dragon. This went on for many generations, until one day the Moon Dragon saw fit to bestow a great blessing on all the humans who lived on this island."

"The Moon Dragon showed the High Dragon and the High Priestess how to perform a special ritual, such that the High Priestess' soul was projected from her body at the height of the ritual, and then the High Dragon swallowed the High Priestess whole, severing the spirit's connection. The spirit was then placed in a nearby dragon egg. When the egg hatched, it contained the reincarnated soul of the High Priestess."

Keer'el paused a moment before carrying on. "This ritual was repeated for every human on the island. Hardly a fortnight had passed before the islands entire human population has been reincarned as new dragons. The Temple of the Moon Dragon fell into disrepair as there were no humans around to maintain it, though the dragons still met regularly here to pay their respects."

"The Moon Dragon told us that one day new humans would come to the island, and one of them would pass the trials to become the new High Priestess, and the Moon Dragon would bless her and she would become the Queen of the Dragons."

"Now, no human has set foot on this island since the Grand Consuming, nearly five hundred years ago, until today. Most dragons have forgotten human language and customs, though we can all talk, at least to each other."

"The first to visit this temple was Krystal. I hadn't eaten in a couple of days, and I was very hungry. I used my powers as the High Dragon to mesmerize her and swallowed her whole."

"I felt guilty, of course, so when another young girl, Keira, came along, I told her what I told you, but, sadly, she did not pass the trials, so I mesmerized and swallowed her too, I didn't want her to suffer a worse fate out on the island somewhere."

The dragon paused again, before going on, "A few hours later, Amelia came here. She also undertook the trials, passed them, but asked to take the Consuming Ritual, as all the humans did before her. I begged her to reconsider but she would not be dissuaded - she wanted to be a dragon and that was that. My mate and I do have a clutch of fresh eggs, so I invoked the ancient magics in the inner sanctum of the Temple and devoured her. Her spirit now rests in one of those eggs, which should hatch in a few more weeks."

"That brings us up to now, June. Are you ready to test yourself against the trials?"

June thought a moment, before she realized she had no choice but to accept. "Yes, I am Keer'el."

"Well, the first test is the easiest," Keer'el stated, before exhaling a stream of dense smoke over June.

June smelled the smoke, realizing it was very sweet and not unpleasent smelling. She held her breath, but not long before she was forced to breathe, where...
121121111.title: More dialog

choices: She gropes around near the door.
1211211111.content:
June breathed in the smoke, and found it light and easy to breathe. She inhaled more, and found it oddly pleasing.

Keer'el smiled, and folded his wings over June, exhaling a dense cloud of smoke as he did so.

"This is the Test of Affinity", Keer'el said, exhaling more smoke. June began to feel lightheaded and slightly aroused. "It proves that you as a human are compatable with us dragons. But there will be more time for this later. Follow me."

Keer'el released June from his tail and walked inside the Temple. Keer'el led June down a large stairway, plenty big enough for even Keer'el's large mass, to large doorway.

"This is the Test of Survival. The island is a dangerous place, you must prove you can survive against the creatures that live here. All you have to do is make it to the other side."

With that, Keer'el retreated back up the stairs. June opened the door and went inside into a pitch black room.
1211211111.title: The Second Trial

12112111111.content:
June walked forward into the gloom, determined to finish the test.

She had taken scarcely two steps when when she encountered a sticky, fibrous wall. She struggled but could not free herself and was soon hopelessly entangled.

Her eyes slowly adjusted to the dark and she saw she was entangled in a great spider's web. June's screams caught the attention of a mammoth spider, easily sixty feet across, which came over to check out its latest catch. Upon examination, the spider found it too small to be worth sucking the blood, and simply scooped up June in its mandables and abruptly silenced her screams by swallowing her whole.
12112111111.title: Spider Food

12112111112.content:
June decided caution was the better part of valor and stayed put until her eyes adjusted. Groping about in the darkness she found a small, steel sword. She couldn't see much about it but it had a very sharp edge.

June peered ahead and saw the dim outlines of a great spider's web. The spider didn't seem to be present, so she hacked a hole in the strands, and, being careful not to entangle herself, stepped through.

She found herself in a great cave. Faintly glowing lichen on the walls provided light, though just barely enough to see by.

She walked down the cave, trying not to draw attention to herself, until, about half a mile down the cave, she found a great pool of water. She could see the cave continue on its far side, but could see no easy way across.
12112111112.title: Hack n' Slash

choices: A great light fills the room
121121111121.content:
June decided that the only way out was through, and cast aside her sword so it would not weigh her down and swam, and silently as she could, across the pool.

In the center of the pool, she bumped into something long and round, about six feet across. She felt it squirming, and realized it was a huge serpent. She left it alone, and it paid her no heed.

Eventually, wet but alive, she arrived at the far side of the pool. A short distance later the cave led back up into the temple, where Keer'el was waiting for her.

"I'm glad to see you made it," he exclaimed honestly. "But now the third and final test is upon you, the test of magic. This test will make sure that you can wield the magics that the Moon Dragon will bestow up on you. Are you ready?"

June realized she still had no choice, and nodded.

"Good. Follow me into the Inner Sanctum."

June followed Keer'el into a great room dominated by a huge white dragon statue, sitting up with its wings folded behind it and its tail coiled around its feet. The statue gazed upon a large marble alter, the wings of two standing dragons facing away from each other forming its surface.

Keer'el said, "All you have to do is pray to the Moon Dragon at the altar, and see what happens."

June nodded, and kneeled at the altar, praying, "Moon Dragon, please don't kill me. Let me serve you. I don't want to die today."
121121111121.title: The Third Trial

1211211111211.content:
The statue's eyes started to glow red, and smoke began rising from its nostrils.

June looked up at Keer'el. "Does this mean she accepts me?"

Keer'el gazed upon her, and June was suddenly captivated by his majesty. "No, I'm afraid not." Keer'el said.

June stood transfixed and Keer'el exhaled a great cloud of smoke. June breathed deeply, the same giddy, arousing feeling passing through her once again.

So deep was her trance that she barely noticed when Keer'el folded his wings around her, exhaling even denser smoke over her. She shuddered in ecstasy at the touch of his tongue, as he slowly lifted her up into his maw, waves of orgasmic delight passing through her at the touch of his tongue, and throat.

She felt herself dissolving in his stomach, her body becoming one with his. She wondered briefly what would happen to her spirit, before she finally succombed to the sleep of eternity.

Keer'el slowly walked out of the temple, a disappointed look on his face, as he awaited the next group of humans to come to the island.
1211211111211.title: Some Girls like to be eaten

1211211111212.content:
As June prayed to the Moon Dragon, a great white light filled the room. It coalesced on June, slowly becoming a resplendent, though quite revealing, robe, imprinted with dragons of all sizes and colors.

June looked around, a bit stunned, when the Dragon Spirit appeared next to her.

"Congratulations, June," the dragon spirit said. "As you have probably guessed, I am the Moon Dragon. Now that I have accepted you into my order, the time has come for you to make a choice."

"You may become the High Priestess and continue your quest to become the Dragon Queen, or you may undergo the Consuming Ritual and be reborn as a dragon, though you will never be the Queen. If you continue, you will face more dangers on the island, though if you succeed, you will be the first Queen the dragons have had in half a century. Make your choice."

June thought for a moment, but only a moment, before swiftly reaching her conclusion.
1211211111212.title: Decisions, Decisions

12112111112121.content:
June quickly decided that the chance of spending an entire lifetime as one of these majestic creatures was too much to pass up. "I want to undergo the Ritual," she said decisively.

"Then so be it, we shall simply have to await the arrival of another human who may become the queen," the Moon Dragon said, before slowly faiding from view.

Keer'el motioned for June to lie down on the altar. June did so, and Keer'el swiftly removed her robe with a single swipe of his right foreclaw, leaving her once again nude.

Keer'el exhaled a great cloud of smoke over June, who inhaled the vapors deep into her lungs. A great sense of peace passed over her, as Keer'el began a low hum.

June closed her eyes, the pleasing humming of the dragon, and its smoke drawing her into a deep trance. Keer'el folded his wings over the altar, exhaling more of sweet, intoxicating smoke over June, who felt a brief tug, and then had the sensation of looking down at herself as her spirit floated above the altar.

June, in her bliss, did not notice the subtle snap of her spirit's bond to her body breaking as Keer'el lifted her body and swallowed it whole, and her awareness slowly faded away as she drifted toward, and then into, one of the eggs sittings in a small nest at the far side of the inner sanctum.

...

Three weeks later the dragon that had been June hatched, along with another dragon that had been Amelia. They were named June'exia and Am'ela, and were perfectly normal silver hatchlings. Later, when they were almost adults, their human memories would return, but by then they were quite comfortable as dragons and both agreed that humans were quite tasty when a raft full of shipwreck survivors washed up on the island one day, about a hundred years after their rebirth.
12112111112121.title: To Be Reincarned, One Must First be Eaten

12112111112122.content:
June decided she had come too far to turn back now, so she stated simply, "I wish to go on."

"Very well then," the Moon Dragon said. June suddenly felt the Moon Dragon's power running through her, and gasped in surprise and pleasure.

"As the only human priestess of mine, that automatically makes you the High Priestess. As such, you can now converse in the language of the dragons, and you should know your way about the island a bit better."

"But the island is still a very dangerous place for you. Most dragons should not try to eat you now, but the dragons have been without a queen for a very long time, and some may resent you. Also, you are still as tasty as ever to the nondragon inhabitants of the island. In order to survive you must accomplish two more things before you become the Queen of Dragons."

June nodded, and the Moon Dragon continued, "You must befriend an unmated male to be your King, and you must travel to Dragon Mountain in the center of the island and retrieve the Draconic Pearl. Once you pick it up, everything else should happen on its own."

With that, the Moon Dragon slowly faded from view. "I must remain here, High Priestess," Keer'el said, before going on, "My duties are here, and I am also still very full from your friends. Good luck, I hope to see you again."

With no other reasonable choices that she could see, June left the temple and started heading toward Dragon Mountain.
