"Greetings Jun'exia, I am Kar'sal, the guardian of the draconic pearl. Before I open the door, I have one question that you must answer."

Jun'exia nodded. She had aced every exam she had taken in high school and had graduated with distinguished high honors. Yet like the trials she had taken on the island, she couldn't read a textbook and memorize the answers. No, this exam was to judge her moral character.

"First of all Jun'exia, why is it that you wish to become the Queen of the Dragons?" asked Kar'sal.

Up until that moment, Jun'exia hadn't devoted much time to contemplate this fundamental question. For a moment, her mind went blank. She thought about Floral, who had given her life just to give her the chance to see the Moon Dragon, of her other three companions who had failed the trails, and of Fra'xal, for his kindness and showing her how to be a dragon. Without them, she wouldn't have been where she was now.

"At first, I did so because I was scared; scared that if I didn't, I would be eaten" Jun'exia began, sensing that honesty would be the better answer. Now that she was a dragon, Jun'exia could see just how vulnerable she had been when she was still human.

"I have come to realize that this is my destiny, that I cannot go back. The denizens on the island depend upon me and I cannot and will not let them down, and if I do become queen it is because of how they have helped me. No matter whether you decide that I am worthy to be queen or not, I will devote myself to restoring the island to its former glory and serving its inhabitants" said Jun'exia.

"Is this what you truly believe Jun'exia?" he said.

"Yes, I do" she replied.

"With that said...
121121111121221211221111.title: The last trial

1211211111212212112211111.content:
"I shall open the door for you, Jun'exia, queen of the dragons" said Kar'sal.

The guardian of the Draconic Pearl reverted to a statue once more. Slowly but surely, the door began to open, a bright light emanted from within.

Jun'exia crawled through the door, and no sooner had she walked inside when it shut behind her. She found herself in a large chamber, its gleaming, ivory walls dotted with numerous small torches. In the center of the chamber was what looked like a huge nest, illuminated by a ray of sunlight. A stairway made out of pure magical energy led up to the ledge, the path behind her dissapating as she ascended.

Her eyes grew wide when she caught sight of the Draconic Pearl. There it was, resting atop a petastal made out of marble, had a smooth, frictionless surface, and was about three times the size of a normal dragon egg. On the opposite side of the Draconic Pearl was another ledge, reserved for the dragon king.

Her body glowing, Jun'exia lifted her neck into the air, calling out for her mate, echoing across the skies over the island. The next moment, streams of red, plasma-like energy entered through the chambers orifice, dancing across the walls before gathering on the opposite side of the pedastal Jun'exia was perched on. They took shape and materialized and when the lights subsided, it revealed her mate, her king, Fra'xal.

Once the glowing subsided, Fra'xal opened his eyes, they locked with Jun'exia's.

"Jun'exia, my queen, you have called me and I have come..." said Fra'xal, his voice filled with awe. "You are so beautiful, it seems not even a god would be worthy of you, much less a dragon like myself."

Jun'exia couldn't help but blush and nuzzle with her mate. "Oh Fra'xal, my dearest love, it is I who have been so blessed to find a dragon like you. Soon we shall become king and queen over the entire island..." murmured Jun'exia.

"Then let us not waste any more time," said Fra'xal.

Jun'exia and Fra'xal chanted a prayer to the great dragons above, before they approached the pedastal where the Draconic Pearl lay. She placed her claws upon the Pearl, Fra'xal doing the same with his. The pedastal dissappeared, and a burst of light emanated from the pearl, sending her into a trance.

She heard Fra'xal chant a prayer in the draconic language, and dissapated into pure life force. Jun'exia gasped as her body was levitated into the air, unable to control her movements. Opposite of her, the Draconic Pearl ascended, Fra'xal's life force circling it, before burrowing within the pearl.

It was then Jun'exia realized what was going on. The Draconic Pearl, in fact, was in reality an egg, and Fra'xal's spirit within it, into a king worthy to share the throne with her, and she would nurture the egg within her womb along with the clutch she already had, so that when Fra'xal was reborn as a king worthy of the throne.

Jun'exia found herself being gently shifting to a prone position, legs splaying open as the Pearl's pointed end aimed itself directly at her womanhood. The thought of an object that large burrowing within her, made her pant and moan, her juices leaking out of her and dripping onto floor.

Nothing could have prepared Jun'exia for what came next. Without warning the Draconic Pearl began to spin rapidly, and then drilled into her womanhood. All Jun'exia could do was roar and thrash in wild ecstasy, as the Pearl's passage stretched her wider and wider to the point where it would surely tear her in half. When the egg was midway through her, Jun'exia gasped out breath, before grasping the Pearl with both claws and pushing it further within her, causing it to glow, while eliciting a fresh round of orgasmic screams.

The entire world seemed to explode when she burst into orgasm. She gave the loudest roar of all, spraying her juices all over the chamber, and releasing all her magical energies out of her body into the air, which spread through the air until every creature on the island from the smallest insect to the mightiest of dragons, was mating and rejuvenating the island of life.

Oh!! By the great dragons above!! Would it ever end!? Part of her wished it would, yet at the same time wished her orgasm would go on forever.

Finally, after what seemed like an entire lifetime, the Draconic Pearl, which now held Fra'xal spirit, had been taken within her womb. Jun'exia floated back down onto the nest, was laid gently on her side.

Though sore and utterly exhausted, she nonetheless had a sense of fulfillment. She was now queen, and before too long, would not only lay her clutch of eggs, but also reincarnate her mate, Fra'xal. Content with the world, Jun'exia closed her eyes and fell into a deep sleep.
1211211111212212112211111.title: The unbirthing ritual

choices: Fra'xal and june decide to explore.
Fra'xal and june decide to stay together for now.
12112111112122121122111111.content: When june awoke,she still felt the fullness.She looked to the place where the dragonic pearl-the egg had rested,and saw a nest there.Following her instincts-her instincts?-she climbed into it and began to convulse.she grunted and heaved,and a round object slipped out-the first egg.the second egg soon followed,the third,the fourth,and the fifth.then it was over,as quickly as it had begun.June examined her clutch of eggs,her eyes immediately settling upon the egg that held her mate.She looked at her arms and legs as best she could,and realized she was bigger and stronger.She also had a crown of dragon ridges on her head.She looked up,and settled down for a moment.Suddenly she heard a cracking sound,coming from Fra'xal's egg.He emerged,and it was a wonder that the puny egg had held him.He was as big as she was,with bulging muscles all over his body and a huge maw.He,too,had a crown of ridges atop his head.She looked at him,and he looked at her.Fra'xal said:"By the great dragon's good right claw,you are beautiful." June responds in kind,and they turn to look at her-their-clutch of eggs."Should we explore or stay here and...enjoy...eachother,Fra'xal?" She said.They decided...
12112111112122121122111111.title: Ahnald Dragon!

choices: He managed to trip while he steps forward, killing him instantly. Yeah. Ow.
1211211111212212112211112.content:
"....you are unworthy." The statue rumbled, it's jaded pupils turning a blood-red crimson.
Jun'exia backed away, her tail twitching nervously. "Uh...come again?"
"And for that, you must be tested once again," The somehow-sentient statue grinded in a deep ominous voice.
She caught her breath, realizing she'd been holding it. "Oh. What's the test, I think I'm ready."
The statue seemed to hesitate. "....wait, seriously?" it asked, it's voice suddenly becoming less of a "giant menacing statue" and more of an "I'm buying some popcorn, want some?" voice.
(Don't shoot me, I'm just the piano player.)
"Er....yes?" She replied, wrinkling her snout.
"Jun'exia-you know, can I just call you June? June, you see the shape of this room?"
She glanced around at the hexagonally symmetrical walls, which were smooth and flat.
June'exia nodded slowly. "What does this have to do with the test again?"
The statue seemed to laugh. "Oh, plenty. This entire room is just one giant um...elevator. It's very primitive, unfortunately, so it makes frequent stops to repair or check the chains that allow it to function. If you calculate the number of stops before you reach the pearl, it'd be....." the statue's head creaked and stared down at its talons, which rose off the floor as he seemed to count them. "...three. Three stops. So all you have to do until then, my dear June...." he grinned. "..is survive."
She blinked. "Survive what?"
His stony grin widened. "Me."
1211211111212212112211112.title: Ladies and Gentlemen, prepare for a BOSS FIIIIGHT!

choices: Plot-twist, he lied. This is actually a trap,
12112111112122121122111121.content:
The floor rumbled, but she couldn't tell if it was from the statue or the supposed elevator. Sure enough, the walls began to slide upward from under the floor, signifying that there was indeed an elevator.
The giant stone dragon shook itself free of the moss and vines that previously sat inert on its chiseled scales. "Erraahhhhh.....been a while since I've done this!"
Jun'exia readied herself, smoke spilling out of her maw as she prepared to blast him with fire.
As the stone dragon stood up, the scales on both of his forelegs crumbled and fell, revealing wooden supports on the inside.
Knowing this was a weak spot, she decided that's where her target was.
The statue bellowed, then exhaled a beam of light out of its maw. Jun'exia rolled to the side, then blasted his foreleg with a burst of flames. The old, dry wood burst into flame.
"Gah! What the-" the statue's leg exploded, sending chunks of stone and charcoal everywhere. "OW!" It yelled, standing on only three legs now.
"YOU'LL PAY FOR THAT!" The statue swept its tail across the floor, sending it at Jun'exia.
She huffed, then leaped into the air, beating her wings to keep her aloft and above the giant tail.
The floor suddenly stopped, forcing the statue to rebalance itself as Jun'exia landed. (Whoever thought it was a good idea to change her name, I think I'm going to find you and pour a gallon of milk on your head.)
"Floor 1," The stone dragon mumbled. "Thought it was further away."
After a few brief seconds, the walls began moving again.
"Alright, BREAK OVER!" He yelled, lunging at June'exia suddenly.
She yelped and rolled inbetween his legs, then blasted the other foreleg with fire. She dashed out from under him as he growled, before falling on his face.
"GrrrrAAAHHHHH!" He roared, standing up on his hind legs.
Jun'exia dodged another beam of light before the decimated statue stomped the ground, throwing her off balance.
He grinned evilly and swept with his tail once again, batting her into the sliding walls.
"Ah!" She cried, grabbing her chest. Her ribs ached from the tail's impact, and her spine felt terribly unstable.
The statue lunged forward again, but this time she was ready. She shot up into the air, then landed on the statue's rocky muzzle.
He growled confusedly until she began to smash the gems that made up his eyes. "AHH! DAMN YOU, FLY!" He roared, smashing his head into the wall. She cracked one of his eyes before she was shaken off.
The floor lurched again. "Second stop," he mumbled. "Damn. Hey, do you know any magic stonemasons? I can't feel my arms, and I feel like that's a medical concern? I don't know."
Jun'exia frowned. "Do you take ANY part of your job seriously?"
The statue shook his head. "No, not really."
The floor began moving once again, before he somehow leaped into the air, and impacted the elevator.
The ground shattered as they were thrown into a free-fall.
Jun'exia barely opened her wings, knowing that with this much sudden gravity that they could very well be ripped off by the winds.
The statue frowned. "Well, this sucks."
Jun'exia blinked, then watched as he hit the ground below as she glided down safely.
The remains of the elevator were shattered on the ground floor, where the statue's remains also rested.
She touched down, then made sure to watch her step for jagged rocks.
"...wait...." a voice behind her croaked. She turned her head to see the statue's head still intact.
"Mmhm?" she inquired.
"...when you become queen, can you....rebuild me?"
She smiled warmly, then nodded.
"....thanks."
Jun'exia flicked her tail excitedly as she walked through the doorway leading to the Draconic Pearl.
12112111112122121122111121.title: FIGHT!

121121111121221211221111212.content:
I will shorten her name to J to save you the pains of autocorrect.

As J entered the room, there was not an orb, but 4 circular stone doors. To the right of each of these doors was an inscription. From left to right, they read

DEATH

LIFE

PURITY

GOOD AND EVIL

Which door does J enter?
121121111121221211221111212.title: Yes, but no.

1211211111212212112211112121.content: So, which new trial first, life or death?
1211211111212212112211112121.title: Which one?

12112111112122121122111121212.content:
J opens the door marked DEATH, and steps inside a long hallway, with periodic piles of gold, diamond, emerald, and other gemstones. At the end of the hallway sits a throne. In the throne was a person, looking to be fairly young, beside the throne sat a green scythe.
“Hello there, I assume you are here for the Queen’s trial?”
J: “Yes, who exactly are you?”
“My name would be Cherlissian, my title, now that’s where the real fun begins.”
J: “So, Cherlissian, why is there a human in a trial meant to choose the new DRAGON queen?”
Cher: “There isn’t.”
J: “What do you mean?”
Cher: “allow me to show you.”
Then, his body began to crack, revealing his true form, a bipedal dragon made of what appears to be emerald or the like. He picks up the emerald scythe, and the blade begins to glow a lime green.
Cher: “My name is Cherlissian, my title: Reaper of Souls. If you wish to even have a chance of becoming queen, you must defeat me and three others before that option even becomes available. Good luck, cause I ain’t gonna go easy on you.
12112111112122121122111121212.title: THE REAPER

121121111121221211221111212121.content:
Cherlissian: Reaper of Souls
Stats:
Attack: varies per attack
Defense: literally made of emerald-colored diamond
Speed: faster than you’d expect

Abilities:
Swings scythe 5 times in rapid succession, is always followed by a downward-traveling phantasmal scythe.
Can cause spikes to erupt from floor in varying patterns, the most common being ten medium-sized ones in a straight line followed by one larger one.
Randomly, transparent scythes will spawn around the room in amounts between 2 and 6. These spin around for awhile before converting and causing a large horizontal slash in the direction of the enemy. This can be jumped over or ducked under, but over is the safer option.
Occasionally, Cherlissian will stop and summon Fallen Souls to aid him. These enemies are better to avoid, but doing so will prevent you from damaging Cherlissian for a time, as they spawn in a circle around him.
At 50% hp, Cherlissian will transition into his full dragon form after jumping into a portal, emerging in dragon form. In this form, he will summon Fallen Souls more often, the scythes spawn in groups of 4-10, and lines of spikes go in 6 directions. His ability to directly melee you is gone, replaced instead by several large scythe apparitions that rapidly sweep alternating left to right. After 6 of these sweeps, the downward stroke targets you, and strikes down after a second of hovering.

Upon defeat, Cherlissian will retreat into a portal, and in the main room a green gem with a red core will light up.
121121111121221211221111212121.title: I forgot description lol

1211211111212212112211112122.content: The trials await! Which does she take first?
1211211111212212112211112122.title: Which one?

choices: VS CYMNIO, BEING OF GOOD AND EVIL
12112111112122121122111121222.content:
J enters the chamber labeled GOOD AND EVIL, emerging into another chamber, whose walls are embedded with clear tubes. Directly ahead of J was another statue, but it seemed different from the living statue encountered prior. Directly in front of the dragon statue was a pedestal with an inscription. It simply read “CYMNIO.” Atop this pedestal, there was a lump of teal-and-purple gemstone, and a hole in the statue’s chest where the lump looked like it fit. So, J does the idiotic movie thing, picks the gemstone up, and inserts it inside the cavity in the statue’s chest. J backs away, expecting the worst, and nothing happens for a good few seconds, when suddenly a pulse of blue light followed by another flash, this time purple in color. The tubes on the wall began to randomly light up either blue or purple, and the screech of moving stone, and the statue began to not move, but crack, revealing that the statue was a cover for something much more threatening than a living statue. The ancient stone began to fall away, revealing more and more of this new threat, when suddenly, J is assaulted by a booming, screeching, masculine voice: WHO HAS FREED ME?
J answers: “I did.”
“MY NAME IS CYMNIO, BEING OF GOOD AND EVIL COMBINED. THANK YOU FOR FREEING ME. I ASSUME YOU ARE SOME KIND OF TREASURE HUNTER?”
J: “no, I am here to become the queen of dragons.”
Cymnio: “IN THAT CASE, YOU MUST BE LOOKING FOR A TRIAL. BEYOND US FOUR IS THE TREASURE BEYOND ALL OTHERS, AND WE ARE THE GUARDIANS OF SAID TREASURE. IN ORDER TO GAIN ACCESS TO THIS TREASURE, EACH OF US MUST BE DEFEATED.”
J: “...”
Cymnio: “ WHAT ARE YOU WAITING FOR, LET’S GET THE SHOW GOING!”
12112111112122121122111121222.title: The trial

12112111112122122.content:
June moaned in orgasmic ecstasy as the dragon thrusted his tongue deeply inside her. The dragon was pleased too, not because of her pleasure, but because she tasted so good.

The dragon withdrew his tongue, and took June's feet and legs up into it's maw, slowly drawing her inside him feet first. Somehow, this only made June come harder, shuddering with waves of sheer pleasure as more and more of her disappeared into the dragon. Finally, only her head was sticking out of the dragon's maw, and she pulled herself together enough to ask "Oh, why?", before the last of her was gone.

The dragon swallowed, and then sat to rest a moment. Devouring such a large meal was very tiring. But, he thought a moment, before saying, "Because, I needed a meal more than a Queen."
12112111112122122.title: Not the King

121121111122.content:
June cast about the cave, looking for materials she could build a raft out of.

Eventually she found some old wooden planks nearby, and was so engrossed in binding them together that she failed to notice the enormous serpent rising out of the water and slithering towards her. She did hear its hiss when it was very close and preparing to strike. She turned, and had only enough time to register complete surpise before the giant serpent devoured her with one bite, before it turned to slither back toward the pool.

Inside the serpent, she struggled to cut her way out with her sword, but the serpent's stomach held her arms firmly at her sides. The serpent's stomach acids tingled, not unpleasently, as she felt her skin, hair, and deeper things begin to liquify, she thought that perhaps this wasn't as bad a way to go as it could have been.
121121111122.title: Pay more attention next time.

1211211112.content:
June coughed and gagged, and Keer'el broke off his stream of smoke and looked disappointed.

"Sad - I had hopes one of you four girls would become the Queen of Dragons. I suppose we shall have to continue to wait until more humans come to our island."

June panicked, but could not escape the dragon's coils. Keer'el gazed down at June, and June, once she looked in the dragon's eyes instantly relaxed and felt strangely peaceful, even though she knew her doom was upon her.

Still gazing upon June, Keer'el loosened his tail and grasped her with his strong foreclaws, lifting her up into his maw, slowly swallowing her whole. June stayed in a peaceful trance up until the end, even as the dragon's stomach acids dissolved her body.

The dragon spirit looked on, and thought, "What a shame. I guess we will have to keep waiting for our chosen one."
1211211112.title: June is not the one

12112112.content:
The dragon looked down at June, who reached up to stroke the dragon's muzzle.

The dragon coo'ed softly, before wrapping its tongue around June's arm.

June looked up into the dragon's eyes, hypnotized by their swirling colors. The dragon gazed into June's eyes for a few moments, before lowering its maw to engulf June's arm. The rest of her followed, though June did not scream or struggle, as she was captivated by the great silver's beauty. She slid down the dragon's throat, and felt only warmth as the dragon's stomach acids went to work on her, the dragon's entralling charm holding her still until the very end.
12112112.title: Being Dragon Food Isn't So Bad

1211212.content:
June cried and mourned for her friend, heedless of the passage of time.

Eventually, though, she saw the sun going down and the need to seek shelter slowly dawned on her. She was already getting chilly. It was not cold, but she was naked.

She looked around a bit before finding a small cave. She had just stepped inside when it dawned on her than that the four large rocks at the entrance weren't rocks at all, but teeth, when the gigantic dragon's mouth snapped shut, and swallowed her whole.

The gigantic black dragon roused itself, wishing that all its meals were that easy, before heading off into the jungle to hunt.
1211212.title: That's not a cave, June.

121122.content:
Moving with lightning speed the python quickly coiled around June, her entire body disappearing into the writhing mass of python coils.

Floral roared and rushed to aid her new friend, but the python slapped her in the head with its tail, knocking the dragon out cold.

The python did not squeeze its victim. Apparently it liked its meals alive and wriggling. June screamed and squirmed in the snake's coils as its enormous head came down toward her. The snake looked June in the eyes as it flicked its tongue over her face, before opening its mouth wide and cutting off her screams as its mouth slid down over her face.

June's kicking feet were the last part of her to disappear into the python, who, satiated, slithered off to digest its meal.
121122.title: Snake Food

1212.content:
Floral roared as she leaped toward the wasps to defend June, but they just flew around her, grabbing June and carrying her off toward a giant mountain in the center of the island.

June screamed, but fell silent when she realized it wasn't going to do any good. She wondered what would happen to her.

About twenty minutes later, she found out when she arrived at a huge wasps nest on the side of the mountain. She screamed again when the wasp carrying her landed near a cell in the nest containing a giant, four foot was larva.

She struggled to get free, but the wasp held her tight as the larva slowly swallowed her head first, abruptly cutting off her screams. A few minutes later she was gone entirely, and the wasp flew off in search of more food.

The dragon spirit thought sadly, "What a shame, she should have picked a stronger dragon to befriend."
1212.title: A Larval End

122.content:
A great many small, hatchling dragons of all colors suddenly swarmed around June, but Floral roared and sent them scurrying away. Floral wanted June for herself.

June looked at Floral, thankful her new friend had saved her from the tiny, bloodsucking dragons. She quickly found out why, when Floral suddenly pounced, pinning her to the ground.

June said, "Oh Floral, why?". Floral growled softly, as if to say, "Because, you're more tasty without those yucky clothes on", before opening her mouth wide and swalling her latest meal whole.

Floral turned and rejoined the rest of the dragons, enjoying the tropical sun as she slept off her latest meal.
122.title: No Bloodsuckers will have June, She's too Tast

choices: Likes her and wants to be her friend
Likes her taste and eats her
13.content:
Keira walked around nervously, her bare feet leaving indents in the sand (after ditching her sandles). She said to herself, "Okay, you can do this. It's just a matter of finding a dragon that likes you so you can make it out of here alive. I just hope I don't become dragon chow."

Suddenly, she heard a noise from behind a large boulder, and froze. "Take it easy. It's probably nothing to worry about... I hope."

She heard the sound of soft feet walking on the sand, and a long, emerald green and white serpentine dragon emerged. Keira froze again, the dragon just looked at her, it almost resemebled a Chinese/Japanese type dragon. It made a light roar, almost like a faint screech, and approached her. It lashed out its tongue and licked her, until it accidently tore off her tank top and bra. It continued to lick her, and Keira wasn't sure if it liked her or was checking her out to be it's next meal. "Oh lord, please, don't eat me." she mumbled.

The dragon...
13.title: Keira's incounter

131.content:
The dragon stopped licking her and started to nuzzle its head by her exposed breast: it was friendly. Keira breathed a sigh of relief, "Oh thank you. I'm glad you're friendly, I thought I was done for. Hey!" The dragon started to lick her face, "Okay, okay, I'm glad to meet you too. Cut it out! Please, that tickles!" The dragon stopped, Keira wiped off all the dragon saliva from her body.

After cleaning herself up, she said to the dragon, "Now, are you a boy or a girl? Roar once for a boy and twice for a girl." It roared once, "Okay, so you're a boy. Now for a name, you'll need one if you're going to help me. How about Airblast? Do you like it?" He nodded, "Okay then, Airblast it is. If you can fly, why don't you show me around the island, so I can get a feel for the land, 'kay?" The dragon lowered his head, gesturing to her to get on, she climbed up. With a spring, Airblast flew into the air, now Keira could see the whole island, along with seeing how long Airblast was: at least 50 feet. The island was broken up into different sections for each element and weather condition: a volcano, an icy wasteland, a desert, a rainforest, the beachy outerring, a bone yard, and lastly, a mountain smack in the middle of the island.

"Cool. I wonder how the others are faring... Huh?"

She could see a faint image coming at her, she didn't know if it was a friend or foe.

It is...
131.title: New pal Airblast

choices: Go To Each Section Of The Island
1311.content:
The image suddenly resolves itself into the strange Dragon Spirit that Keira and the other girls meet on the beach.

"Congratulations on befriending a dragon." The Spirit says cheerfully. "You have overcome your first obstacle, but now it only gets harder."

"Um, I have a question." Keira says. "What exactly do we have to do to become the Queen of Dragons? You never told us."

The Dragon Spirit blinks in confusion and says, "I didn't tell you? Oh, I'm sorry it must have slipped my mind! What you have to do is..."
1311.title: Guidance

13111.content:
"You see this island is divided into six sections, a volcano, an icy wasteland, a desert, a rainforest, a bone yard, and a mountain in the center." The Dragon Spirit says. "To become the Queen of Dragons you must travel to the first five sections of the island and find all five of the lost pieces of the Dragon Crown that have been hidden there." The Dragon Spirit is suddenly interrupted when Keira bursts out laughing.

"What’s so funny?" The Dragon Spirit asks.

Keira manages to stop laughing and replies, "I'm sorry, but this whole thing is like some video game or something."

"Yeah, I know what you mean." The Dragon Spirit sighs and responds. "But despite that the dangers are still real! So take them seriously! Anyway, once you have all the pieces of the crown you must take them to the cave at the top of the mountain in the center of the island. That’s all I can tell you, after that you're on your own." With those final words the Dragon Spirit disappears.

"Well Airblast, I don't suppose you know where any of the pieces are?" Keira asks her dragon only to see him shake his head back and forth. "Yeah I didn't think so. Oh well, the rainforest section is closest so maybe we should start our search there or we could just begin somewhere else."
13111.title: The Path To The Queen Of Dragons

choices: A giant red dragon with a massive claw
A long blue and white serpentine dragon
131111.content:
Airblast points his tail to the rainforest, Keira nods, "Okay then, to the rainforest!" Airblast swooped down and into the forest, letting the young rocket mechanic down.

For about an hour, they searched the huge section of the island, but no luck. Finally, Keira sat down, sweating and tired, "Whew, I'm beat... Say Airblast, maybe you can sense this crown piece?" Airblast shook his head, "Figured as much. You know, I wonder what's so special about that mountain in the center. Maybe the Dragon Spirit knows... but how do I talk to him...?" Airblast closed his eyes and suddenly, the Dragon Spirit showed up. "Yes, do you have a question?" he asked, Keira nodded, "Yeah, what's so special about the mountain and this crown?" "The crown is a sacred dragon treasure, and if you have it, the guardians of the Ultimate Power, the Four Sacred Dragons, will allow you to obtain it. But if you misuse it, they will destroy you. That is all I can say." and with that, he vanished.

"Okay then, now I know why I need this crown. Thanks Airblast." Suddenly, Keira's stomach growled, she clutched it, "Ooohhh, I am so hungry. I haven't had a meal in a while. Keira woke up in a crystal cave full of hot springs, and there, standing above her was the figure who saved her. It was...
13111121212112211.title: Onward!

choices: The Ice Crackes under Keira's feet!
an Ice type monster apears, hungry and ready to attack!
131111212121122111.content:
"Hello again. How are you feeling?" Drake asked. Keira shot up and embraced him, "Oh Drake! I am so glad you're all right!" Drake's tail lashed out straight, his eyes widened and his pupils shrank, "K-Keira... D-Do you m-m-mind letting go of m-me? I am s-still in a l-l-lot of p-pain." Keira quickly retracted her grip, "Oh, so sorry! I-I didn't mean to..." Drake shushed her with his finger, "'S'all, just watch it next time."

Keira helped dress his wounds, "Thanks, that feels better. I see you made it without any trouble, except for nearly turning into a icicle." Drake said, licking one of his wounds to clean it. Keira sighed, "If it wasn't for you, not only would I still be in Genwakumemu's stomach, but carved up by that dragon, and nearly frozen to death. I have to find a way to thank you. But first, tell me, where are we, exactly?" Drake chuckled, "A crystal cave filled with magic energy crystal, or know as dragonite crystals. It's a little place I come to every now and then to relax and take a dip in the warm, healing hot springs."

"Healing hot springs?" "Yeah, the dragonite is used for various purposes. Such as healing deadly wounds, making you more resistant to heat and cold, and reviving a fainted dragon. Since the dragonite is in this cave of hot springs, the dragonite's power is liquified into the water, thus healing hot springs."

"Cool. Anyway, you said it makes you more resistant to heat or cold, right? How can I use it for that purpose, since I'm practically running around naked in the middle of a blizzard?" "Simple, break off a piece and eat it. As your stomach digests it, the properities will melt into you, thus transforming your body's physical strength. Give it a try." Keira walked over to a small piece of crystal, broke it off, and swallowed it.

In minutes, she could feel her body change from weak and frail to strong and resistant, she even gained a few more muscles. "Woah, awesome!" She walked over to Drake and sat down next to him, "Drake, how did you survive against that dragon?" "Oh, that. I used the legendary power of SinnSaber ot destoy it, but not before that blasted dragon gave me a good thrashing. But I'm fine now."

He then reached into his bag and pulled out a map of the island, and unrolled it. "Okay, here is the Ice Sector, and were here. Now, the crown piece is guarded here, in the middle of the sector, by Ice Leviathans. Trust me, one hit of their Freeze Breath, and you will be a icicle. In order to beat them, we need to first go to the Ice Village, just a little to the west from there. Once we're there, we have to find the Water Elemental Key. But the trip is dangerous, filled with thin ice, ice monsters, frost dragons, and leviathans. We will have to be careful if we want to survive."

"Water Elemental Key? What's that, and why do we have to find it?" "First off, we have to find it if we want to stop the Ice Leviathans. It will unlock a new power in us for better battles." Keria laughed, "What's so funny?" She managed to choke, "I'm sorry, but like I told the Dragon Spirit, this sounds like a video game." Drake gave her an odd look, "Whatever. But if you want to survive here, unlocking the power of the Elemental Keys is crucial. All dragons can do it, when they learn how to use it. I, myself, have been able to use one; the Wind Key. Anyway, once that key is in our possession, those ice creatures won't stand a chance."

Keira Yawned ""Okay then, when morning comes, we'll head on out."

Drake Yawned too "You look tired, would you like to go to sleep?" "Yes please."

Drake picked Keira up and slowly deposited her into his mouth, Keira fell asleep just as he started pushing her feet in...

The next morning, Keira woke up before Drake. But jostling around in his stomach for a bit woke him up too. After Keira has been taken out of Drake and cleaned up they headed out on thier journey. However, when they reached a certain part of the icy wasteland, something happened.
131111212121122111.title: A bashed up Drake

choices: a icy sea creature snaps up Keira in its jaws
he manages to pull her out and take her to a safe place
1311112121211221111.content: Suddenly, the ice starts to crack under Keira's bare feet, and it breaks, plunging her into the deadly arctic waters. She flails to get back up, "Drake! Help me!" Drake reaches out and grabs her hand, and begins to pull. Then...
1311112121211221111.title: The Ice Crackes under Keira's feet!

choices: a topless female Ice type Hybrid
13111121212112211112.content:
To prevent himself from falling in, Drake digs his spike heels into the ice, and pulls with all his might. Finally, he manages to get Keira out of the water, and not a moment too soon. She was already a dark blue, and just where she was, a sea creature swam by, furious that it just lost a free meal. Keira passed out, Drake scooped her up, and carried her off.

Keira woke up with a start, her body had finally recovered from the frozen shock. She was inside Drake again, she felt him sigh with relief and pulled her out of his stomach with a sudden urgency. When she was finally out, she looked at her surroundings. She was in a different dragonite cave, she could tell since there were no hot springs here. She huddled by the fire that Drake had built, as Drake said "I see you're awake. Good. I was afraid that your body might not have recovered from the shock. Looks like that dragonite you ate really helped." Drake sat down and opened his bag, some arctic fruits rolled out and two large things with many sections, they looked like a cross between a watermellon and an acorn squash.

"Uh, Drake, what exactly are those things?" Keira said nervously. "Lunch." Drake simply said, giving her a sly smile. "Translation, please." Drake picked on up, tossed it in the air, and exhailed fire, cooking it up. He placed it near her, and did the same with the other, placing it near him. He then reached into his bag and pulled out two thick bamboo straws, giving one to her. "Enjoy."

Keira looked utterly confused, until Drake tapped the thing with the straw, and it opened up to reveal it was a giant pillbug, filled with yellow meat! "Ah, hot and crispy frost pillbugs, haven't had one in a while." he chuckled, looking at Keira's revolted look. Using the straw, he started to suck up the meat, making Keira sick to her stomach, she groaned, "Drake, you dragons will eat just about anything." "Including you." Drake smirked, "Nice comeback... How... is it?" "You might like it. Don't love it until you try it, haha."

Keira gulped, and looked at her pillbug, then her stomach roared in hunger. "I guess I don't have a choice. I guess it would be nice to have a hot meal..." She repeated what Drake did, and took a small taste, it actually tasted pretty good, for a giant insect. She managed to swallow all the meat when Drake picked up the shell and started eating that too, "Like I said before, you'll eat just about anything. Is the shell... good?" "Yeah, try it." She gulped again, and took a bite, surprisingly, it tasted like a ranch potato chip.

After she finally gulped down her strange meal, she fell asleep in Drake.

She was roughly awakened as she was pulled out of Drake, again, with a sudden urgency. "Wake up, we've got company." They looked out at the cave tunnel, and out of the dark tunnel came a...
13111121212112211112.title: he manages to pull her out and take her to a s...

131111212121122111121.content:
They both gasped to see a beaten up female Hybrid walk in. She was defently an Ice type, judging by her ice blue hair, icicle shaped wings, and a tail with an icy spike at the end. She stumbled towards them, moaning in pain, until she tripped and fell into Drake's arms, "P-Please... help me..." and she passed out.

Drake left her in Keira's hands while he searched for another frost pillbug to feed her with. When she finally woke up, Keira said, "Don't move too much, you're in bad shape." She moaned again, too tired and hurt to talk, so Keira took that as a "Okay".

Drake finally reappeared, cooked up the pillbug, and hand fed it to her, she graciously ate it. When she finally had enough strength to talk, she said, "Please, I need your help. My village is under a terrible threat. The Ice Leviathans are moving towards the village, hungry and blood-thirsty. I need you to stop them, before its too late. I was asked to give this to a Null type Hybrid male who was Sennkoh-Coola's apprentice. I sure hope that is you..."

She reached into her torn up bag and pulled out two things: the crown piece and the Water Elemental Key. Drake took them, putting both in his bag with the other crown piece, "Tell me, why did those sea demons leave their post? It's not like them to do such a thing." She responded, "I don't know... They have been acting differently lately... Almost like the time over 100 years ago when Shinryu was released..." "Shinryu. I sure hope it is not him."

"Who's Shinryu?" Keira asked, Drake explained, "Shinryu is the Ultimate Dragon of Darkness. Over 100 years ago, he brought death and distruction to this world. It was then that the Dragon of Light, Sennkoh-Coola, the original one, appeared, and finally managed to seal Shinryu in the sacred stone, the Dragon's Soul Stone. There is a reason why the crown pieces were scattered, since they are the key to the Shrine of the Four Sacred Dragons, where Shinryu is kept. You remember that meteor shower about a week ago?" "Remember? How could I forget, I nearly got vaped in that shower." "Right, anyway, an ancient lore states that if the northern sky is filled with shooting stars, the seal to Shinryu is breaking. I didn't make the connection at first."

The Hybrid nodded, "It also says that when the seal is breaking or is broken, Shinryu can manipulate any dragon's mind, expecially if they are dark types. That might be the reason why some dragons, like the Ice Leviathans, are acting unusual." Keira looked a little worried, "Does that mean the Dragon Spirit is leading me to my death and the destruction to the world?" Drake shook his head, "No, of course not. He is mearly testing you, to see if you have a pure heart or a dark heart. If your heart is pure, you won't release Shinryu, even for the eternal glory and whatnot. He's just seeing if you can be trusted. Nothing more, nothing less."

Keira sighed in relief, "Whew, I thought that he was evil for a minute there." Drake sniffed the air, "Well, we can't go very far for a little while, there's a blizzard outside, unless you want to freeze. It would be best to stay here until it clears." The Hybrid girl shook her head, "No! We can't stay here! We have to get back to my village and stop those ice creatures!" Drake turned to Keira, "Well, what do you want to do?"

Keira scratched the back of her head, "Um... I guess we should..."
131111212121122111121.title: a topless female Ice type Hybrid

1311112121211221111211.content:
Keira shurgged, "I mean, if the Ice Village is under a threat of attack, shouldn't we get moving? It might not last much longer if we stay here." Drake sighed in defeat, "I guess you've got a point. We'll leave ASAP. By the way, what's your name?" "Oh, my name's Icsashaka, but call me Icsa. Thank you for your help, I will repay you two someday." Icsa stated. Drake reached over and broke off a piece of dragonite, "Eat this to heal your wounds faster." She ate it and they headed into the blizzard, braving the firece winds and subarctic air.

They walked for an hour in the killer blizzard, following Icsa, until Keira asked, "Where is it? I don't see it anywhere. Are we going around in circles?" Icsa snapped, then moaned, "No! I mean... I dunno... Maybe this wasn't such a good idea..." Suddenly, they could see something ahead of them, "Is that the village?" Drake asked. Isca looked harder, "I think it is..."Where will this story go next? Your choices are below...
1311112121211221111211.title: go out into the blizzard

choices: Use the Dragons to save Keira
Too late, Keira is as good as Digested
13111121212112211112111.content:
Icsa's stomach dropped below her navel as a giant Ice Leviathan's head appeared. "I suggest we run... like, NOW!!!" Drake agreed, and both dodged it, but Keira wasn't so lucky.

"What are you talking ab-- oh dammit..." Before she could move, a pair of strong jaws snapped around her, and she was trapped in the ice creature's mouth. "DRAKE! ICSA! HELP!" she screamed, but the Ice Leviathan made a massive swallow, sending her down into its throat. Drake and Icsa watched as they saw the lump that was Keira sliding down the long throat into the larger body of the ice creature.

The Ice Leviathan seemd quite pleased with itself, and lowered it head for a nap. Inside it, Kiera was struggling to get out of its stomach, but the ice creature seemed to injoy it, and simply belched.

On the other hand, Drake started attacking it with his spear and Icsa with her bow and arrows, but to no avail. "It's no use. Its scales are just too thick. I could use SinnSaber, but I might anhiliate Keira as well." Drake growled. Icsa said, "Maybe we can use her dragons to help us?" Drake looked at the dragons, "Maybe, if it's not too late."
13111121212112211112111.title: A savage ice creature

131111212121122111121112.content:
Too late. The Ice Leviathan's stomach went straight to work on poor Keira. She kicked, screamed, and flailed, but to no avail. All too soon, she lost her strength, and fainted, and the acids dissolved her body into a liquified mush.

Drake looked at Icsa, she said, "I guess we were too slow. Sorry about your girlfriend, but that makes you available. Well, come on, since she's dead, we have to get to the village posthaste." Drake sighed, "Sorry Keira, I was hoping that you and I could stay together. Farewell, young one."
131111212121122111121112.title: Too late, Keira is as good as Digested

13111121212112211112112.content:
Icsa sighed, "It's the village. Come on, just a bit further." Drake and Keira nodded and followed her into the village and into the chief elder's hut.

The elder smiled, "I see you have done a good job, Icsa. Now, since you are the Sennkoh-Coola's apprentice, we need your help in defeating those Ice Leviathans. If you can defeat them, we will be most grateful." "I will do my best." Drake stated. "That's a good boy. Now, Komachio, please escort our guests to their resting chamber, we will need them to be at top notch in order to destroy those demons." "Yes elder." stated a male Hybrid, and he lead them away, Icsa remained where she was.

She turned to the elder, "You said you wanted to see me after I completed my mission. What is it?" The elder looked at her, "Icsa, you have been a warrior here for some time, and I feel that it is only best on what I have to tell you. Icsa you're being..."
13111121212112211112112.title: the village

131111212121122111121121.content:
Icsa's mind froze as he said that. She finally recovered, almost stammering, "Banished!? Why? I didn't do anything wrong! Why are you banishing me!?" The elder looked at her with a fiery glare, causing Icsa to recoil, "It was not my dicision, it was your captain's. He feels that your usefulness has worn out, and he feels that you cannot continue on as an Ice Warrior. I am sorry, but that is the choice he made. I expect you out of this village by the time the leviathans are destroyed. You will leave with Drake and his friend, is that clear?" "B-but...!" The elder made a low snarl, Icsa gave up, "Yes elder..." and she dashed out, weeping her eyes out.

She managed to find Drake and Keira and told them what the elder said. "What!? Banishment! You didn't do anything wrong! Why?" Keira asked, amazed. Drake answered for the sobbing Icsa, "The Ice Clan is big on two things: honor and skill. Apparently, either Icsa accidently dishonored her leader or wasn't good enough to continue. I feel the same way, it was unjust and unfair, but those are their customs. I guess we now have a new ally. Don't worry Icsa, you're always welcome with us." Icsa hiccupped, "T-thank you. I h-hope I can be of some u-use."

Suddenly, they heard screaming outside, and they dashed out to see...
131111212121122111121121.title: Banished

1311112121211221111211211.content: "What the.... Oh damn this.." said Keira. The Ice Leviathans quickly snapped in fury about Keira and Drake. One was too fast for Keira and snapped her up. The lump in the Ice Leviathan's neck grew. "NO NO AND NO! I wont die like this, not now." She felt hopeless as she landed on something. "What is this? What the... a frozen fish? She peered across the stomach and saw something gleaming. "Whats that? Huh?" The stomach was starting to churn and she cursed as she raced across the leviathan's stomach. Her only hope if that was a weapon... It was a....
1311112121211221111211211.title: the Ice Leviathans

13111121212112211112112111.content: "An sword?" She waved it in the air and saw that it sparkled. "Is this enchanted? Probably..." as Drake shouted "Keira! Do you hear me?!" Keira responded "Yes! I do! I found a sword probably enchanted.... I'll try slashing at the leviathan's stomach." She slashed as hard as she could but to no avail it didn't show any effect... Just as she was about to give up, Airblast roared loudly and she had new found courage. The sword glowed brightly and Keira said "I wonder..." She slashed at the stomach and to her surprised it opened! The leviathan roared so loud it deafened everyone. All was silent for a few moments. When everybody gained their hearing back Keira continued to slash though the leviathan. The other leviathans ran away at the sight of her holding a sword that killed one of their brethren. She was proud for the first time all through this damn adventure. Drake asked her how she managed to slash the leviathans nearly steel tough stomach. She replied that she had courage when she heard Airblast roaring and the blade seemed to be glowing with power when she got that courage. Drake laughed and said "That must be one of the Khan swords." Keira replied "What are Khan swords?" Drake replied "The Khan swords were forged with the most toughest material ever. The material they used were rare and kept a secret. Khan swords only were forged by the dragons. Hmph.. the soldier that had that sword probably perished inside the leviathans stomach..." We should be heading our way now...
13111121212112211112112111.title: An enchanted Sword

choices: A Frozen Lake with some sort of stone in the middle
131111212121122111121121111.content:
"you didn't need me to save you this time."Drake said "what?"Keira replied. "you saved yourself from a monsters stomach,about time too."Keira started to laugh, but she notices that Drake isn't even chuckling. Thats when she relizese that he must like the fact that he's the one to save her. She stoped laughing and added "you told me that their are lots of ice creatures out there," "so?"he answerd, "so, that means that i'm gonna get Scared alot you know.I'm not qiuet ready to be on this island yet."She holds his hands as they continue walking, and he folds his hands in with hers. "besides I think that was the only chance of courage I could handle without you." He lets go of her hand and he said "lets go find the ice key!" All five of them walked through the harsh cold, but they didn't seem to care. After all the things he did for her,Keira didn't mind swallowing some of her pride. Later they were walking down a path that was so beutiful and otherworldly, but she stoped appreciating it when they could makeout some sort of image through the snow.
it was...
131111212121122111121121111.title: Go find the ice key...

1311112121212.content:
Just as the two of them close in for a kiss, something come crashing through the trees, startling them. "What the!?" Keira sputtered, and they looked to see a 20 foot bear-like dragon with razor sharp claws and souless yellow eyes. Drake prepared himself for battle, "Keira! Get to safety! You and your dragons best head as far north as you can. Soon you will reach the Ice Sector, you should be safe there! Now GIT!"

Keira wouldn't move, "I can't just leave you here to die! Let me help!" Drake placed his claw in front of her, "No, you have to head on. Now that you have the Rainforest Sector's crown piece, you need to find the others, and the Ice Sector is the closest. Go, I'll be fine, I've come out of worse scrapes before. Let's just hope my training as the Sennkoh-Coola's apprentice saves me today. Now go, before that dragon rips you in half!"

Keira reluctantly moved, "I won't forget this. I promise, if you survive, I will repay your kindness." She started running, following Airblast and Canopus north, Drake smiled slightly, "At least she should be okay. I just hope she is built for hell's cold breath when she arrives there." He turned to the bear dragon, "I really don't want to use this, since it could kill me, but what choice do I have?" Suddenly, his right forearm started to glow...

Keira was running as fast as her bare feet would allow, Airblast and Canopus flying right next to her. She was also crying, and hoped that Drake knew what he was doing. Finally, she felt a cold blast of wind, and made it to the Ice Sector, but she kept on running, even though she was freezing.

Finally, she stops, too cold to continue, her body completly numb. She flopped down in the foot deep snow, shivering, still crying, until she passes out. Canopus and Airblast coil her to keep her warm, hoping that's enough. Hours later, Keira was frozen solid, but then a figure approached, scooped her up, and carried her off, Airblast and Canopus followed.

Keira woke up in a crystal cave full of hot springs, and there, standing above her was the figure who saved her. It was...

Drake finally reappeared, cooked up the pillbug, and hand fed it to her, she graciously ate it. When she finally had enough strength to talk, she said, "Please, I need your help. My village is under a terrible threat. The Ice Leviathans are moving towards the village, hungry and blood-thirsty. I need you to stop them, before its too late. I was asked to give this to a Null type Hybrid male who was Sennkoh-Coola's apprentice. I sure hope that is you..."

She reached into her torn up bag and pulled out two things: the crown piece and the Water Elemental Key. Drake took them, putting both in his bag with the other crown piece, "Tell me, why did those sea demons leave their post? It's not like them to do such a thing." She responded, "I don't know... They have been acting differently lately... Almost like the time over 100 years ago when Shinryu was released..." "Shinryu. I sure hope it is not him."

"Who's Shinryu?" Keira asked, Drake explained, "Shinryu is the Ultimate Dragon of Darkness. Over 100 years ago, he brought death and distruction to this world. It was then that the Dragon of Light, Sennkoh-Coola, the original one, appeared, and finally managed to seal Shinryu in the sacred stone, the Dragon's Soul Stone. There is a reason why the crown pieces were scattered, since they are the key to the Shrine of the Four Sacred Dragons, where Shinryu is kept. You remember that meteor shower about a week ago?" "Remember? How could I forget, I nearly got vaped in that shower." "Right, anyway, an ancient lore states that if the northern sky is filled with shooting stars, the seal to Shinryu is breaking. I didn't make the connection at first."

The Hybrid nodded, "It also says that when the seal is breaking or is broken, Shinryu can manipulate any dragon's mind, expecially if they are dark types. That might be the reason why some dragons, like the Ice Leviathans, are acting unusual." Keira looked a little worried, "Does that mean the Dragon Spirit is leading me to my death and the destruction to the world?" Drake shook his head, "No, of course not. He is mearly testing you, to see if you have a pure heart or a dark heart. If your heart is pure, you won't release Shinryu, even for the eternal glory and whatnot. He's just seeing if you can be trusted. Nothing more, nothing less."

Keira sighed in relief, "Whew, I thought that he was evil for a minute there." Drake sniffed the air, "Well, we can't go very far for a little while, there's a blizzard outside, unless you want to freeze. It would be best to stay here until it clears." The Hybrid girl shook her head, "No! We can't stay here! We have to get back to my village and stop those ice creatures!" Drake turned to Keira, "Well, what do you want to do?"

Keira scratched the back of her head, "Um... I guess we should..."
13111121212121121.title: Dragon Isle's History

131111212121211211.content:
Keira shurgged, "I mean, if the Ice Village is under a threat of attack, shouldn't we get moving? It might not last much longer if we stay here." Drake sighed in defeat, "I guess you've got a point. We'll leave ASAP. By the way, what's your name?" "Oh, my name's Icsashaka, but call me Icsa. Thank you for your help, I will repay you two someday." Icsa stated. Drake reached over and broke off a piece of dragonite, "Eat this to heal your wounds faster." She ate it and they headed into the blizzard, braving the firece winds and subarctic air.

They walked for an hour in the killer blizzard, following Icsa, until Keira asked, "Where is it? I don't see it anywhere. Are we going around in circles?" Icsa snapped, then moaned, "No! I mean... I dunno... Maybe this wasn't such a good idea..." Suddenly, they could see something ahead of them, "Is that the village?" Drake asked. Isca looked harder, "I think it is..."

The elder made a low snarl, Icsa gave up, "Yes elder..." and she dashed out, weeping her eyes out.

She managed to find Drake and Keira and told them what the elder said. "What!? Banishment! You didn't do anything wrong! Why?" Keira asked, amazed. Drake answered for the sobbing Icsa, "The Ice Clan is big on two things: honor and skill. Apparently, either Icsa accidently dishonored her leader or wasn't good enough to continue. As soon as she turned around Drake went behind her and grabbed her.

Keira shouted "What are you doing?!" as Drake began to lift her up.

"Eating of course. I didn't really want you to get me dinner, you ARE my dinner," he said as he licked his lips.

With that Drake open his mouth up wide enough and stuck her head in. His tongue licking her face as he began to pull her shoulders in.

Keira shouted "No! You can't do this! Airblast! Canopus! Help me!!!"

But the two dragons had curled up and fallen asleep and Keira's voice was stiffled as Drake pulled her in.

Drake began to drool as he ran his tongue over her breasts that were now in his mouth. He loved her flavor. He had never tasted anything like it. Keira's head was pushed into his throat as Drake gave a big swallow. Keira screamed and thrashed about only adding to Drake's pleasure.

Keira couldn't believe what was happening to her. She knew she should have had him come with her but he seemed to much of a rogue to her and now she was going to be digested by him.
Keira felt her stomach enter Drake's mouth and she did the only thing that she thought might save her. "I'll let you come with me and help you with whatever it is you want if you please let me out." she screamed.

Drake responded by pushing her farther into his mouth now only her thighs and feet were left outside his mouth as he ran his tongue over her firm bottom. Keira knew that he wasn't going to let her out and began to cry.

Drake felt her stop struggling and knew that she had accepted her fate. He swallowed again and used his tongue to pull her in so that now only her feet were left outside wiggling around. He reached up his hand and lightly tickled her feet making her wiggle around involuntarily inside of him. With one final gulp Keira slipped fully into his mouth and down his throat into his waiting stomach.

Keira was now completely inside his stomach and curled into a ball. Crying softly she began to feel the acid pouring into the sac. Drake gave a belch and laid down rubbing his now enlarged stomach. "You tasted pretty good. I might have to let you out just so I could eat you again" Drake said chuckling to himself.

Keira could feel him rubbing and fell asleep to the feeling before she was able to say anything back slowly digesting inside this hybrid.

1312.title: Foe

13121.content:
Keira was alive, but she was in great pain. Obviously, most every bone in her body was broken.

The dragons continued their battle, uncaring that she was no longer among them. Keira cursed Airblast, then began to cry. Night was falling, and she knew predators would soon be on the prowl.

She didn't know how right she was. Her screams may not have alerted the dragons, but a pack of jackals were very curious about the noise in their usual quiet habitat. The pack cautiously surrounded her, and when the depths of her injuries became obvious, moved in for the kill.

Keira's eyes opened wide as the pack moved in, and her screams erupted through the night as the jackals joyfully fed upon her defenseless body.

1312321111.content:
Finding her was easy, folding his wings into a dive Airblast crashed down in front of her.

Amelia backed away, brandishing a heavy stick threateningly. “No, don't be afraid” he told her, “I'm here to help you.” Amelia gave him a suspicious look, but lowered the branch slightly. “I was Keira's ally but... well... she got eaten by a snake.”

“If that's the level of help you offer, I think I might be better off on my own.” she lowered the stick and walked towards him.

Yes, come closer dinner. Airblast thought, trying not to drool at the idea. Empty and knowing food was on the way his stomach growled, loudly and impatiently. Amelia froze realising she had been tricked, before she could raise the stick Airblast pounced, pinning her arms to her sides then wrapping his tail round them and squeezing tight.

Letting go with his claws Airblast paused to admire his soon-to-be-meal, pinned within the coils of his tail all the tasty morsel could do was wriggle from side to side like a fish held above the water. He was squeezing her so tight she could barely breathe, despite this she managed to gasp out one word.

Airblast...

Pulling Amelia closer he directed her head into his mouth. Amelia groaned as her vision was filled with Airblast's throat. Her face pressed against his esophagus, it opened, taking in her head then tightening again.

Feeling her in his throat Airblast began to speed up, his jaws sliding effortlessly down her back as neck, shoulders, breasts and forearms disappeared into his throat. No longer needed, his tail released its hold and Amelia took several large gulps of the stale air in Airblast throat.

Recovering quickly Amelia began to thrash wildly. Airblast waited patiently as her struggles worked her deeper towards his belly. When he reached her hips however he decided to hurry things up, placing one paw on her rump he began to push her down.

Her buttocks brushed against the roof of his mouth, past hard pallet, past soft then with a gulp disappearing from sight. Now only her legs protruded from his mouth. Gulp! Now only her feet. Lick, gulp! The feet were at the back of his mouth. Airblast closed his jaws and tilted back his head. Gulp!

The esophagus closed behind her sealing her in, then slowly began to push her down. Airblast closed his eyes in pleasure as his struggling prey slid towards his gut. The sphincter opened and Amelia was pushed into the stomach.

“But if I let you go Amelia will be all alone, with no-one to keep her company. We can't have that can we?”

As Krystal stared in horror at Airblasts twitching belly, he opened his mouth and in one fluid movement slid his jaws over Krystal's head and down her body. Unable to manage such a large meal in a single mouthful Airblast's jaws closed tight around Krystal's bottom.

Most of Krystal was already in his oesophagus now, throwing his head back he lifted Krystal's legs into the air and watched her kick futilely for a while. A hungry groan came from his stomach, telling him to stop playing swallow her. Two gulps later and Krystal was sliding down his throat.

Krystal tried to struggle as she slid down but the slippery tube was so tight she could barely move, sliding helplessly deeper she found it widened out a bit and the confining walls became softer and spongy, she had arrived in the stomach.

“You idiot!” Amelia's voice rang out from the darkness, although she couldn't see Krystal judged her to be only a few feet away. “Couldn't you have put up a better fight than that?”

“Well your in here to so you can't have done much better.” she pointed out.

Amelia was about to respond when she was interrupted by...
13123211112112.title: Krystal enters Airblast

choices: “Very well lord, in that case I can only wish you a pleasant meal.”

131232111121122.content:
June sat on a rock and looked miserable, she was cold, hungry and tired. She had so far been unable to find a dragon to help her and even if she could, she had no particular desire to become the dragon queen beyond the obvious benefit of not being eaten.

Whoomf. She looked up sharply to see Airblast walking towards her. Standing up she looked around in alarm, was this dragon friendly or had it come to eat her. The large bulge in its tummy and a certain predatory gleam in its eyes suggested the later, but with nowhere to run and no hope of overpowering it her best chance still seemed to be diplomacy.

“Hello?...” she tried. That sounded weak, in no way capturing the respect she felt this creature deserved, it also failed to get any response from the advancing dragon so June tried a different tactic. Stepping forward she bowed to the dragon “Greetings lord. May I know of your name?”

Airblast reached June and stopped, her choice of words and respectful attitude caught his attention and he decided to at least talk to her before devouring her.

“Greetings dinner. You may know my name if you wish but it will not prevent you from joining your companions.” he licked his lips in anticipation, up close June's naked body was quite tempting.

June took a second to gather her courage before responding “I do wish so lord, and also to know if there is any way that I might save myself from my companions fate”

Airblast smiled, he was liking Jane more and more, “Very well, I am Airblast. You, I already know are called Jane, Keira told me about you all before her encounter with a snake. Your other friends are awaiting your presence inside me. But as for your question of avoiding that fate I can think of no service you could preform that would suit me better than the one you shall do so as food.”

As June struggled to think of a reply Airblast opened his mouth and positioned his jaws above her head. As he began to lower himself over June's body she spoke.
131232111121122.title: June's responce

1312321111211221.content:
Airblast smiled to himself as June's words and instead of sliding his jaws over her tasty body as he had done to the other two he started licking her. Beginning with her face then working on her neck then her chest, giving special attention to each breast in turn, then carrying on down to her midsection.

June stood still, there was no way she could escape from the hungry dragon and she hung to the hope that he had changed his mind and that the licking was friendly or that this was some final test of courage and that she would be released any moment now. Besides some part of her was enjoying the attention and she leaned into every lick.

Saliva ran from Airblast's open mouth, down her body and pooled around her feet till by the time he reached her buttocks her whole body was coated in his drool and was as slippery as a fish. At last Airblast stepped back to admire his work, checking that every inch of her was covered in saliva.

June looked at him, questioning whether he would let her go now, but her taste was burning on his tongue and his belly begging for the meal it knew was coming, letting her go was the last thing on his mind. In one quick movement he caught June in his jaws and jerking his head back swallowed her in a single gulp.

Airblast struggled for a moment, trying to suppress his throat's attempt to push June back out, June's slick body made it easier and she slid a few inches deeper, enough to allow his throat to close behind her, from then on it was easy. The massive bulge in his neck began to twitch a June realised what had happened to her, very slowly the awkward lump in Airblast's neck descended as June's soft fleshy body was gently squeezed deeper by muscles in his throat.

Eventually the bulge reached the others in his middle, joining to make one massive distortion in Airblast's otherwise lithe body.

Curling up on a sunny patch of grass Airblast prepared to digest the unfortunate humans.

Keira flew and hit the mountain side. She nearly passed out; however, she pulled herself together and watched Airblast struggle against the snake. "What am I going to do' she thought when she realized that there was an object buried in the pile of rocks next to her. Keira dug it out and she couldn't believe her eyes. There, right in front of her, lay a missile. This gave her an idea. As a rocket engineer, she knew how to separate the warhead from the missile itself. Keira went straight to work. Luckily, the warhead was loosened up a little, so she was able separate it. Finally, when it gave in a came off, she shouted at Airblast,' BACK UP!,' then she charged at the snake which turned to her again and through the warhead at it. What followed next was a thing that dragons rarely get to witness. The usage of human weaponary. A giant fireball was unleashed upon the snake. What used to be a snake was now nothing, except for some burnt gush. Keira; however, had not been very fortunate either. Though some distance away from the explosion, the fireball had touch her only by an centimeter. She was wounded critically anyhow. Death drew near. "Oh Airblast...,' she tried,' I have failed, I have failed you and myself. You were a good friend to me though it wasn't a very long time." Keira... died?

"Death had a stong hold on you, but I was able to bring life back to you with my magic,' Airblast said. Amelia only starred him in the eyes. "You see... I have an ability to fix the fatal wounds of those who I love. The only problem is, my heart is very cold and won't turn easily. You; however, have some kind of influence in me,' Airblast explained.

I never knew such things were even possible. I've only heard of such things in stories. Terrifying, horror stories. The most horrific story is about a bomb which would bring mass destruction. In the story it was detonated and the explosion vapourized flesh and bone within seconds around a large radius. After the explosion the area effected was radioactive for a long time, causing... what was it called again, something... something starting with a "c"... ca... ca" "Cancer?' Keira asked. "Yes, that was it, cancer, a terrible thing. Good that it was only a story." Airblast sighed. "I... don't want to scare you, but...,' Keira stuttered,'... such a bomb is real." Airblast starred at her; horrifyed. "Are you saying that such a weapon of major destruction really excits! Surely, it doesn't cause cancer?" he said. "I'm affraid it does,' Keira said,' It was the weapon which ended World War II, a war which took 60 million lives."

Airblast didn't say anything for the rest of the time before he fell asleep. Keira's history lesson had caused him depression. The next morning; however, Airblast woke Keira up, telling her it was time to go. "I'm so hungry,' Keira moaned. "So am I,' replied Airblast,' but it sure would be a miracle if we found anything decent to eat here, there's nothing, but rock, rock, rock, rock. The weather is starting to get colder too." Keira realized she was cold herself. "I can't continue without any clothes!' she said. "That is true, you humans are so unresistant, but there really isn't anything for you to wear. I'm sure you'll make it. You are strong." As they continued up, it started snowing. Airblast covered Keira with his wings, hoping she would stay warm. Behind a corner they came up with...
1312321221.title: Rest

1312322.content:
Realizing that her friend was in no condition to climb a mountain, Keira heads west toward the swamp.

The trail leads into a dark forest, and the visibility is poor at night. She hopes that Airblast will be able to navigate through the muddy terrain in his condition.

Hours later, exhausted from hiking though waist deep mud, Keira finally finds a piece of dry land suitable to set up camp. Airblast, in his weary injured state, finds a large empty area and collapses, fast asleep.

Keira knows the wet tattered rags that remain of her clothes won't keep her warm through the night. She needs firewood, or she'll perish.

She ventures a bit away from the camp site, hoping to find some dry kindling to start a fire. Once the sleeping dragon leaves her field of vision, she regrets venturing so far off.

Her fears were not unfounded. As she leaned over to collect a pile of brush, a 4 foot tall frog jumped out of the bayou and into her path.

She had two choices: Run further into the woods, or swim to safety
1312322.title: Through the Swamp!

13123221.content:
Keira ran, and the frog hopped after her. It's tongue shot out, and caught itself on her back thigh. She fell over, and the frog started dragging her back to it's mouth. She grabbed onto the branches of a shrub, and tried to kick off the sticky amphibian tongue.

I need to make a decision, she thought. Do I keep holding on, or do I fight?
13123221.title: Run!

131232211.content:
Keira held on for dear life, for what seemed like hours. As her arms numbed, she was ready to give up hope. She closed her eyes, and prepared to leave this world, when suddenly, the pulling sensation stopped. The tongue had gone limp.

She opened her eyes, and saw that the tongue led to a flattened frog, under the talon of her protector, Airblast.

She smiled, and then collapsed into a deep sleep. Airblast lit a fire with his breath, and curled around her protectively.

They both awoke the next morning to a horrible crashing sound. Keira looked at the spooked look on Airblast's face. What could possibly scare a dragon? Keira thought.
131232211.title: Hold on!

131232212.content:
Keira let go of the shrub, determined to remove the frog's tongue from her body, else battle it until it decided better of eating her. Sliding quickly to her predator, she managed to pick up a triangular rock, and with all her strength, the slammed it into the frog's tongue.

But it did no good.

Worse, her wrists touched the adhesive tongue, and she was now stuck in a contorted position, unable to get another blow.

She struggled and struggled, but only managed to get herself more stuck. By the time she reached the frog's mouth, she was stuck in a tangled fetal position, quietly weeping. The frog globbed her up, and hopped back into the drink, hardly feeling the determined struggles of the poor girl inside.
131232212.title: Fight!

Keira jumped into the lagoon, hoping the frog wouldn't follow.

It didn't matter, as the sharp teeth of a crocodile clamped down in her midriff mere seconds as soon as she jumped in, crushing her back and dragging her under.

The frog wasn't so much looking for a meal as trying to avoid becoming one itself. Happily, Keira took his place on the croc's menu.

Krystal hid behind Williams wings and watch. All of a sudden a teenager walks out of the bushes. He's 6'0 atletic build, and is obviously carrying weapons. Screamed Krystal.

141111121.title: Defiance

1411111212.content:
Two blue paws landerd in front of Krystal blocking her escape. Looking upwards she caught a glimpse of the open maw descending upon her, before it cut out all light. Blaze pushed her head down forcing Krystal's head into her throat then, stretching her mouth she continued push her head lower, using the hanger floor to force Krystal deeper.

In a matter of minutes Blaze's lips brushed the cold, stone floor. She closed her mouth, Krystal's feet kicked against the inside of her lips, most of Krystal's body was now struggling in her throat. She raised her head and slowly tilted it till her nose was pointing straight at the ceiling, then gulped.

As she felt Blaze preparing to swallow her, Krystal's struggles turned to pleading. The swallow lasted only a fraction of a second as a ripple ran through every muscle in Blaze's neck, then she was slowly sliding down the tight oesophagus.

She could feel the powerful muscles pushing her down. She could hear Blaze licking her lips, hear the steady beating of the dragon's heart, hear the hungry groaning of the waiting stomach and, more and more, she could smell the acrid fumes of the digestive fluids below.

All too soon she was pushed from out of the throat and into Blaze's dark stomach. The heat was overpowering forcing her to pant, the air smelt of dead meat and the chemical scent of acids. She was in a sack of living flesh, mucus and acids covering the muscle, feeling around she found she could touch every inch of the stomach from where she was sitting.

She felt the stomach swinging with each step as Blaze walked back to her own sleeping area, then a sudden jerk as she lay down. The stomach gurgled ominously and the walls started to churn slightly. Above the noise she could hear Blaze yawn, sleepy, happy and full. She Pushed herself against the stomach wall “Blaze!” No response, “Blaze, please!” she begged, her terror showing in her voice.

“Finally learning some manners are we, food?” Blaze taunted.

“Please, please... don't do this” she begged. The stomach's gurgling grew louder and Krystal could feel the fluids rising around her.

Blaze groaned “Hmmmm, be quiet food” she started to massage her full stomach, and felt the digestion speed up in response. Inside Krystal began to thrash, both hoping to make Blaze sick and refusing to die without a fight. Her struggles were short-lived however, heat and lack of oxygen drover her to exhaustion and forced her to stop.

“Giving up?” Blaze licked her lips at the thought “soon you're going to be soup in my intestines, nutrients for my body.” she burped, tasting Krystal's flavour on her breath “Goodbye Krystal.”

Krystal was now struggling not to drown, rising digestive fluids and the constant churning of Blaze's stomach meant she was spending more and more time with her head beneath the fluids, and each breath she got contained less oxygen than the last. She could feel the dragons body waiting for her, wanting her.

Again she was pushed under, she struggled once more to reach the surface then realised that this time she wasn't going to make it. She kicked weakly a few more times before passing out.

Blaze lay, curled around her full belly, after a few minutes she started to snore.
