"Umm ... "W-William?" she asked before she screamed when his jaws started to work there way around her body. She screamed and wiggled around helplessly in the wet, tight mouth. Her head pressed and squeezed in to the tight throat soon followed by her shoulders and chest making a nice lump. The Manticore let out a murr as it enjoyed it's human meal wiggling downwards.

Krystal was in deep water as her new found friend got it's maw down over her tummy and clamped it's jaws around her torso. "No stop it!" she called struggling harder in the flesh but soon she was pressed right in to the stomach of the lion type creature. With a slurp and hard gulp William sucked her legs down like noodles and let her slide right in to the pits of his belly. he murred laying down to enjoy Krystal's squirmish body.

She yelled and cried trying to get someone to help her but it was just no good. The tin air and hot stomach started to take it's toll on her. "Some body..... h-help..." she whispered soon blacking out.

~Sometime later~

Krystal groaned as She started to wake up her body shifting and moving all around and it was hot .... wet and very cramped. 'where am I....' she thought shifting around softly.
14121.title: Dinni and dash

141211.content:
Krystal wakes up to find that she is still in the cramped area of Williams stomach. Krystal starts to call for help, but suddenly stops when she hears the faint murmer of a silent conversation on the outside world.

Suddenly, the maw of the lion type creature opened up, and a stream of light beamed down on her. She saw a dark figure block the sunlight, and a hand slowly grabbed her thigh and pulled her out of William.

Krystals eyes adjust to the light and she is staring at......
141211.title: Krystal is still in the stomach unharmed

1412111.content:
Instinctively, Krystal backed away from the large red dragon before her, bumping into William. To her dismay, he responded by gently nudging her forward.

"Hey! What are you doing?"

William nodded towards the dragon, and Krystal carefully looked up to meet its gaze.

For a moment, neither of them budged, giving Krystal a chance to look the beast over. She guessed it to be about 12 feet tall, as well as around 25 feet from head to tail. Between the horns on its head sprouted a dark purple mane that flowed gracefully down its serpentine neck. Bumpy ridges continued past the dragon's folded wings and along its back all the way down to its arrowhead-tipped tail. Each claw on its three-toed feet was at least the length of her hand, and its glistening teeth were of a similar size.

And when those teeth began to part, Krystal finally lost her nerve. She dropped to the ground and closed her eyes, terrified from the anticipation of those fangs digging into her well-toned skin.

But, instead, the dragon spoke.

"I suppose it would only be polite for me to say 'hello,' wouldn’t it?"

Krystal blinked. The dragon's voice was clearly feminine, not to mention somewhat calming in spite of its sarcastic tone.

"By the way, my name's Veluur."

Slowly, Krystal lifted her head back up and dared to answer. "…Um, hello to you, too, I guess…"

"Oh, come now, little one!" Veluur said brightly, sitting down and lowering her head to Krystal's level. "There's no reason to be frightened. I'm one of the friendly dragons; trust me! I wouldn't harm a fly!"

Krystal narrowed her eyes.

"What, you don't take this dragoness at her word?"

Krystal shot to her feet. "Are you kidding me?" she exclaimed, clenching her fists. "You expect me to TRUST you? In the little time I've been on this freaking island, I've been treated as nothing more than someone's lunch! First it was one giant snake, then a second giant snake, then this manticore here – who I thought was my friend after he saved me from the snakes – turned on me and ate me himself!"

"And yet you're still alive, aren't you?"

"What does..." Krystal's intended response suddenly caught in her throat. "Wait...um, I..."

Veluur chuckled. "I think you need not worry about William's loyalty, young Krystal. I know all about your unfortunate escapade this morning, what with my mind-reading and all that. It sounds as though you'd wandered into a python breeding ground, and your manticore friend felt that using his gut as a temporary human storage chamber was the best course of action to bring you here safely."

"Hmph. Maybe." Krystal suddenly realized she hadn't bothered to examine her surroundings. "So where exactly is 'here,' anyway?"
1412111.title: Krystal Meets Veluur

14121111.content:
Krystal took a moment to examine the grand chamber around them. The room was built in a perfect circle, with support beams arching up to the peak of the domed ceiling high overhead. Glowing plates were strategically placed around the walls to bathe the entire chamber in a golden light. Only a passage exiting the room on the opposite end was too dim for Krystal to see into. Set along the outer edge of the room were six hexagonal platforms, which circled around a small pedestal that presented a shimmering, cloud-white orb.

"Welcome to my home," Veluur said with a smile. "Although you might be more intrigued to know this is also the Temple of Souls, and it is here where you can become the Queen of Dragons."

Krystal's eyes widened. "Wait, what?"

Veluur chuckled. "I thought that might get your attention. See that orb there?" She nodded towards the pedestal in the center. "Go and touch it, unless you still don't think I'm trustworthy."

Krystal frowned as she looked at the orb. It didn't look to be anything special. Granted, it didn't seem to be dangerous, either, so maybe Veluur wasn't trying to trick her. Maybe.

Slowly, Krystal advanced to the pedestal. From a closer angle, the orb perched on top looked to be made of clear glass, with the white color coming from a smoky wisp that filled the entire orb. She gingerly reached her hand out, with a single finger extended.

The instant she touched the glass, a massive jolt shot through Krystal's finger and into the rest of her body. She hunched over, her knees buckled, and tried to pull away, but found that her finger was stuck to the orb. As the shock flowed through more of her muscles, Krystal feared that the pain would rip her body to shreds.

The jolt cut off as quickly as it had started, and Krystal's finger was finally released from the orb. Looking herself over, Krystal couldn't see any obvious changes, and yet, she still felt different, like something had entered and filled her body.

"...What...happened to me?"

Veluur approached her. "The same thing that happens to every girl who touches the orb, of course. You see, that orb is filled with draconic magic in its purest form. By touching it, some of that magic flowed into your body and merged with your spirit, allowing you to use a little of our magic yourself. Good thing, too, because without that magic, you wouldn't be able to continue your quest to become Queen of Dragons."

"You mean there's more? I thought you said the orb would make me the queen!"

The red dragoness burst into laughter. "Oh, goodness, no! What I said was that you'd become the queen inside this temple. The magic orb was only step one."

"Oh. So what's step two?"

Veluur's comical tone suddenly vanished. "Well, I'll tell you." She crouched down so that their heads were only a few feet apart. "But first, I must ask you something, Krystal. Are you willing to humble yourself, swallow your pride, or risk your very life, even, for the sake of having a chance at success?"

Krystal was taken aback. "Um...well, if that's what it takes, then I suppose so."

"You better be, little one. Because you aren't going to like step two."

"And why's that?"
14121111.title: The Temple of Souls

choices: "Place your hands on my stomach walls."
141211111.content:
"Wait, what-"

But Veluur didn't wait for Krystal to object. Her tongue shot out and wrapped itself around Krystal's arm, then pulled the girl into her open jaws. The dragoness flicked her head, tossing Krystal further into the mouth so that only her limbs remained outside. As she stood up, Veluur gave Krystal's body a couple of quick licks, adding to her extreme displeasure, which she made clear by flailing her arms and legs for all she was worth.

Not wanting Krystal to accidentally hurt herself on the sharp teeth, Veluur lifted her tongue to drop the girl's head and shoulders into her throat. This brought her limbs inside Veluur's jaws, allowing her to safely shut her mouth. Rather than waste any more time, the red dragoness raised her head skyward. A few swallows later, and Krystal was on a trip down her esophagus.

Krystal winced as she was squeezed through an opening and forced into the stomach. She felt the chamber stretch to accommodate her, and she ultimately ended up curled into a ball with very little room to maneuver. To make matters worse, her limited air supply carried the foul stench of rotten meat, making it difficult to breathe.

Nevertheless, as terrified and cramped as she was, Krystal immediately began punching and kicking as much as the stomach walls allowed her to. She was going to get out of here, no matter what it took.

Then Veluur's voice sounded from above her. "Krystal! Please, you need to calm down!"

"Calm down?!" Krystal screamed. "After you ATE me?"

"Yes, your alarm is understandable. However, this is the only way to activate the magic you've been granted. Your magic allows you to enhance my very essence, but it can only be done while you're inside my body. I didn't make up the rules. Believe me, I don't like this any more than you do."

"Liar! You were tasting me before you swallowed me! Don't think I didn't notice!"

"...Well, okay. You got me there. But, honestly, this is for your own good. This way, you can practice your magic in a safe environment, where failure doesn't lead to digestion."

"This is the exact opposite of a safe environment!"

"Krystal, in order for this to work, you're going to have to trust me. Your magic won't work while you're frenzied or angry. Take it easy. Relax."

Krystal briefly paused to weigh her options, then eased up her muscles as she used the breathing techniques she'd picked up from high school track to calm herself down.

"Thank you," Veluur spoke. "Now, for the magical part."
141211111.title: Down the Hatch!

1412111111.content:
"Empty your mind of any and all thoughts. Allow your mind, body, and soul to rest. Your magic will work on its own, once you're ready."

"Okay...how will I know when it's working?"

"Oh, you'll know, little one. It's subtle at first, but by the time the process is complete, it's the best feeling in the world!"

Reassured, Krystal relaxed and waited for any sign that the enhancement magic was about to kick in. As the minutes dragged on, she even found the stomach to be somewhat cozy, much to her surprise.

In the meantime, Veluur looked over to William. "Many thanks, my friend," she sighed. "Consider your debt paid in full."

The manticore nodded and curled up near the door, intending to sleep off the python he'd eaten when he saved Krystal.

Licking her lips, Veluur lay down, as well. She turned her head so she could admire the lump in her gut that was Krystal.

"All right, my darling," she whispered. "Let's make some magic happen!"

Inside, Krystal could feel the walls around her begin to tickle. At the same time, she noticed something else, as if the magical energy filling her body was starting to leave.

"Hey! I think it's working!" As quickly as the energy left her, it was replaced by excitement as she awaited the moment when she'd finally get out of the dragoness's belly.

In fact, it seemed as though the magical energy was collecting immediately above her, causing the stomach to stretch out even more. Soon, the final trace of it seeped out of her body, and, just as Veluur had said, Krystal felt nothing but immense pleasure.

"Well, Veluur?"

"Any second now, sweetie. Any second..."

Suddenly, the energy above her solidified, and Krystal found herself squeezed underneath this new mass, whose extra weight made the stomach sag further. "Oomph!"

Once again, the stomach was tight and cramped, and she could barely maneuver herself. Whatever had become of the mass of magical energy, it was oddly soft to the touch. Struggling, she reached one of her arms up to identify what this thing was. To her utter surprise, her fingers wrapped around what seemed to be...another arm?

"What's going on here?" Krystal shouted.

It was her fellow occupant who answered. "I could ask you the same thing!"

Krystal's eyes widened. It had spoken in her voice!

Now fear began to set in. She continued to move her hand around to identify more features. A hand, a boob, some hair, a face...

It was in that moment when Krystal noticed she still felt the tickle from before. But the magic process was already over, and even her euphoric bliss had faded. That tickle wasn't coming from her. In fact, it had since become more of a tingling sensation, which was now starting to burn.

"Veluur?! ...VELUUR!!"

The red dragoness watched as the bulge in her stomach, now twice as full as before, began squirming wildly. A smile formed on her lips, and she let out a sigh of pure content. Nothing in the world could match the feeling of live prey struggling inside her!

Ages ago, Veluur had used some illusion spells to make her cave appear to be an ancient temple, just for the purpose of luring humans into her den and into her maw. Later, she got the idea to have her unsuspecting prey touch an orb that filled them with magical energy, which she could manipulate with her own magic to create a perfect clone, meaning she could have two meals for the price of one. Some called it being lazy; she called it being creative.

But even then, there was no guarantee that the humans would find her cave. To compensate, Veluur would occasionally make a deal with one of her fellow island-dwellers, where she would do a favor for them as long as they brought her the next human they found. The manticore had wanted help driving a nest of pythons from his home, and she had been happy to oblige.

A sharp kick in her abdomen snapped Veluur out of her thoughts, followed by some colorful language emanating from within. The dragoness shook her head and chuckled. Why did they always believe that she would release them from her stomach? The foolishness of humans never ceased to amaze her.

Veluur slowly rubbed her distorted belly, relishing the feeling of her prey squirming inside her and ignoring their muffled pleas. Eventually, she let out a yawn, laid her head down, and began to doze off, allowing her stomach to begin the work of claiming its prize.
1412111111.title: Magically Delicious

1412111112.content:
"Press the palms of your hands against my stomach walls."

Krystal uncurled her fists and followed the dragoness's instructions.

"Good. Now, concentrate on me. Think of nothing except for the lovely dragoness surrounding you. Picture my body, my scales, my wings, my teeth..."

Krystal had no trouble forming an image of Veluur in her mind. "Now what?"

"Now the process gets tricky. You need to take that mental image of me and imagine it growing larger."

"Really? That doesn't sound hard at all."

"Keep concentrating, Krystal. It's vital that you don't lose that mental image or let your hands go during the enhancement process."

Closing her eyes, Krystal shut out all her other thoughts and focused on the picture of Veluur. She imagined the dragoness increasing in size, as if struck by a mad scientist's growth ray.

As she did so, she felt the stomach around her give a slight shake. "Veluur?"

"Focus, Krystal! Do not break your concentration!"

Krystal tried her best, but the stomach's movements only increased in frequency and energy. Finally, she felt the dragoness's entire body slam down into the floor, tumbling her about and forcing her hands off.

Immediately, everything settled down around her, other than a barely noticeable rhythmic motion.

"Phew..." Veluur gasped. "I...I'm sorry, Krystal. It's been...quite some time since the last candidate came along...so I guess...I'd forgotten how painful this is."

Krystal realized the rhythmic motion was, in fact, Veluur panting. "Wait. I was hurting you?"

"Yes. An unfortunate consequence...of the enhancement. It's...not unlike what you felt...when you touched the orb. Don't worry...I'm quite fine now."

"So, did it work?"

"Unfortunately...no. You have to keep it up for ten seconds...at minimum. Otherwise...my essence returns to normal...and you have to start over."

"No wonder you said this would be tricky."

"Indeed...and this is only the practice round. You'll have to enhance the essence...of other creatures, too. And when you're trying this in the belly of a satisfied predator...well, it goes without saying that you're operating on a very strict time limit. Okay...I'm ready now. Try again."

This time, Krystal tried to brace her head and feet to minimize her chances of being bumped around. She pressed her hands against the stomach walls and began picturing Veluur growing massive again. The stomach quickly resumed its shaking as the dragoness struggled to contain the pain, but Krystal was determined not to be thwarted a second time.

"That's it, Krystal. That's it! Keep going. Keep making me bigger! As large as you can think! Taller than the trees! Higher than the mountains!"

Despite the stomach's violent shaking, Krystal maintained her focus, and suddenly, what felt like a shockwave burst from her hands. Simultaneously, the stomach squeezed and forced her out. The next thing Krystal knew, she had been expelled from Veluur's mouth. William bounded over and happily began licking her clean.

"Excellent," groaned Veluur, who was once again lying on the floor in pain. "Welcome back to the outside world, my friend."

Krystal couldn't help but give a smirk. "So what's next?"

"Now we must touch the orb together."

Veluur reached out with one of her paws to the orb, stretching so she wouldn't have to stand up. Krystal did likewise. As they connected with the orb, another intense shock blasted both of them, though not nearly as powerful as the shock Krystal experienced before.

Within seconds, the shock cut off. Veluur now stood up proudly, all traces of her suffering having vanished. "There. Now your magic is back to full power, and my essence is back to normal. It's as if I never gobbled you up."

"What? Why would you undo everything we just did?"

"Because your magic is limited to six uses. After your successful practice round inside me, you were down to five. Fortunately, by us touching the orb simultaneously, the enhancement is reversed, and you're back up to six uses. I need six enhanced essences to turn you into the Queen of Dragons, but because I'll be the one conducting the ritual, I unfortunately can't use my own essence."

"Hold on. Are you saying I have to be eaten SIX more times?!"

"You say that like you're going to chicken out on me."

"Of course not! It's just...what if some dragon decides to keep me inside and digest me even after I do the enhancement thing?"

"You saw how miserable I was, right? No living thing can tolerate having its essence blown way out of proportion like that. Believe me, after those ten seconds, the pain will be so unbearable that they'll immediately dislodge you from their gut in order to put a stop to it. With the enhancement process completed, all that extra essence will also exit their body, rather than shrink back to normal."

"And I'm supposed to trust that they won't try to eat me again?"

"Hah! They wouldn't try again even if you begged them to! A nifty side-effect of your magic conditions their brains to disregard you as prey, and even prompts them to drop whatever they were doing and proceed directly to this temple, where they'll await your return. So, as long as you manage to finish the enhancement, you are quite safe from their appetite."

"But what's the point? What does enhancing their essence have to do with me becoming queen?"

"You think you can become Queen of Dragons and remain a human? What's to stop some random dragon from devouring you and bragging to all his friends that the almighty queen was now digesting in his belly?" Veluur shook her head. "No; the only way you can become Queen of Dragons is to first become a dragon yourself. As a sorceress, I know the spells necessary to transform you. But to do so, I need to infuse your body with the essences of six other creatures."

"Could you at least be more specific about these six creatures?"

"There's not much need to get more specific. Any six will do, with only one condition."
1412111112.title: Enhancing Veluur's Essence

14121111121.content:
"You must enhance the essence of six dragons. They can be any type of dragon, including hybrids."

"So, basically, I just have to go around and find six hungry dragons. Shouldn't be too hard."

"And only six. Once your enhancement magic is used up, you'd better not end up on anyone else's menu, unless you think you can convince them to spit up such a scrumptious meal."

"Right, I'll try to keep that in mind..."

"One last thing: the enhancement magic only works on dragons. Nothing else. So if you find yourself swallowed by another snake or something...well, it was nice meeting you, Krystal."

Krystal shivered. "Um, yeah. You too." She beckoned to William. "All right, big guy, I guess we should be on our way."

As they departed from the temple, Krystal pondered over everything she'd been told. What a crazy system these dragons have in place for becoming their queen! Clearly they only want a leader who's humble enough to put her own life on the line!

Outside, she glanced around at the unfamiliar terrain. Not that she expected to know where she was, since William had brought her here safely inside his belly.

"Well, William, you know this place better than I do. Where should we start our search for hungry dragons?"
14121111121.title: Dragon x6

14121111122.content:
"You must enhance the essence of six different animals that live on this island. Dragon, gryphon, alligator...even your manticore friend there. As long as they aren't the same species, they are fair game for your enhancement magic."

"What if they're extremely similar, like a python and an anaconda?"

"Those are okay. You'd also be able to use your magic on, say, both a dragon and a wyvern, or an alligator and a crocodile. However, I'd advise you to play it safe and stick to creatures who are quite obviously different species. If you mess up and get eaten by the same species twice, your magic will fail to activate, and you'd become nothing more than an extra layer of fat on somebody's gut."

"How lovely."

"And once you've used up all your magic, you'd best return here without being eaten again, or else all your efforts will be wasted."

"That's for sure. Well, I think I'm ready to start. Wish me luck?"

"If I believed in it, maybe."

"Heh. Okay, William, let's get going."

As they exited the temple, Krystal took a moment to consider the task she'd been given. Having to be eaten over and over again? Clearly these dragons only want a queen who's brave enough to take on an army of predators and live to tell about it!

Outside, a thought occurred to her. "Say, William. Seeing as how I have to find six different animals, would you be okay with me enhancing your essence for the ritual? I know you saw how painful it is, but would you be willing to do it, for me?"

After some consideration, William slowly nodded his head, and then began to open his mouth.

"Oh, I'm not saying we do it right now. I was thinking later on...unless..."

She weighed the costs and benefits. On one hand, letting William eat her now would give her another chance to practice without the threat of being digested. However, he'd then have to stay behind, forcing her to venture into the wilderness alone. On the other hand, having William eat her at the end meant he would be around to help her out of any bad situations. However, the fauna of the island might be less willing to gulp her down if they saw a dangerous manticore at her side.

This decision could potentially make or break her quest before it even began!
14121111122.title: Species Diversity

choices: Because I need your help, future queen of the dragons
1412112.content:
Krystal stared at the hybrid dragon, not knowing what to say. She looked back to see William unharmed, and grinning at her, if a lion thing could grin.

"Kinda creepy, huh?"

Krystal jumped at the sound of his voice, he didn't expect dragons could talk. All Krystal could reply with is, "You can talk?"

"Of course I can, my name is Richard. And William there is" Richard chuckles "Is what you can call my delivery boy."

Krystal looked away from Richard, his half human form is on the top part of his body, but it is still scaly. Wings sticking out of his arms, and claws for hands. The bottem part of his body was a full silver dragon, all scales silver. Krystal
suddenly realized that she wasn't wearing any clothes and her womanhood was showing.

"So why did you want me here?" She asked bodly.
1412112.title: A Hybrid Dragon?

14122.content:
William gave Krystal a disinterested look and walked away. He was already full and clearly this human girl was going to be more trouble than she was worth.

Krystal screamed and struggled but the python held her firm against the tree, until she finally tired and ceased struggling.

The snake flicked its forked tongue over Krystal, sampling her taste, until it opened its mouth and took her feet inside of it. Krystal struggled a little bit, but was still far to weak to resist the snake.

As the python worked its way up to her shins and knees she noticed the inside of the python felt strangely comfortable, and she reflected on her fate as the snake slowly worked its way up her body.

Soon the python's mouth reached her waist, and as it passed her womanhood the snake's tongue flicked sensuously over and inside of it, and Krystal ceased resisting entirely. She knew that soon her body would be broken down and become part of the python's body, and her spirit would go on to the afterlife, there was nothing she could do about it, and the inside of the snake was tight, but still cozy in an odd way.

The python soon had Krystal inside her all the way to her breasts. Krystal had always been proud of her breasts, they were large and firm, and she knew they would provide much nourishment for the python.

And, about an hour after the experience began, it ended as the snake reached Krystal's head, and it forced its mouth up an over the back of her head, shutting its mouth over her eyes, and a few seconds later nothing remained of Krystal save a large lump in the python.

Inside the python, Krystal felt her body begin to dissolve. She moaned in delight at its deadly warm feeling, feeling only a gently building ecstasy until she passed out some time later as her body turned to mush.

The python lay there until it felt a bit more comfortable, and then, greatly engorged, slithered off to sleep off its latest meal. It would need to eat again for at least a month.
14122.title: Snakes Again!

142.content:
The dragon yawned, and lay down for a nap, it had obviously wanted her for its dinner, but first come, first serve. Krystal's stomach dropped, she moaned, "No! Please, you have to help me!!!" All too soon, the python's mouth reached her chin and the back of her neck, tears were pouring out of Krystal's eyes, she knew she was dead. Very quickly, the python swallowed her up and sent her to its stomach, where the powerful acids went to work on her body. She screamed and kicked and flailed, but to no avail. Finally, she passed out, and her body was reduced to mush, and all her nutrients were absorbed into the python.

The dragon spirit sighed, "Oh well, I told her to be careful. Now she pays the price. Farewell young one."
142.title: Bye-bye Krystal

143.content:
The strange lion-like dragon seems to understand and quickly comes to her aid. It gently pulls Kyrstal free from the python's coils and set her to the side. To Kyrstal's shock it then proceeded to swallow down the python. Then it turned to face her, a look of voracious hunger on its face.

It leapt at her, pinning her to the ground. It had her in a very compromising position at this point and could have done any number of things to her, however it simply wanted a meal. Being of considerably greater size than her he chose the simple solution. Using his long tail to wrap around her mid section he lifted her up above his head, slowly lowering her into his waiting jaws.

Moments later all that could be seen of her was a wiggling lump inside the dragon and soon after not even that. The dragon, now quite content, laid down in the sun, taking a nap while his latest meal digested.
143.title: Sometimes a thank you isn't enough

info.brief_description: Choose the fate of 4 young women as they are stranded on an island filled with dragons!
info.description:
A plane with four young women (ages 18-21) is struck by a meteor, and thus explodes. Next morning, all four girls, clothes torn to shreads, wash up on an island filled with dragons of all sorts. But not just dragons that inhabit this island, but other carnivorous creatures, such as carnivorous plants, snakes, and more. The girls are: Kyrstal the athletic girl, June the bookworm, Amelia the treasure hunter, and Keira the rocket mechanic. They must befriend at least 1 dragon in order to survive.

Choose one of them and guide them through horrors beyond imagination. It is up to you if they live or die. You decide if they get eaten or become Queen of Dragons. Oh, and better get them some new clothes while your at it, if you want.

A few things: No blood or gore, just soft vore, and if they do get eaten, no chewing or vomiting. And when it comes to sexual moments, no lesbian, or animal sex. The most I will allow is maybe some humanoid male is on the island seduces them, and that when they are being eaten, tongues on the breasts, vagina, etc are allowed. If you don't do this, I will delete your entry.

Thank you, and enjoy.
